Reviews.Title: “Middle of town perfection”
Reviews.Author: lindsNdel Posted by a NH Hoteles traveler
Reviews.Content: I loved the hotel to bits. Everything from the lobby, the room and the location. I would recommend this hotel to anyone, it's a five minute walk to Dam Square. The room had a superking bed, loved by my six feet two inch boyfriend! Bathroom was my favourite. The room was cleaned everyday to a high standard leaving a wee sweetie on my pillow. We watched a movie while there, and for the extra charge it was worth it. really enjoyer my hotel experience.

Reviews.Title: “It is a nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Miller B
Reviews.Content: I've traveled a lot and came across many hotels, but this one suite my need the most. I booked through http://www.jollyhotelcarlton.nl1.biz with discount rate.

Reviews.Title: “4 days at Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Hugo F Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Very good location everything accessible on foot, but the business rooms are very noisy due to being close to the street and reception.You can ear everyone.....

Reviews.Title: “nice location”
Reviews.Author: Roxanne N
Reviews.Content: We went on a girls trip, and found this hotel very central. The hotel is like 3 minutes away from some of the most fabolous nightclubs, and 2 minutes away from the shopping street. The rooms was clean and the staff was quite helpful. We enjoyd our stay, and we'll definitely stay here again. XOXO. Oslo

Reviews.Title: “Everything has remained the same as 14 years ago”
Reviews.Author: anselmodapadova
Reviews.Content: Same small and dusty rooms, monumental televisions, bathrooms with bathtubs and anti-hygienic curtains. Maybe in 1998 this situation was OK, but now it's not in compliance with a four stars hotel. Prices are very high: for two nights and 1 person (double for single use) I paid more than 310 Euro, including breakfast an in-room wi-fi (you have to pay for both these last services). The Restaurant Caruso (one of the best Italian restaurants in Northern Europe) has been closed and the launch restaurant just prepares frozen foods.The reception staff sometime is not so polite and friendly (especially the Managers).

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: STARKEY
Reviews.Content: The carlton is in a good position next to the flower market.We had a lovely welcome from reception staff and all other staff we encountered were equally good.Our room was on the 4th floor and was clean and comfortable and had bath and shower.The chairs in the room were suffering from wear and tear but not a major problem.A good buffet breakfast with plenty choice.The hotel is a short walk to Spuistratt which has a choice of bars and restaurants.We particularly liked Luden.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, saw no sign of the problems experinced by others.”
Reviews.Author: Steven H
Reviews.Content: Myself and partner have just stayed at the NH Carlton, for two nights, March 17/18 2011. We never really use hotel eating and drinking facilities, so I will ignore these in my review. Firstly check-in. We met very polite and capable staff, who allowed our security deposit to be paid in cash. No hassle here. The Room; It was the 7th floor, room 719. As others have said, the mini bar was empty. No loss to me. It worked as a fridge, and as such we could fill it with our own cheaply bought soda, fruit and water. I thought the room was fantastic because of the balcony. This more than made up for the 'worn' carpets!! Bed sheets were spotless, as was the bathroom. Old CRT tv in the room, but we go to Amsterdam to relax and have fun, not watch TV. Check-out was fast and easy. Full marks NH Carlton and thankyou for a lovely stay. See you again next month hopefully.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but expect 2* not 4*”
Reviews.Author: L_G82
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is the main selling point, within walking distance of many of the main sights and lots of bars and resturants close by. If you go expecting 2* accomodation its fine, but the standard of the room we had was nowhere near what you would expect for a 4* hotel. Also if you pay the local tax in advance make sure you get a reciept, as they would not believe us on checking out we paid this on arrival! Room was clean enough and bathroom was fine but the decor and quality of furnature was pretty poor, and although we specifically requested a double we still were given 2 singles pushed together with 2 single duvets. The first hotel I have stayed at for a very long time which still had the old fashioned crt style TV!

Reviews.Title: “Great location to stay”
Reviews.Author: Josstein
Reviews.Content: This hotel is at a walking distance from all the happening places of Amsterdam. The rooms are nice and clean. The serivce staff is great. Good value for your money. The best thing is that you can walk down to all the places you want to be and come back for rest. Great location. Jollly hotel is surrounded by many reputed restaurants and night life locations. Great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “A very good hotel”
Reviews.Content: very near to the flower market, near to the Dam Square and I think it is a nice place to stay, because it is a landmark and it is convinient to explore amsterdam

Reviews.Title: “A handy base for Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: AOBC
Reviews.Content: The NH Carlton is a very convenient base for exploring Amsterdam. It is only one canal down from Dam square and comfortable walking distance from all the main sights of the city. The staff are very friendly and helpful and greeted us cordially when we arrived. The receptionist told us that she had a lovely room for us at the front of the hotel, looking out onto the street. However, she added that the bed was two pushed together rather than the double we had requested. Now the problem with this is that we have found that someone always ends up sleeping on the crack!!! So we asked if she could find us a double. She very obligingly arranged this. The room we got was now on the 7th floor (fast lifts, so fine there) and it looked out onto the back of the hotel. The room was small but perfectly adequate for a weekend break. It also had a small balcony which would have been lovely on a summer day, but rather redundant in February. This balcony could have done with a hosing down as it was a bit mossy from winter, but again probably something for the summer season. The fact that the room was at the rear was actually a good thing as the tram runs directly out-side the front door, so sleep was better at the back. We didn't take breakfast as we considered it somewhat expensive at 15 euro per person, particularly as my husband, who is a coeliac has to bring his own cereals and breads anyway. We found a lovely little cafe nearby which provided what we needed. At check out the desk staff were happy to do airline check in and print off boarding passes. I would certainly consider staying in this hotel on a return trip to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Great for Central Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Pick1962
Reviews.Content: We have stayed four times at this hotel. We both love Amsterdam, and this hotel is brilliantly located. It is a kilometer from Central Station, the trams stop 100 mts either side of the entrance, the Flower Market is literally around the corner, the Red Light district a short stroll through excellent restuarant and bar areas, and Dam Square is a half kilometer back towards Central Station. The hotel is on the route for tram numbers 4-16-24 and 25 - buy an unlimited travel ticket from Tourist Information (GVB ) situated opposite Central Station (mind the ongoing Metro works). These tickets are available elsewhere, but this office can provide you with all the information you need for your stay - these lines also take you to the Museums, the Markets, Anne Frank House, and the Westerkirk. Vitually all other trams can be caught in and around Dam Square. The Hotel itself is four-star. However, apart from the Bed and the Bathroom, we rarely make use of the facilities, as we always stay on a room only basis. The hotel has an excellent coffee shop, and late check-out can be arranged where possible. Amentities within easy walking distance are excellent restaurants (hence room only basis for us - Breakfast at the Nieuwe Kerk (New Church) in Dam Square is brilliant); the central canals. and major shopping areas. We went here as a couple, but it would be equally good for friends, familiy and solo. It is frequented by business people, but the business facilities are not brilliant e.g. the internet is a bit of a nightmare. However, we go to shut ourselves off from the rest of the world and enjoy the brilliant amenities that Amsterdam has to offer, whether it be sitting with coffee in a square or a bottle of wine by a canal and watching the world go by; checking out bustling markets, and quiet museums; eating in fine restaurants or simply window shopping. Needless to say we are going again later this year.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: pseisog
Reviews.Content: Even if it's a bit further from central railway station (about 20 minutes walk) it really worth the effort. It's in the middle of everything : museum area on one hand and classical amsterdam attractions like red light district on the other. It's clean and staff very helpful. Breakfast is also very good and is served until late in the morning. Be prepared to ask for room in the front side of the hotel though !!! Rooms (standard rooms) are rather small but ok keeping in mind what you can find in other hotels (with no windows, dirty etc.). It's only 200 meters away from Dam square. Other attractions (like icebar etc) are just 2 blocks away. It's also too close to many fast foods and other stores and restaurants. Also try their massage chairs !!! The best you can have after a long day in the streets !!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: JulieHFM
Reviews.Content: (+ means 'like', - means 'not like', = means 'average') ++ great location in the centre of amsterdam + goods beds + breakfast + value for money (breakfast included) + space in bathroom = cleanliness = staff - shower in bath

Reviews.Title: “Good location and thats all”
Reviews.Author: burburmody
Reviews.Content: if Ä° travel back to Amsterdam again, Ä° would not stay here . We were there with friends and all work in tourism business. My friend chose here because they had nice photos of the bath rooms and rooms looked big and clean. Location wise it is very good but thats all. Wi fi is not free and you need to reconnect every half hr even from the loby where it is free. House keeping is bad, our bed was made every day but our pijamas were tucked in to the corners w/out being folded. Balcony was full with cigarette filters. Ä°t is expencive for all these bad services.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, great location!”
Reviews.Author: marchelle2321
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely hotel, with very elegant rooms and decor. Staff were very friendly and helpful and the location is great for getting around. Would highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Why”
Reviews.Author: claytoncast
Reviews.Content: I,ve been staying in this hotel three or four times a year on business for four years or so now. My client in Amsterdam books it. They pay a hefty corporate rate if â‚¬200 or so night and I have never checked in here without a problem. They lose reservations. They always try to put you in the worst room available. I've resisted the temptation t review it as its not a hotel I would choose despite it's excellent central location. However checking in tonight I have had enough. This evening they had lost my reservation despite it having been guaranteed with a credit card this morning. The client had booked a superior room. I was shown to a cupboard on the third floor. On saying I was not pleased I was moved to another room.which is perfectly pleasant and roomy on the same floor, but why did I have to complain to get a decent room. Who we they saving this one for? It seems that being a regular customer counts for nothing. They swipe your card but I don't know why as the mini bar is empty. Internet is free in the oh but charged at a hefty rate in the rooms. Get your act together. If you're a business hotel charging premium corporate rates then Internet should be free. It'es a deal breaker when I book a hotel myself. I will try and advise my client to book a different hotel but it's difficult. I suppose I'll just have to go on complaining about rooms in order to get a decent one, praying that they haven't lost my reservation in the first place, and hoping against hope that being a regularly visitor starts to count for something. There are loads of good business hotels in Amsterdam with god services, up to date decor and a warm welcome. The NH Carlton I'm afraid isn't one of them.

Reviews.Title: “great stay”
Reviews.Author: jaffar71
Reviews.Content: arrived at the hotel at 10am but could not check in til as the room was not ready. they did let us leave our bags in storage whilst we went off to have a look around. We checked back in at 3pm and was given quite a small room but very clean and modern. We asked to be moved and they kidly moved us the following day, to a much larger room with 2 balconies and a great view. They upgraded my friends room to a suite as it was his 40th. They hotle is 20mins walk from the station or 2.50 euro on the tram. very easy to find as its a straight road down from the station walking through Dam Sq. Dam sq is 10mins walk and the flower market is right outside the hotel. The red light district is 10mins walk. Beer is 5-6 euro pint and for those that smoke is 15-20 euro per gram bag.

Reviews.Title: “a safe bet - well located, average 3 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: MattFS
Reviews.Content: The NH Carlton is a large, reasonable standard chain hotel that is well located for reaching all Amsterdam`s attractions, many within walking distance. Our room was fairly small but adequate, as was the bathroom which came with complimentary shampoos and shower creams. I had asked for a room with a balcony, and was pleased to get one with a good view over the locality; this turned out to be a double edged sword as it meant we got a lot of noise from the streets below. Although not in the very heart of the entertainment area, the hotel is near to Rembrandt Square which is a lively nightclub area and we stayed a week before Christmas â€“ although to be honest the main noise was sirens and car horns (not sure if rooms on the inside of the hotel suffer the same problem). Service was efficient, rooms and hotel generally spotless, and there is a pleasant seating area on the 1st floor. Buffet breakfast was very good; varied (with decent cooked option), as well as the customary European fare (croissants, cakes, cold meats, fruit etc) and there was plenty of tables in the spacious room. Slightly disappointing was, on returning, tired, on our first night, planning to have a quiet nightcap in the bar, only to find it closed â€“ it was only about 11.15pm. Decided to settle for the minibar (as advertised) only to find that it is not stocked unless you pre-order (and then you have to pay for everything regardless of what you use). Other than that, no complaints â€“ a bit pricey for an average 3-star hotel and having now seen some of the slightly cheaper independent options (our sons stayed elsewhere), would consider them next time. Overall, a safe bet - a well located average 3 star hotel offering a good breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “OK but tired hotel”
Reviews.Author: KristenEberlein
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for five nights on a 2-week business trip. The location was great -- on a Tram line, an easy walk to the Metro that took me to Biljmer Arena (the stop for my company's office), and right in the middle of things. My room was at the back of the hotel -- on check in, the staff did ask for my preference -- but a little too small and "tired." There was an electric kettle to make tea and a refrigerator (nice, with an Albert Heijn just around the corner), but *very* few electric outlets. I unplugged the desk lamp to make room for my lap top, and unplugged the TV so that I could use the electric kettle. The bathroom had a hair dryer, but it came apart in my hand and the sink was extremely slow to drain. Still, it had a nice electric towel bar. I think the hotel needs some refurbishing and I probably won't stay there again if I have other comparably-priced options.

Reviews.Title: “good location, delicious breakfast”
Reviews.Author: GinaG25
Reviews.Content: good location, staff friendly, room clean and tidy, breakfast has a wide variety and very tasty.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty bed sheets say no more”
Reviews.Author: AUSTUK
Reviews.Content: I had dirty bed sheets on complaining they covered stains with blanket. Dirty bad service. Avoid

Reviews.Title: “Good Time at the Jolly Carlton”
Reviews.Author: DouginCorona
Reviews.Content: Very nice Hotel, very good location, very good prices. The flower market is right out the side door. You can walk everywhere from here. Mcdonalds across the street in case you get the muchies! ha..Doug

Reviews.Title: “Good Location but Poor Value”
Reviews.Author: YorkshiremanBeverley
Reviews.Content: Our first visit to Amsterdam for my wife's birthday, we wanted a hotel within walking distance of the major attractions and this hotel certainly delivered, being situated next to the flower market. Our room was clean,situated at the rear of the hotel and had a decent bathroom,tv,mini bar and we also found a trouser press.The room was quiet, the facilities were good and the staff were all courteous and pleasant although there was a rather unpleasant smell in the downstairs lobby area..... However...the beds were 2 singles pushed together and were hard.I think the previous owner was Fred Flintstone. My wife who suffers with her back, had to put the spare blankets on top of the mattress to soften it. We stayed for 2 nights at a cost of 307 euros room only plus the local tax. This is expensive for what is being offered in my opinion and I do not put the quality of the hotel in a 4 star catagory. A Â£19 a night Travelodge would be better. Some new and comfortable beds would help bring this hotel up to standard and a general re-fit but as Amsterdam has such a large tourist population, most Hotels can fill up and charge what they like so I think the likelyhood of any improvements being made in the near future are remote whilst the money is pouring in. I have stayed in much nicer b&b's at much cheaper rates so it was a dissapointment. On the plus side, the location is good. We were able to visit all major attractions like Anne Frank house, Dam Sq.,Red Light District, Heineken Brewery and all within a short walk. Our overall experience of Amsterdam was good. Would we return again? To Amsterdam, most certainly and we plan to return again at some point but would try to find a nicer place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced not 4star”
Reviews.Author: Simon_UK_Comments
Reviews.Content: Very expensive at 170 euros / night. Hotel showing signs of its age and in need of refurbishment. Staff very friendly but always a queue at reception, 15 min wait to check out Sunday morning is in acceptable. Not worthy of 4 stars.

Reviews.Title: “excellent and quiete”
Reviews.Author: MrMaxx_jps
Reviews.Content: not the first time around in amsterdam, but first time in carlton could not have picked a better spot to stay, it is just located at the flower market and minutes away from center and the museums. with the tram right at the door step it makes it easy to get around in the city we had a view on the street and though it is a busy street there was no noise in the room and we where able to get a good rest the staff is extremaly professional and very friendly we will be back for sure on the next city break

Reviews.Title: “Avoid if you can”
Reviews.Author: Hudsuckerproxy
Reviews.Content: Old and neglected building, stained carpets, minimal service and amenities... Even if it is well positioned, it degrades your experience if you are discuisted of your room it hotel. Staff is well meaning and tries however the building needs a major remodelling ASAP! Overall, you can find better places for that price - avoid if you can.

Reviews.Title: “Very good rooms”
Reviews.Author: SUNIL50
Reviews.Content: This hotel is well located and the rooms are spacious and good. However, you are required to move your own luggage to your room and back. There is no help on this count. Otherwise the staff is helpful and smiling. It is advisable to book in advance as the walk in rates are very high depending on the demand. We had a change of room though as the air conditioner was not ok.

Reviews.Title: “Amsterdam visit”
Reviews.Author: mokum58
Reviews.Content: After a flight from Rome we arrived in the evening at our hotel. A very sweet young lady checked us in and noticed we were staying for 6 nights. "I'am going to upgrade you to a nicer room (we had booked a standard) with a GREAT VIEW." Our room was #532 and it was very nice. Looked out over the Munt square and we were serenaded by the Munt tower. The hotel's location is just fine for everything. Plenty of places for breakfast, lunch or dinner or to just sit someplace (Rembrandtplein) and enjoy a drink and people watch. One drawback; you can not use the inroom refregirator for your own articles but there is a coffeemaker that works.Even though we had typical Amsterdam weather (RAIN!!). we enjoyed our stay at the Carlton.

Reviews.Title: “Nice reception & dining & meeting areas however......”
Reviews.Author: fivesheds
Reviews.Content: The main issue was the small & dated bedroom that I had even though it was a double bedroom. Room was clean, quiet though cramped bathroom and dated decor, content. The hotel breakfast was good & meeting room facility used was very good. Expensive hotel given the cramped & dated bedroom; not sure if they are all like this though this was disappointing. The air con in the room just circulated air & did not chill the air.

Reviews.Title: “Would definately stay here again”
Reviews.Author: charashworth
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 5 nights with my partner. we loved it. Arriving in the early hours we were allowed in our room with no extra cost. staff v friendly. there is a great chill out bar directly accross the rd. located in the nicer area of amsterdam but not to far away from all main attractions. very good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: DunnartMouse
Reviews.Content: Amsterdam is an expensive city to stay in and his was reasonably priced. It is well located. The room was nice but no bar fridge for keeping our drinks cold. Wifi is downstairs and works well.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect base for the weekend”
Reviews.Author: SJB_Berks
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a perfect location for the weekend. We arrived in Amsterdam by train, and it was a 10 minute walk to the hotel with a case on wheels - otherwise cabs are easy to come by at the station. We were right by the flower market on the canals, and had great views of the city. The marvellous museums, the red-light district and all the bars and restaurants were an easy stagger from our hotel. It was a safe and clean location. Our room was small, but, hey - we weren't in it much. That said, the bed was great, the bathroom, although small, had a good, powerful shower and all the towels and linens were clean and in great condition. The balcony looked over the city giving wonderful sunrise and sunset views. The staff were friendly and helpful. We were only booked in for breakfast, but this was served in a very large and fairly opulent dining room. A huge choice of beautiful fresh foods...the usual fruits, continental style, cooked...and also many pastries and gateaux...plus a huge champagne bucket full of a lovely sparkling wines...have a glass of that each morning - don't mind if I do!!! No complaints at all, very clean throughout and I would definately go back here.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable and great location”
Reviews.Author: lincolnshiregirl76
Reviews.Content: Good location and even though on the main road very little noise. Reasonable size room and very nicely modernised bathroom. Reception staff varied but on the whole very helpful, bar staff also extremely friendly. Have stayed previously in the NH Caransa nearby which was more modern then the Carlton, but this did not have a bar or restaurant. Hotel bar/cafe leads straight out on to the flower market and there are lots of places to eat nearby. We didn't have breakfast in the hotel, ate in a lovely little cafe around the corner as it was cheaper. Able to walk to most attractions from the hotel, about 15 mins to rijksmuseum and in the other direction ann franks house. Ideal for all age groups. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “No frills, conveniently located.”
Reviews.Author: PINELights
Reviews.Content: We were probably lucky as our room was a fair bit bigger than the others we saw on the same floor. Quality of sleep was excellent and nothing really to complain about. Breakfast at EUR 20 seemed to be unnecessary as you could find plenty of breakfast for that kind of money nearby. Hotels interiour though must have been ultra modern some 30-years ago. Location was convenient enough for our purpose of visit. Three stops by tram from Central station. Next to flower market and an easy crawl back from the pubs that are in abundance in the area. Of course it is not this hotels fault, but the city of Amsterdams. Amsterdam has choosen to milk its visitors with a 5% tax on top of your grand total. That leaves one wondering if the already somewhat overpriced accomodation in Amsterdam is worth considering on another occasion. There are other nice towns in Europe that have less expensive accomodation and who do not charge you extra tax for spending your money there.

Reviews.Title: “Classy joint”
Reviews.Author: Burnstyles
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with misses for 2nights in August. Pros: Location Staff Comfort Free wifi Fridge Design Cons: Expensive if on a budget Was really impressed by the hotel aswell as the staff who were very happy to help. Bathroom has to be the best hotel bathroom I've been in from a ergonomic view, honestly the design of it was superb.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT LOCATION - BEST WE HAVE STAYED IN HERE”
Reviews.Author: akw1965
Reviews.Content: NH Carlton is very central to all things to see in Amsterdam and is right by the Flower Market and Rembrandt Square. It is clean and the room we had was good. Better than any other hotel we have stayed in in Amsterdam, and this was our 7th visit. Would go again to this hotel if the deal was right . Amsterdam itself is just fantastic and there is so much to see , do and experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great location,”
Reviews.Author: Frank T
Reviews.Content: THe hotel had a great location, staff was disorganized and appeared out of control( with one exception (Hati - who was definately with it .) Hotel room was small, offered almost no ammedities in the room, no conditioner, no bar soap, limited pillows and towels, and the bed was very unconfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Nice one, though too expensive for a trip of young people”
Reviews.Author: Kouzelna_Rybicka
Reviews.Content: We booked a twin via internet for an early booking rate, so had 25% off (i think they call it The Organiser"). We arrived at the time for check in, but they held us in the reception for about 15 minutes saying they couldnt check us in for some uknown reasons. Anyway, I asked for a free upgrade (as a member of NH) and the receptionist gave us a superior room. I wonder how the standart room looked like :-) Superior was fine, spacious and nicely decorated. I found that the tea and coffee facilities were missing, but after a call to the reception, they quickly sorted this out. There is no free english TV channel (exept news but who would like to watch the lybian invasion), no radio or music channel whatsoever. But this was not a big deal. What we found more irritating was, that the windows were sealed and couldnt be opened and the ventilation didnt supply much of good air. I found the hotel location superb. Its a half way on the line of the central station and Vondelpark. So whichever direction you go, the hotel is exacly in the centre. It had one brilliant feature too - the hotel sigh at the top tower was glowing at night, so you could see it from a distance and you could easily find the way back :-) We havent had breakfast paid, cause 18 Euro per person was a bit over the top. The staff was helpful and smiley, they speak very good Spanish too. Well I guess for young people staying only for a weekend, this hotel is not suitable. Next time I would better opt for a smaller family hotel, not a big four star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Best location, good hotel, great deal.”
Reviews.Author: lilaloTLV
Reviews.Content: Good hotel, at a great location. Just at the â€œBloomen marketâ€�. Rooms are nicer than most rooms in Amsterdam, staff were most helpful & smiling (not obvious at all in Amsterdam!), and overall experience was great. We can highly recommend this hotel, especially if you catch a great deal like we had (115 Euro per night).

Reviews.Title: “great location hotel ill use again”
Reviews.Author: monymontana
Reviews.Content: we stayed in this hotel for 2 nights in june 2011, regarding the rooms they are not very big as the rest of big cities in europe, good this it had mini fridge which was really helpful, ac wasn't working very well but the weather was ok and we really didn't complain, location is amazing the hotel is closer the the bars and clubs area than central street, let's say it's a couple of minutes walking to the clubs area and smthn like 10 minutes walking to the big square by the end of central street where Madame Tussauds is, but the walk is very enjoyable because it's all small street full of shops and snack shops so u wouldn't really feel the walking time.they also give u free wireless passes for 30 minutes each to use only in the lobby area.

Reviews.Title: “location&location&location”
Reviews.Author: Beguin
Reviews.Content: The most important thing is location. I really enjoyed at amsterdom. there is not a safetybox in the room but there is a strong room at the reception. one disappointed thing is a refrigerator. It did not work. but I don,t care. this city is fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “my 3rd stay in nh carlton!!”
Reviews.Author: DaLaL_ShaNe3a
Reviews.Content: please note that all my reviews pased on deluxe room i never booked a standard room once so i have no idea about them, the hotel manager was so kind and helpfull and gave me agood offer for adeluxe room cuz this was my 3rd long stay in nh carlton i stayed 27 night in nh carlton the room was huge and clean the location is the best all the staff was friendly and helpfull and am sure next time i will stay there thanks alot for all the staff and for the hotel manager Marcel Wijnberger.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised”
Reviews.Author: EuropeDreamer
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Carlton for one night, as part of a tour. After reading the reviews on Trip Advisor, I figured it was good to be there for only one night. The complaints about noise had me worried enough to purchase earplugs. Then, we arrived only to find that the Dutch team had won the Futbol (soccer) final; and there was "partying" galore!! I was dreading the night. So, I was surprised and happy to see that the hotel had invested in what appears to be fairly new double pane windows. With the low hum from the fan (it didn't work like air conditioning) and the new windows, we didn't hear any noise, and slept soundly. We really enjoyed our canal cruise-all the humpback bridges, houseboats, etc.

Reviews.Title: “INCREDIBLE PARTY LOCATION!! Good Hotel Overall”
Reviews.Author: WJacobs
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel with pretty helpful staff. Everyone smiles and is cordial. There's a nice lobby and restaurant on lobby level as well. Late at night the front doors are locked and you have to intercom to the front desk clerk with name and room number in order to gain access. If you're inviting "late night" guest you'll need to be prepared to provide them this information or go down and let them in yourself. :-) The hallways could use a little updating but hey, this isn't meant to be a permanent residence so it was fine. It's not dirty, it doesn't smell..it could just use some updating. I stayed in room 441. I think the air conditioner was broken so it was a bit warm a few times, but it wasn't so bad considering the fact that Amsterdam is one of the VERY few places in the world where you can function a day or so without air in mid August. I could have requested attention and I have confidence that they would have fixed the issue or moved my room but it wasn't that serious. The room was actually spacious and modern overall (despite the older style TV) and the bathroom was spacious and updated. The soaking tub was nice. Clean room, clean bathroom, no insects, rodents, problems, hallway noises, etc. I would say that this hotel is expensive. There's no doubt, especially for special events. Whew!! I'm sure most people would expect more for the $$ but it's still a reliable place by all means. For a hotel this expensive I think they need FREE WIFI THROUGHOUT THE HOTEL, BOTTOM LINE!! It's 10.70 Euro for 24 hours of access in the room, however you can only use that code for your laptop. It won't work for a mobile device if you want that wifi capability as well. They offer free (easy, fast) wifi in 30 minute blocks in the lobby and they are very generous with those access codes, however it can be a pain to go to the lobby to connect your handheld device/phone, etc. to wifi each time. It's 2011 AND WIFI SHOULD BE FREE, FREE, FREE....in every hotel, especially one that's over 200 Euro/night. Good hotel choice. Walk to tram stop (a few blocks), grocery store, various restaurants, bars, pubs, etc. I'd stay here again without a doubt, but I'd beg for a better price too!

Reviews.Title: “great hotel,great location”
Reviews.Author: pitball
Reviews.Content: my wife and i have just spent 2 nights at this hotel,though we didnt eat there,everything else was superb,we got an upgranded room,as our wasnt ready,all the staff were great,from desk to cleaners,always had a smile,and would help at every chance if needed,we will def return

Reviews.Title: “4-Star Hotel? By Whose Standards?”
Reviews.Author: acegt1
Reviews.Content: Typically Priceline doesn't let me down, but I felt a little underwhelmed when I requested a 4-star hotel in Amsterdam for three nights and ended up with the NH Carlton. I live by TripAdvisor ratings and the ratings weren't stellar for this hotel. I see why. It's not that it's a terrible place, it's just not 4-star quality. I've stayed in several other 4-star hotels in Amsterdam and this place was 3 at best. Bed was rock hard, room was hot and air conditioning ran all night but barely cooled the room. Shower curtain barely hung low enough to keep water off the floor of the bathroom. Bed linens and pillowcases had faint stains on them. Overall the room felt very drab and dated. I wouldn't be too excited about staying here again, although I would if push came to shove. When you use Priceline as much as I do, sometimes you run into the occasional underwhelming hotel - and this was it for me on this particular business trip. At least the location was pretty good, just a short walk to the nearest tram stop (Keizersgrachtâ€Ž, the 4, 16, 24, and 25 run here). Don't miss the fantastic Spanish restaurant nearby the hotel. Walk out the front door, cross Vijzelstraat, and go straight down the adjacent alleyway (Reguliersdwarsstraat). The restaurant is called Castillo and the tapas are out of this world. Best meal I'd had in Amsterdam to that point.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant stay!”
Reviews.Author: Glynnyg
Reviews.Content: This hotel is brilliant the location, service, value and cleanliness is excellent! My cousin and I went to stay in Amsterdam mainly for a good time to experience the coffee shops and bars! The NH Carlton offered us a smoking room and the location was perfect for what we needed! The location of the hotel is bang in the middle 10 minutes max to Dam square 15 to red light district! A cinema opposite the hotel! We couldn't check in until 3 as our room was not ready although we put our luggage in the safe room! Staff were also very friendly! We did not try the food or breakfast. Due to the location of the hotel mornings may possible be noisey when the windows are open but It was to be expected in the city! We are thinking of travelling to Amsterdam again and will stay at the NH Carlton

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, slightly worn down”
Reviews.Author: Lunow
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a single night in late June. I must agree with my fellow reviewers and admint, that the location is very central, but the street noise might be annoying if your room doesn't face the rear of the hotel. Rooms and bathrooms could use some refurbishment. The furniture and carpets were not quite up to date and the bathooom was small and hasn't been updated for some years. That said, the cleaning standard was good - one of the better which I have experienced. The biggest issue was the A/C, which despite running on full speed, didn't contribute much to lowering the room temperature. Luckilly, as my room faced the rear of the hotel (closed courtyard) I could turn off the A/C and sleep with my window open. Another issue was a quite low water pressure in the shower. Calculate with some extra minutes for washing shampoo out of your hair. Breakfast was what you might expect from this hotel standard in Netherlands. OK, without being extraordinary. Costing 20â‚¬, you might be better off finding a nearby cafÃ©.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Great staff, but...”
Reviews.Author: wadams4209
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel was fabulous! The room was in a great location, big terrace and great view but....It was SO NOISY outside around 2:30 or 3:00 every morning when the local bars got out. We could have closed the windows and when we did it was very quiet but our no-smoking room had a pretty bad smoky AC smell and the AC never really worked so we just lived with it. The people in the hotel were very healpful and friendly and we liked the room so much, we just lived with it all. The cafe on first floor was a great place to sit outside and watch the flower market over a coffee or glass of wine,

Reviews.Title: “Mediocre hotel; great location”
Reviews.Author: StarryNight01
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location by the canals with lots of shops and restaurants close by and the flower market is right on the corner. The rooms are run down and small although the bed was comfortable and the sheets very clean and nice. The bathrooms are tiny and difficult for 1 person let alone 2. Check in was exceedingly difficult because we'd booked online through a booking website. It took three front desk staff to figure it out while I waited 30 minutes for them to do so. And I had handed them the email confirmation when I got to the desk. Check out was similarly confused. Breakfast for 15 Euros (if you sign up beforehand at the desk; 20 Euros if you just go in for breakfast) is not worth it. The breakfast room is nice, but the buffet is meager by Dutch standards. With so many cafes around, no reason to stay at the hotel. The hotel was extremely helpful in arranging a meeting room for us at the last minute -- the room was arranged exactly as requested and we were able to order lunch for our small group via room service. I was quite impressed with this service. All in all, I would not choose to stay here again but would keep it as an option should other places not be available. The location is hard to beat. Just make sure to take your paperwork with you if you book online. Probably better to book through them directly.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location... brings pro's and con's!”
Reviews.Author: domlikestravel
Reviews.Content: My fiancÃ© and I stayed at the NH Carlton for 3 nights early June - this was our third visit to Amsterdam - and we booked the hotel as a secret deal on travelocity, for circa Â£200 each for the three nights. Amsterdam is obviously a very expensive city and you don't get much for your money accommodation-wise.... I always spend ages reviewing hotels/ apartments; the key thing for me is to ensure the best value for money. I had worked out from the description that it was either going to be the NH Carlton or the Caransa, and was pleased it turned out to be the Carlton as the reviews of the two hotels seemed to show the Carlton as the quieter of the two. We were greeted by a very friendly receptionist who checked us in quickly and luckily, just before a huge group arrived for check-in. The lobby is as expected, quite grand in an old-skool hotel sort of way, big chandelier etc...... we went to our room to find that, for the first time ever, we had been upgraded and were in a "suite" which had a separate kitchenette area, walk-in cupboard with electronic safe, and usual bathroom with complimentary shampoo etc - the shower is great and thanfully, the shower curtain wasn't overly-affectionate (I hate them! Cringe!). The beds were very comfortable (although as usual in Europe, two singles pushed together), the pillows however were the weirdest I've ever experienced - they were a bit like sleeping on an airbag as they didn't seem to flatten when you put your head on them!! We discovered on leaving that apparently the hotel have four types of pillows to choose from - shame we didn't notice this before as it would have made our respective sleeps that much more comfortable. This hotel is all about the location - you really are as central as you could ever hope to be, right next to the Flower Market. 15 minutes walk to Central Station, 5 minutes to the canals, 5 minutes to Rembrandplein and 15 minutes to Leidseplein/Museums. Plenty of trams as well although we didn't use them once this time round. Unfortunately, being so central has it's disadvantages in that we were disturbed throughout the night with revellers on their way out of town, groups coming back to the hotel, people leaving the cinema across the road, rubbish/delivery trucks in the morning etc etc. In terms of other costs, we were offered breakfast at â‚¬15 per person which is frankly extortionate - there are plenty of cafes and restaurants nearby where you can get pancakes or english breakfasts with coffee for under â‚¬9 per person. Similarly, wi-fi is available in the lobby of the hotel at â‚¬9 per day. You also do need to pay the city tax on departure, which was circa â‚¬20 for the three nights There is a big bowl of sweets in reception which are free though! All in all, I would say that this hotel is all about location but you've got to weigh up what that means for you. The hotel is definitely in need of updating, the carpets and curtains look dated and there's that lingering old hotel smell..... so I wouldn't say it's a 4* by today's standards. I feel we got good value for money having received the upgrade, however I'm afraid I don't think I would return as I would probably go for somewhere a bit quieter next time, or pay slightly more to stay somwhere a bit more current. And I would get my pillow changed!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for business or pleasure.”
Reviews.Author: PhilHunt
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed here while on a busines trip. The room was clean and airy, the bed was comfortable and from the 5th floor I had a good view. Check-in was an easy and pleasant experience. Breakfast was good with a wide variety of choice. Situated fairly well although quite a walk into the main centre (this does however, keep you away from the drunken stag parties and their noise, so not necessarily a negative). I would happily return for a leisure trip.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT HOTEL, GOOD STAFF”
Reviews.Author: biglindy
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel, upgrade to superior, lot of room and quiet. Hotel desk staff were very cooperative. Included breakfast was in a beautiful dining room, better than average for Europe, not as good as in the Orient.. Well located next to the flower marked. Short walking distance to just about everything. This was our second stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: chelseabeds
Reviews.Content: This hotel is situated in a great position right by the flower market and probably almost in the middle of the city that you want to walk around, couldnt have been better. Stayed on the 5th floor and had a lovely room, beds comfy and clean, bathroom was a good size too. We didnt have much of a view as over looked an area in the middle and a multi storey carpark but I didnt go to Amsterdam to sit and look out of the window !! I have stayed in many a hotel in Amsterdam and this was the best I felt but was a little more expensive. I would definately stay here again. We didnt have the breakfast as was expensive and you can get more choice just a few places away for much less and have the choice you wish for. There is an additional tax to pay when leaving the hotel which I think was 5 Euros a night although I cant remember and it was only a few days ago, I didnt take much notice so it wasnt a great deal anyway. The hotel does have a bar but didnt use that either, all in all its worth going to if you want to wander around the city and the staff at reception were very helpful and polite.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel - but watch out for the extras!”
Reviews.Author: sidenhill
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel from a training course, fortunately I found out before hand that breakfast would cost me E20 so I opted not to have the breakfast. You can get just an hour a day free wifi in the lobby anywhere else will cost you. and don't forget the tourist tax too. The room was good although the grey decor and the grey hallways make it a little dark, the conference facilities good also but sometimes the service was lacking - forgetting to bring refreshments to the training room on several occassions and they seemed a little unsure what the plan was for lunch each day!! For those who paid for breakfast apparantly I didn't miss anything. By the way parking is E40 a day too. Its in a great place to explore the city although I didn't have much time for that.

Reviews.Title: “Very good location, rooms are OK. Decent price for Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Budapest09
Reviews.Content: Definitely need renovations, but rooms were clean, and the one I got was good size (Deluxe Room, last floor with nice balcony). I would recommend this hotel if you book a Deluxe room. Staff was very friendly and useful.

Reviews.Title: “NH Carlton Amsterdam - Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Deboralee
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the NH Carlton Amsterdam for a week and it was a pleasant experience. Great hotel, clean room, nice view - and best of all - central location. I wouldn't hesitate to recommend this hotel or stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but noisy”
Reviews.Author: RSNS
Reviews.Content: Nicely located hotel next to the Flower Market and shopping. The hotel bridges a street and our rooms were directly on top so any conversations on the street carried straight up. The fan/air conditioning system in both rooms did not work. Would not recommend getting the breakfast there are two nice restaurants next to the flower market where you can eat for 7 euros vs the 15 euros at the hotel - granted the hotel is an all-you-can-eat buffet. There was free wireless in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: hufsa
Reviews.Content: I spent a lot of time trying to find a hotel with a central location, bathtub and a buffet breakfast as this were the kids requirements for the trip. As Amsterdam hotels are very expensive we also tried to find hotel for less than 200 euro pr night including breakfast and and extra bed for children, and this was not easy. However we got a de luxe room at NH Carlton for this price at the net, and the room was large (36 sq m), with a huge bed, huge bathroom with spa bath and separate shower and fantastic view. The decor was quite dull, but it was clean, and a worked great for a family. The kids loved the breakfast, but I thought the bacon was a bit cold and the cheese somewhat dry for a 4 star hotels breakfast. The location is fantastic with walking distance to all sites in Amsterdam. The smaller rooms looked a bit small, so I am not sure if I would recommend them (just looked inside when passing by), but the de luxe rooms are great for families.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, affordable & Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Kevin2981
Reviews.Content: It was our first trip to Amsterdam and the hotel was perfect for seeing the City by foot. Our room overlooked the Pathe cinema and Rembrandt square provided bars and restaurants on our doorstep. Staff were friendly and our room was cleaned everyday.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money, close to centre, no complaints”
Reviews.Author: Ali_Mally11111
Reviews.Content: After spending a long time going through all the terrible reviews of hotels in Amsterdam (check they are actually hotels and not hostels as some are shared bathrooms) we chose the Carlton - on arrival the receptionist was a bit scatter brained, didnt seem to know what she was doing then told us the hotel was overbooked......but we would be upgraded to a superior suite. Which was great but it could have easily have went the other way, downgraded or moved to another hotel. Shows a lack of organisation. The rooms were spotless, very comfortable, beds were massive! The bathroom was spacious and towels cleaned whenever you needed them, great shower although we didnt have hot water at one point later on at night on one occassion. Rooms cleaned every day but were never disturbed by maids. There was hardly any street noise which was unexpected as our room looked right onto a main road. Theres trains from the airport to Dam station every few mins and you can buy your tickets at the ticket machines (which generally say no cash or coins and only accept card) or theres ticket desks - cost around 7Euro and takes around 15 mins. The hotels about a half hour walk from the station or you can get a taxi from right outside for 10-15Euro. Dam square is a 20-30 minute walk away depending how quick you walk, theres plenty of trams and taxis around aswell. We walked everywhere in the whole time we were there which was fine as theres plenty of scenery and things of interest to stop you getting bored! There's lots of small take aways close by to the hotel aswell and great restraunts, quieter than the ones nearer Dam square. Amsterdam is a great place to be, the atmosphere is buzzing everywhere you go and theres plenty to do and see - Madam Tussauds and Anne Franks house were definitely the highlights. Definitely take a boat ride along the canals - costs around 15Euro and you can buy the tickets from most little newsagents or tour shops and the boats depart from infront of central station.

Reviews.Title: “central”
Reviews.Author: SinbadClydebank
Reviews.Content: Decor can only be described as dull. Our room looked on to a main road which was extremely noisy until six in the morning. Our bathroom was overheated with no air vents or windows. The bathroom fittings were hilarious - a bidet which couldnt be used unless you were a contortionist and the taps on the basins soaked you everytime! We paid 12 euros for a basic pizza on the night we arrived not realising how many fantastic restaurants were nearby! On the up side its location was fantastic and the reception staff were helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “great service”
Reviews.Author: LBMounty
Reviews.Content: the staff are great very helpful, we arrived friday 18th feb early morning and they checked us in with out any problems. the Hotel is in a great location next to the Flower Market and it is easy to get around the city. stayed in one of the older rooms but they are still ok rooms are clean, the hair dryer is old and doesnt work very well so take your own. the beakfast is ok nothing to go wild over but good to get you started in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “The Carlton Will Always Be My Home Away From Home in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: DavidEichler
Reviews.Content: Trying to find an affordable, clean, well located hotel in Amsterdam is no simple trick. After weeks of exhaustive research I chose the NH Carlton. It would be easy to say that from the moment I arrived I knew I had chosen correctly but that's actually not true. Their reservations staff was so polite, responsive and accommodating by email I knew I had chosen correctly even before I stepped off the plane. First the location. Doesn't get better. You are in the center of everything. Equal walking distance to pretty much every part of town. RIght next to a tram stop which is key especially when it's cold. The front desk was friendly, fast and helpful. Did I have to wait a few minutes? Sure. Someone walked in right ahead of me to check in and another guest was being helped by the cute Dutch girl behind the counter. It drives me crazy when I read these reviews and bratty guests -- usually US -- act like the world is going to end if they have to wait five minutes to have their diaper changed. The lobby was well appointed, sparkling and inviting. No attitude here. When I was given my key I knew I was in for a treat. I had asked the hotel that if an upgrade wasn't possible could they maybe give me a high floor with a view. I am a photographer https://picasaweb.google.com/zensled/NeuronsOnSiesta# and always enjoy getting some perspective on things. Well I was heading for the 6th floor which is a rare thing in this wonderfully old and intimate city! The elevators were numerous, fast and spacious. Also rare. The hallways are typical for a Dutch hotel when on a budget. Nothing fancy for sure, but clean. I have stayed in 4 other hotels in Amsterdam and can tell you that unless you want to spend $400 US per night, you should let go of the expectation that everything will be opulent, spotless and gilded. You might like to pretend it's 1650 but it ain't so get over yourself. When I opened the door to my room I literally dropped my bag. To say they had given me an "upgrade" is an understatement. My home for the next week would be a two room suite on the corner of the building with a pristine view of the city. As I walked into the space I was pretty sure that my plane had crashed and this was my heaven. The bed was great. The sheets and pillows couldn't have been better. Mini bar and safe. Plenty of closet space. The room was warm when I wanted it to be and cool when I needed it to be. And yes, I could open the windows which is not always an easy thing to find in an older city. Even though I was facing a busy street the windows kept out almost all of the noise. Not all? No, but this is a bustling city. If you want pristine silence go to the mountains. The bathroom was beautiful and clean. Marble. Good water pressure. An actual shower head. A toilet that was dependable. If you have travelled much you know that these simple things can never be taken for granted. Was the TV a flat screen? Was there free internet in the room? No, I'm on vacation, I don't need to be sitting in my room channel surfing and checking emails. There is free internet in the lobby and if you must get a longer fix you can go across the street to McDonald's where it is free. Once again I must rant. Who are these travelers who give hotels bad reviews for such ridiculous things. The comforts of home are good service, a bed and shower. Not technology. Get over yourselves. If I needed to know something I asked the staff downstairs who always had the answers. If I needed entertainment I left the friggin hotel! For the next week, the Carlton never missed a beat. Housekeeping paid attention to details and was incredibly fast to respond on the days when I slept late and only gave them a small window to do their thing. There was always a mint waiting on my pillow when I'd return. I never ate in the restaurant but it always had lots of people and looked quite nice. I know I got lucky. I arrived mid-week in January and hit the jackpot with the room I was given. I can't count on that happening (nor should you) when I return to the Carlton. But return, I definitely will. Bravo!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Hotel, Great Break. Stay Here.”
Reviews.Author: TommyMcAree
Reviews.Content: From the time we left the plane at Schipol and got to the train station, we had a great time. The people are so friendly, and go out of their way to help you. They speak almost perfect English, and any time we asked for directions, they were given with a smile. From asking at the station which platform to Central Station, to the Tourist Office outside the station asking which Tram to take to the hotel, the service was brilliant. We were given a tourist map and the hotel was circled. Even I couldn't go wrong. Check in was simple, and directions to the room and where breakfast was held was made very clear. We went to our room and this was the only disappointing thing of our stay. The room was too small. This may be a ploy to get you to upgrade but the bed was too big for the room. However, we may have been spoiled by previous hotel stays. You can upgrade for 25 euros per night if you wish to a superior room but to be honest, to me a room is a room. But a bit disappointing. No complaints about the housekeeping, and got an extra pillow when I asked for it. The cleaner, Izabella,was very friendly and always had a great smile. The sweet on the pillow every day was a nice gesture. Breakfast was very good. A nice touch was when we went down for the first time, one of the staff there took you across to the buffet area and pointed out where everything was. You didn't stand there like a lemon wondering where everything is. The location of this hotel is superb. 15 minutes walk from the top end of town, and 10 to 15 minutes walk to the lower end where the museum area and the Vondel Park is. There is not too much traffic going past the hotel and what there is was not too noticeable. It was close to plenty of restaurants and bars, and the area has a nice atmosphere about it. Whilst in Amsterdam we did not have a bad meal. The first night we went around the corner to Saturninos, Reguliersdwarsstraat 5. A small Italian restaurant, with great atmosphere, and a cosy, informal manner. Beautiful soft slices of veal for me, an excellent plate of chicken for my wife with a lovely sauce on top. Superb food. Need I say any more. Go there. The second night we went Dutch. We went to a place called Het Karbeel, Warmoesstraat 16, in the centre of town. A popular meal was Fondu which a number of tables were having.However, I had steak and was able to cut it with a butter knife, it was so tender and moist. Again no complaints. The last night we went to a thai restaurant down near Leideslein square. It was only okay, but that was compared to what had gone before. One other place deserves a mention. We had lunch at Cafe Mankind, Wetteringstraat 60, a small bar near the Rijksmuseum and antiques area, overlooking a small canal. They serve the best pea soup in Amsterdam, and the Club sandwich was superb. It was so good we went out of our way to go back there for lunch the next day. Well done Frank, the owner,for a superb place. It has AMBIENCE. All in all, a great break, and batteries recharged for the coming months. We booked this through Easyjet Holidays and I would thoroughly recommend this location, airline, hotel and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “NOT SECURE !”
Reviews.Author: Andre2011
Reviews.Content: I was staying for business at this hotel in January 10 th to 15 and it was horrible.The next morning of our arrival ,my laptop bag where stolen from the lobby while I was speaking to the reception staff.It happens in 2 minutes,somebody came from outside to the lobby area and took my bag very quickly.We could see that from the camera registration which was at the lobby.It is unbelievable how fast it happens.I lost my pc,credit cards,cash money,and other documents.I defenitly not recommend this hotel to anyone ,the manager of the hotel said that it is not their fault ,he was not helpful ,I had to report to the police station in amsterdam on my own and no body assisted to me from the hotel management.The are signes out of the hotel at the entrance ''24 hours camera surveillance '' but you can not see due to big flowers fronting them. The staff at the reception said that it was the 5 th time in 1 year.I will complain to the had of NH Hotels in Spain as well.

Reviews.Title: “a well-priced hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: mackyUK
Reviews.Content: Spent a couple of nights here over the New Year and I thought the Carlton was a well-priced hotel in a good location. The hotel is about a mile from Amsterdam central station and you can walk to the hotel by following the Spuistraat all the way to the flower market where the hotel becomes visible. You can also catch trams 1,2 and 5 which run very frequently. The hotel itself has smallish rooms (which is common for Amsterdam) but they manage to pack in the TV, Desk, Coffee and Tea making facilities as well as confortable double/ twin beds . Our room was on the sixth floor (quite high for Amsterdam) so we has some great views of the Munttoren and Muntplein.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, great location - would definitely recommend”
Reviews.Author: Josie0007
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights here over New Years and when looking for a hotel we struggled to find many options as most had sky high prices and terrible reviews so were a bit apprehensive about what we'd find... but when we saw it we were very happy! We got only got an okay deal on easytobook.com but we think it was money well spent. It's in a great location - about a 20-25 min walk from Central Station, or there are a number of trams you can get that stop at Muntplein, about a 1 min walk away. It's 15 mins walk to Dam Square and the red light district, 10-15 mins to Heineken Brewery, 20 mins to Van Gogh Museum. The flower market is a 1 min walk away. It's easy to catch trams around if need be but we didn't find it necessary as it's a flat walk everywhere and it's a pretty walk too! We had a standard 'organiser' room which we found to be very comfortable and warm. It was cleaned spotlessly and tea/coffee/soaps etc replaced each day - plus a new sweet on our pillow! The staff were all very friendly, professional and helpful. We faced the street but didn't find street noise too much of a problem - apart from New Years eve but that's to be expected! We left our luggage in the luggage storage for our last day and it was the first hotel we've come across that has good security as they stuck labels on our luggage, gave us a ticket and matched it with our luggage when we picked it up. There is a restaurant and bar but we didn't try out either. The breakfast seemed quite expensive (20 Euro each) but there are supermarkets nearby so we picked up some things ourselves and kept them in the minibar fridge. Failing that, there are cafes close by as well alongside the flower market. The only downside is that we struggled to get much of a sleep in (i.e. past 8am) as we were woken by rooms nearby/hallway outside being cleaned - although we never had a problem with hearing people in their rooms. Overall it's a great hotel and we'd recommend it - they even have a pillow service so you can pick the perfect pillow to your liking!

Reviews.Title: “GREAT HOTEL AND STAFF AND WONDERFUL LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: kappyaus
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff were helpful from the time we checked in to the time we left. They helped me with finding my way, transportation, where to find tours and how the trams and canal boats work and charge. It was a great stay and we had a wonderful 48 hours in Amsterdam!

Reviews.Title: “Superb Location”
Reviews.Author: Terry061
Reviews.Content: We stayed in room 602 which was at the back of the hotel with a great view and very quiet. Room was spacious , warm and clean. The bathroom was spotless and large. Shower excellent. The location is faultless. 15 mins walk to Van Gogh Museum, Adjacent to Flower Market . 15 mins walk to Red Light District - don't need to use trams etc unless you have difficulty walking. Schipol Airport to Amsterdam Central is 15 mins and is 4.20 euros one way. We walked from train station to hotel in half an hour but a direct tram is available outside station. Loads of restaurants around hotel including a MacDonalds that serve a great breakfast for 6 euros - juice, croissant, coffee/tea and bacon/egg muffin. Subways are all over and many other restaurants and supermarkets nearby. If we go to Amsterdam again i will choose this hotel. We have visited over 20 capital cities and this is one of the best locations/quality hotels we have experienced.

Reviews.Title: “Insects in carpet hell”
Reviews.Author: rabiatix
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is great, and the staff seemed friendly enough. Unfortunately, that's all the positive things I have to say about this hotel. Walking through the corridors towards my room, it felt as if I was about to be trapped in the spaceship a very unfashionable alien. That didn't bother me much as it's not too uncommon in hotels, and I was not planning to sleep in the corridors. When I entered the room however, I almost wished I was going to. The room was tiny and the interior looked like a dark green-ish bathroom from the seventies. Stained carpet covered all of the floor. When I opened the window, I looked down onto a roof half a meter below, littered with cigarette butts and roaches. Back inside the room a bunch of insects were having some sort of a convention in the ceiling. When I finally left the place after 3 days, I had somewhere between 10 and 20 different insect bites. Mainly mosquito, I think, but the mosquitoes definitely were not alone in the room. The prices are ridiculous too. Breakfast costs 15 euros extra per day, internet access another 9 euros.

Reviews.Title: “Super clean, good rooms, with a 15 minute walk to the center”
Reviews.Author: seputus
Reviews.Content: The title kind of says it all. Hard to find something at a not-eyepopping price in Amsterdam which doesn't have horrible reviews, so I went the Priceline route and got this hotel, saving 40% off of what the major sites had the room listed for. This was still just an 'okay' deal but probably a great deal for Amsterdam! Hotel's not really close to the center but there is a very lively street with restaurants, pubs, cafes, etc. just 50 meters away which is nice if you like nightlife. Internet is free but only in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Central Location, great value on internet pricing”
Reviews.Author: ycamp5
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had a 5 day stay recently in Amsterdam at the NH Carlton. It's by the flower market, perfect location to get everywhere via walking or the tram/train. The rooms were small or quaint but clean and simple. We were on the 7th floor which was smaller with double bed (not two twins put together!) and a nice size balcony that overlooked the city. It was perfect for our stay and we were able to take some wonderful post-rain pictures of sundown from our balcony. My only problem which wasn't an issue was the cleaning solution they use for the hallways...smells like industry cleaner they use for public bathrooms. The hallways were like a cruise but the lobby was fine with 30min free wi-fi and the restaurant and bar was nice with good service. The concierge were helpful with detailed maps of the city and speaks English (I don't think they were even Dutch) and knew almost everywhere we asked them directions for. Nice area, clean hotel and it was pretty inexpensive for Amsterdam! Definitely good value for the buck! would recommend if you are not so picky about space and the extra luxury from real 4 or 5 star accommodations.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: bluestar001
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a trip to amterdam on 7th october, this hotel is right next to the flower market, with rembrandt square just a five minute walk away, the red light district is up the road and to the right, there are plenty of restaurants close by and cake shops, gift shops, coffee shops, etc highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “regular visitor”
Reviews.Author: fearmÃ³r
Reviews.Content: this is a very functional hotel and well priced if you get a deal on it. Its central location is good for tourists and I've always found the staff to be great. the room are good in terms of Amsterdam, where all hotels are fairly dated in my opinion. I'v not eaten here but there are some realy good restaurants nearby. There is free wifi in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “It worked for what we needed”
Reviews.Author: Southernmost
Reviews.Content: As others say, this is not even close to 4 star hotel. The location is great, but everthing else is just ok. Room was clean but old. Our flight arrived in the morning. We got to the hotel around 11:30. As expected, they advised the room wasn't ready. They offered us an upgraded room for 20 euro a night that was ready for immediate check-in. After a long flight, we jumped at the opportunity - which I'm sure is a gimmick - but it worked. The room wasn't as spacious as everyone said. Air conditioner didn't work. We were able to leave the windows open when we were hanging out but at night it was too noisy so the room got stuffy. The beds were comfortable. Front desk staff was hit and miss, never rude but not overly friendly or informative. Free wifi in lobby was ok but didn't cut it as far as time needed so I paid the up-grade fee for room access. Speed was good but make sure you have updated security on your laptop because my provider was catching a ton of hacking attempts. As a whole, the room was okay for what we needed. I would only recommend this hotel if the rate was at a 3 diamond/star price.

Reviews.Title: “just so you know what to expect”
Reviews.Author: smjsmj
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 4 night stay. For us the hotel is ok. The location is excellent. Our room was really worn. The doors and furnishings were scuffed up pretty badly and the carpet could be replaced. The room was large and pretty clean but the lighting was not good. I don't think the air conditioning was working but we just opened the windows when needed. They do have free internet in the lobby. You are given a code which is good for only 30 min. This is the only hotel I have ever stayed at in Amsterdam so my idea of value may not be accurate. I do however feel that the hotel is a little overpriced.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location and Service-- We Enjoyed Our Stay”
Reviews.Author: sneaks23
Reviews.Content: This hotel was awesome. We were on a two-week jaunt through Europe, staying at 3 and 4 star hotels, and this was right up there at the top for our favorite hotels. PROS: * Awesome location! There was many food options right across the street. This may have been our favorite part of the hotel - we literally could walk (or bike) everywhere * Large room * Very friendly and helpful front desk. Great service. * Got a great rate on Priceline too... a great value * Free WIFI in the lobby. For WIFI in the rooms, you have to pay. I bought Economy WIFI service for 1 day (was too lazy to go to lobby) and WIFI speed was fast * Easy to print boarding passes (for free) * Great water pressure in shower * Very comfortable bed Unfortunately, unlike other 4-stars we've stayed at, this hotel didn't have a gym. One "nit" to mention: the initial room they gave us had a small queen bed (felt like what we call in the US a "full bed"); unfortunately, my wife was sick and she didn't want to give me what she had. We asked for a room with two beds, or a larger bed. Initially the person at the front desk was not able to help us. After talking to her manager, the manager was able to give us a room with two beds but it took a few minutes to go back-and-forth with her. It would have been nice if this was a little easier, but she was cool and overall it was not a big deal. In short, the staff turned what could have been a bad situation into a good one. We really appreciated it so it something I wanted to mention in the review. Based on our experience, we'd very highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not 4 star, no way”
Reviews.Author: FlyStayEat
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through Priceline and got a good rate. The location was pretty good and we easily walked many places from the hotel. Parking was available, but expensive and a hassle (having to be buzzed in and out). We checked in early and the desk clerk said only 2 single beds were available, but we were tired and took them. Thankfully the 2 single beds are pushed together, so it seemed like a double. The desk clerk was very very friendly and helpful also. I was surprised, however, that the desk could not change out currency. Most "4 star" hotels can do this. The hallways were narrow and older looking. Our bathroom needed major work. It wasn't super clean and unfortunately smelled a bit like urine. I tried to ignore it, but it was definitely there. Only shampoo in the bathroom - no conditioner or body lotion. The breakfast was somewhat expensive considering the scrambled eggs were clearly powdered. We were here only one night, so we dealt with it.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in great location!”
Reviews.Author: tflynnuk
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a short 4-day trip to Amsterdam in September. When we arrived we were surprised at how big the hotel seemed. Including a restaurant at ground level, it spreads across (and even over!) the local streets. Not so pretty from the outside, inside it is relatively modern and definitely clean. Check-in was friendly and hassle-free, our room was on the 4th floor, directly overlooking the street outside. The rooms were double-glazed so if the windows were closed traffic noise wasn't a problem. Refreshingly, the windows opened all the way so if you did want to sit on the window-sill and people watch, it is possible - there always seemed to be something going on outside in the mornings! Decor-wise, some of the corridors and communal areas looked a little tired, as did the rooms. It wasn't out-dated, but definitely not cutting edge either. But the room was clean and perfectly useable, having most of the facilities you would expect from a hotel of this class - toiletries, tea & coffee, full TV system, etc. One slight niggle was a request to come and reset the safe (which someone had kindly locked with their credit card and then checked out!) after which the handyman turned his attention to our air-conditioning which he said was too noisy. He then promptly disconnected it, and never returned to fix it, despite us reminding reception about it for the next two days. In the end it was never fixed. Not a major problem, but had it been slightly warmer this would have been very annoying! A quick complaint via email after we returned home earned us a voucher for our next stay, so I suppose they did try to redeem themselves... Our stay did not include breakfast, and we didn't make use of any of the hotel facilities so I can't comment on their quality. The location of this hotel is faultless, you are right in the heart of the city, and easy walking distance to all the major sites. We even walked from the train station to the hotel on our arrival, with no need for a Taxi, which was a pleasant change! The area is safe and busy even at night, although as always it's wise to exercise some common sense after dark and don't flash valuables - but what city don't you need to do that in these days! If I return to Amsterdam I would try and stay here again, purely because of the price and location. The air-conditioning issue aside I was very pleased with the service. I'd recommend this hotel to anybody who doesn't want to spend a fortune in Amsterdam, but still wants a good quality room with a "big hotel" feel to it with easy access to the sights.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate hotel in a great location!”
Reviews.Author: twiggers77
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 5 nights in September 2010. Room was purchased on Priceline for $95/night (a little high, but likely due to the length of stay). After reading the mised reviews on here I was a little nervous, but it was unfounded. The hotel was pleasant. I confirmed the hotel before arriving and requested a double bed, and specifically asked that it NOT be two singles pushed together. We arrived early, around noon and were able to get our room right away. The front desk staff were VERY helpful and polite every time I needed help. The room was on the 6th floor (room 601) and was just fine. The room was clean and neat. Bathroom was also clean. Husband reported that the bed was a little hard for his taste, but he adapted. There was plenty of room for our two small rollerboards and had two chairs to sit in. Room overlooked a smaller side street which we thought would be good, but it was noisy! There were a bunch of small bars and so it could be noisy at night. The trash pick up in the morning was the worst though. The simple solution was to close the window. Water pressure and temperature in shower were great. Towels were comfy and huge for hotel towels. Good selection of pillows available by calling front desk. Soap, shampoo, and body wash provided. The location is the best though!!! Coffee shops nearby, tram stops a block away, and the flower market right outside the door. Free wifi in the lobby and they also have two computers on the second floor you can use for free (15 minutes at a time but they'll give you more if you ask). Would I stay again? Yes, but only via a Priceline bid. In my opinion, this room isn't worth more than about $75-80 USD per night.

Reviews.Title: “Not sure about that 4th star”
Reviews.Author: rc429
Reviews.Content: Like many others, I got this hotel on a priceline bid. When we checked in, they told us that the room we had reserved wasn't available (we arrived quite late in the evening) and that they were upgrading us. That was fine; the room itself was spacious and had everything we needed. The bathroom, however, needed a good scrubbing with a mildew remover. The hallways also had seen better days - there were spots where the paint (and plaster?) was chipped off. We liked the location, and the service in the bar was good and friendly. Overall, not what I would expect. It wasn't horrible, but it wasn't great either.

Reviews.Title: “NiCe HoTeL WiTh The BeST LoCaTioN iN aMSTeRDam!!”
Reviews.Author: DaLaL_ShaNe3a
