Reviews.Content: We just stay in nh carlton for 25 night we booked 2 deluxe room it was spacious and comfortable with a big bath and nice view the stuff was so helpful and polite this was our second time and am sure next time we will stay in the same hotel the location cant beat within a walking distance to many attraction and shopping street and just beside the flower market we receive a welcome msg with a lovely flower and chocklet from the hotel manager Marcel Wijnberger that was a nice touch thanks for making our stay the best I donâ€™t know why there is many bad reviews about the hotel there is nothing bad at all in this hotel I stayed in many 5 star hotel in Amsterdam and nh carlton just 4 star hotel and it was better than the other hotel I recommend this hotel for any one and I will not stay in any other hotel in Amsterdam I traveled to Amsterdam every summer and who knows if I got a good deal for nh carlton in December I will return back for new year its really a nice hotel with the best location in Amsterdam .

Reviews.Title: “Avoid”
Reviews.Author: ambdsa
Reviews.Content: 20 minutes in line to check in (just one receptionist at the time); dirty bathroom; stains in the room carpet; no toiletries (not even a soap bar) on the first day; room service answer was a taped message; food trays left until next day in the corridor; power cable on the corridor; promise of late check out not honored; decaying rooms. Bottom line: apart from the location which I think is very good for a tourist, this hotel was a great disapointment. Not worth the price.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, staff and location.”
Reviews.Author: GeorgeJohnF
Reviews.Content: The check in was quick, friendly and efficient. The room was well-prepared, clean and a good size. We had booked a single room for our daughter and had been advised that the hotel would 'try' and provide adjacent rooms and this was what we got without any problems! The hotel is in a great central location for many of the 'must see' places and we were quickly able to use our map and one provided by the hotel to plan our days. The breakfast room was also clean and run efficiently with an excellent choice of cereals, fruit, cheeses, meat and pastries. The staff were always busy clearing and setting up the tables. All in all I cannot fault the hotel - it exceeded all of our expectations.

Reviews.Title: “A place to sleep but absolutely no service”
Reviews.Author: gavinareid
Reviews.Content: Having arrived for a city holiday my partner and I upgraded to a Deluxe room and were pleased with the size of the room though it was dated and not particularly clean (coffee stains all over side tables). The room has a kettle however to use it you needed to move it, unplug the TV and plug it in. There is very little in the way of room service, or in fact any concept of service at the hotel. The staff are very matter of fact and quite honestly gave the impression that they couldn't care less and were quick to find an excuse for everything from the time in takes to be acknowledged by the desk staff to the fact there was no toilet paper in our room's bathroom. As a frequent stayer with NH Hotels this was a huge disappointment. On the upside great location however I would recommend the NH City Centre is a better choice. The Carlton should be re-rated to a 3 star (at best)

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Excellent Location and Value”
Reviews.Author: philly57
Reviews.Content: Hotels in Amsterdam are expensive! We wanted something close to the center, with air conditioning, and decent rooms. According to betterbidding dot com, this was Price Line's designated 4 star Amsterdam center hotel. So many people reported getting this hotel, that when I bid, I was 99% sure I would get this hotel - and I did. For the same money as the hostels, hotels outside of the center, and 3 star centrally located hotels with bad reviews, I stayed here. Was it perfect? No. But it was definitely better than anything else in our budget. The AC worked, the room was fine, good water pressure, hot water, the location - right across from the Flower Market - was amazing. The staff was pretty friendly too.

Reviews.Title: “Clean with air con,central location”
Reviews.Author: iris444
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights in room 640 thru Priceline. Old fashioned clean room,slightly bigger than standard double in NH Amsterdam Centre. Adequate tub and good shower over bath with plenty of hot water. Cleaned and fresh towels daily. Efficient air con as was previously concerned from reading a recent review. Windows can be opened if required but mind the mossies. Tea and coffee making facilities but always bring my own supplies with fresh milk bought in fridge. No stains in room carpet, infact quite newish ( yes, sad isn't it that we are checking everything!!). Comfortable bed and given quiet room as requested. Yes, there are slight cleaning noises in the corridors in the mane and odd plumbling here and there but it was not a problem for us. Polite and friendly staff at reception. Did not eat in as plenty of cafes around hotel. Breakfast daily at V & D La Paige (400 yds from hotel) with plenty of cheap choices and lovely fruit smoothies. Spolit for choices. We always have a meal or two at Restaurant Orontes at Albert Cuypstraat 40-42 on every trip, 20mins walk from hotel. Lovely location to walk to everywhere which we always do loads in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “My honest review”
Reviews.Author: lady_jamrock
Reviews.Content: O.k so i travelled solo a 20 something female traveller,the hotel was quite easy to get to, after the train then locating the tram, by the way the tram is not the one directly when you get out the station, instead it is one that veers, to the left, a few stops later i got off then realised that i could of walked, just follow tram tracks i did :) The hotel is nice, if not very old fashioned, my favorite reception person was babette, she was so helpful all the time and always smiling, also another guy who works night, didnt get his name but a blond haired blue eyed guy :) My room was very old fashined and had a slightly yellow feel to it, the carpet has turned pinkish in some parts, prob due to it being so old, i could not figure out the air con heating thing, but did not ask reception either, there are 22 channels for tv and not very varied, lots of news, also there seems to be the toilet system between the bedroom and bathroom hall, so whenever somebody upstairs flushed the toilet, i could hear it constantly, which was very annoying, balcony was roomy, but its a shame the maids do not go out there as there was alot of cobwebs, also it would be nice if the chairs fitted outside! Be aware that you will need 50 euros upfront to pay for the mini bar, but if you use nothing you get this back, one tip, i checked the mini bar out and it was about 50% full, i took a picture of this and took it to reception and asked if this is how it was supposed to be, they said no, babette showed her colleague who assured me the house keeping would fill it up the next day, she made 2 calls but the next day house keeping did not fill it up, luckily i had babette when i checked out, so she knew the situation with the mini bar so i got my money back easily. The hotel is walking distance to everything, the albert cyup market is a leaisurely 20 min walk its a straight road, again follow the tram lines if you are unsure, there is a supermarket, at the side of the heiniken attraction, where you can pick up most things, it is a 20 min walk back up to cantral station and about 10 mins to the red light district, you are opposite the mcdonalds and noodle place, burger king is on the same road as the side entrance to mc d's and so is subway, rembrandt square is lively and a good place to head, Internet usage, i didnt pay for this, you can get 15 minbs free at reception and if you have a device laptop phone etc, you can get a code from reception to use the internet wireless, which was handy on the last day. Also my flight was not until 7pm, the hotel have a locked room where guests can leave their bags, until they are ready to leave, they give you a ticket and reception hold the key. There is also on the 7th floor an ironing room, which is open everyday where you can go and use the iron, all in all nt a bad hotel if you have got it at a discount through priceline. I would say just go and explore!

Reviews.Title: “keep away from this run-down, filthy and smelly establishment”
Reviews.Author: PushingTheSenses
Reviews.Content: foot spray in the bathroom, or â€˜how bodyshop saved my lifeâ€™ upon seeing the ugly building from the outside and entering the lobby it was clear that this was a run-down version of a hotel that may have deserved 4 stars in the good old days when dinosaurs were roaming the earth. so ok this was not going to be a highlight but at this stage i was still expecting at least an ok room. when i was queuing for check-in all of the front desk staff were dealing with another customer who was complaining about his room - they gave each other looks that clearly indicated they were not taking him seriously. this was not foreboding well. so with already lowered expectations i still was utterly disappointed when entering the room. tired and dated, with chipped wood panelling and furniture that worked like a time-warp into the early 80s. worse of all was the smell: mold from the bathroom overpowering old cigarette stink in the non smoking room. luckily the air conditioning was working. i was happy to just drop my luggage and leave for the evening. the really nasty surprise was the next morning when i discovered the year-old grime â€˜decoratingâ€™ the glass shower separation (see photos). imagine taking a shower while trying not to touch anything... with the photos i complained at reception. their reaction was as if housekeeping had been sloppy just on that day. to be clear: this was not a case of bad cleaning for a few days, this was NOT cleaning for years. they revealed absolutely no interest in helping customers. i wasnâ€™t offered to move to another room, instead they promised to alert housekeeping and have the shower cleaned. upon learning that breakfast would be at an additional 20 euros to the room rate of 140 euros per night i did not want to grace this establishment with another cent so i decided to have breakfast at a nearby cafe of which there are many. so when returning back to the hotel late in the evening i was curious about what would expect me there. yes, the shower had been cleaned. however, the stink in the room was now unbearable. obviously the act of cleaning after all these years had somehow disturbed the filth and there was now a reeking smell coming from the bathroom. my only remedy was spraying every possible surface with bodyshopâ€™s peppermint foot spray and closing the door, hoping that this would make possible a shower the next morning. obviously nobody from management or staff had felt it necessary to check on the room and its state after i had complained. my reaction to the standard check-out question â€˜did you enjoy your stay with us?â€™ elicited a surprised reaction from the lady and she apologised. however, no compensation whatsoever was offered, no discount no nothing. i wish i could say the checkout was the only positive thing about this hotel. summary: - definitely not a 4 star but a total rip-off for a poor and overpaid budget accomodation - there is nothing pleasant about this place - filth and bad smells in the rooms - cheap toiletries that stink - breakfast comes at an additional 20 euros - location is central, but so are a lot of pleasant hotels at the same or even lower price the level - or should i rather say lack - of cleanliness is appalling. regardless of a hotelâ€™s star rating i would expect it to be clean. i have been staying in backpacker hostels that were a lot cleaner than this! nh group must have acquired it recently as on the windows you can still see the jolly hotelâ€™s branding. evidently nh have bought this hotel for cash cow milking as they donâ€™t seem intent on investing even a penny into proper upkeeping, let alone into a long overdue, massive reconstruction.

Reviews.Title: “Total rip off”
Reviews.Author: Monaco77
Reviews.Content: Would advise against this hotel: ugly building, unfriendly reception staff, rooms that are tired and outdated. No interest in helping customers. I was given a non smoking room that reeked of cigarettes. When I asked to change it, the receptionist said "it's not possible you are on a non smoking floor" and said she would come and check herself ! Once inside the room, she reluctantly agreed that there was an issue. I was moved to room 50. Avoid at all costs. It's actually a meeting room that they turn into a bedroom by using some kind of cupboard open folded down bed. Dark wood panels all around, stained carpet, ripped bed cover, could have been the set of a bad 70's porn movie :-) It was on the mezzanine so a gathering place for peoople. I was awoken at 6:25 by a very nousy group of American retirees. When asked at checkout if my stay was good, I said "no, terrible actually". The receptionist didn't say anything back, no discout offer not even an apology. All of this for a total of 187â‚¬ ! No wonder it was one of the few hotels left with availability that night. You can only stay there if you have no other alternatives !

Reviews.Title: “the best location in amsterdam!!”
Reviews.Author: DaLaL_ShaNe3a
Reviews.Content: Me and my friends choose to stay in nh carlton for 7 night in july 2009, we booked a deluxe room it was realy nice and spacious with abig nice bath and walk-in closet the furniture was old but comfortable and clean we loved it alot, the location cant beat u can walk to every where there is acinema just in front of the hotel we didnt try any of hotel restaurant so i cant say any thing about it because there is plenty of restaurant and caffes just around the hotel for brake fast try the V&D they have plenty of nice sandwichs and just 5 mnt walking from the hotel also the night life if your are looking for partying there is plenty around just in rembrandt square near the hotel just 5 mnt walking its really close but at the same time u cant hear it in room it was so quite and u can get agood sleep i cant wait to come to the lovely city again and the nice hotel i already booked for next july in same hotel i highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, Unremarkable Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lamava
Reviews.Content: My sister and I checked into the Nh Carlton for a three day stay in Amsterdam. Not overly finicky, and really just wanting some beds and proximity to the sites we were content with our stay. The staff at the front desk are capable and knowledgeable if not overly friendly. The location is very nice - walkable to Centraal (though take the tram or a taxi if you don't travel light) and to most of city center Amsterdam. We were not pleased with the 'free' wi-fi situation as it was confined to the downstairs lobby and limited to 30 minute sessions (despite there not being any shared device, you have to bring your own). Each time we wanted to use the internet, we had to wait in line at the front desk and request login credentials. A waste of time for all parties involved and certainly a clunky system. The rooms are adequate but not overly plush or comfortable. However, we were able to get enough sleep to function (more due to jet lagged sleeping schedules) and appreciated being able to walk out into the thick of things in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Will never stay at a 'NH Carlton' Hotel again”
Reviews.Author: ering08
Reviews.Content: Me & my partner stayed at this hotel for two nights. Upon check in, Bernadette was very helpful and showed us places to go. We arrived in our room which was tiny, old and distasteful. The room was so stuffy and the aircon didnt help one bit. To order a movie cosed 13 euros which is the biggest rip off ever. Everything comes at a price with this hotel. To add breakfast was 20 euros per person per night (which we were not willing to pay) as we were already paying 179 euros for the first night. On the last day, already disatisfied, we asked a lady who worked there what time check out was & so we left our bags in the room and went out until half an before the check out time. When we went back to our room, the key wouldnt work and so we had to get another key from reception where the lady explained checkout was earlier than we though but she said if we got our bags and came down it would be fine. So we did. Once checking out, we got a different tall blonde lady instead of the one who had been dealing with us earlier. She refused to accept we were late by mistake and charged us 30 euros late checkout fee on top of the 330 euros for 2 nights!! I usually wouldnt complain but this hotel is a scam, trying to exploit people and take their money any way they can. Rooms were horrible and the service was very unpleasant. I wouldnt recommend this hotel to anyone and i certainly wont be back. Staying at this hotel ruined our holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutly NOT 4-star, really BAD beds!”
Reviews.Author: StockkholmLifetrip
Reviews.Content: We were very disapponted. Looks like it's from the 80's. Very, very small rooms. The beds were like hardwood and in our "non-smoking"-room, we felt smoke every morning in our bathroom and balcony. The only positive thing is the nearness to everything, but then Amsterdam is a small town. I will never go back to this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, good hotel”
Reviews.Author: hurtzu32
Reviews.Content: Friendly staff, great location. Standard rooms are a bit small, but perfectly functional for two people. Close to Rembrandt Square for good nightlife. Walking distance to all major attractions. Very friendly staff, free wifi in lobby only.

Reviews.Title: “Ok hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: Bustergirl
Reviews.Content: We got a good price on this hotel through Priceline, bidding on a 4 star. This isn't a 4 star hotel in my opinion, but it isn't bad. The best thing is that they gave us a room at about 11:30 am after a long trip from the US so we could take a quick nap. The room was small but decent with a little balcony to overlook the action on the street below, and it was quiet. The location was great for walking all over Amsterdam. On the down side - The shower was crazy - it went from normal to boiling hot several times during the course of one shower. The beds were hard, but that was fine with us. The process to use the hotel computers is cumbersome and it is only 15 minutes at a time. It's a fine place to stay if you can get it cheap.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: philmaw
Reviews.Content: It is a great hotel with great central location,only 100m far from the museum.Hotel was clean and my room was quite nice. There are good restaurants at the hotel but little expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Location Location Location”
Reviews.Author: occhi21
Reviews.Content: My husband and I won this hotel for $100 via priceline which was over our budget but when we actually arrived at the hotel we realized it is smack dab in the center of Amsterdam! It is right next to the flower market. It is three tram stops from the Central Station, a block away from Rembrandt square. We told the hotel we were on our honeymoon before and they gave us a corner room on the 4th floor right above the flower market with a perfect view of the canel! The staff was super helpful and they even gave us a welcome letter with a huge bottle of spring water and snacks and thanking us for choosing there hotel for our honeymoon. I have stayed at our NH properties and I have to say that I always find them to be clean,simple, and new. They now offer free WiFI in the lobby for 30 min which is so refreshing bc I feel hotel's prices for internet is a bit INSANE! They also give you 15min pass for free to us the hotel's business center computers. Def would recd' and stay at this NH property which btw has tons of Amstersdam hotels

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but wouldn't rate it 4*”
Reviews.Author: AHappyHiker
Reviews.Content: Had booked to stay for two nights but due to Volcanic Ash etc ended up staying four. Which meant we had time to explore this beautiful city. The Hotels location could not be better, right next to the flower market and within walking distance to the main attractions. Breakfast buffet was adequate but nothing special. Rooms are again nothing to write home about. Air conditioning didn't work so had to keep the curtains closed as with it being sunny weather the room soon heated up. Hope they get it working for the summer as with the window open the noise was unbearable.

Reviews.Title: “Do NOT book this hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: Lunoe1
Reviews.Content: I almost do not have the energy to write this review, after being in this terrible hotel for 2Â½ days. The check in was close to 20 minuts... the same as check out. Food around medium, room in bad shape.. ok beds, but didn't seem completly clean, the shower is impossible to use for normal showering, not more than a few drops actually coming out of the shower... overprized internet, that was not working all that well. All of the above combined with arrogant service and sometimes no service at all... My best recommondation: DO NOT BOOK THIS HOTEL!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location if somewhat dated”
Reviews.Author: VanninLady
Reviews.Content: Situated in the middle of town right next to the flower market. Within easy walking distance of a great range of restaurants and bars. The rooms themselves were slightly dated; the furniture was scruffy; the bathroom was tiny; the shower was erratic ranging from normal to boiling to freezing; the air conditioning didn't work and it was too noisy to leave the window open; and leaving the breakfast card on the door failed miserably.

Reviews.Title: “does not warrant a 4 star”
Reviews.Author: lisacego3
Reviews.Content: The hotel was lovely, the food was good, the rooms were small and the beds were rock hard and very uncomfortable. Great for walking to places, right in the middle of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: ndoubleyou
Reviews.Content: We booked the hotel through Thomson and got an excellent rate. The hotel is clean and comfortable with friendly, professional staff. The rooms are a little outdated but certainly not grubby and come with all the facilities you'd expect including a mini-bar and tea and coffee making facilities. The breakfasts are plenty to set you up for the day and include some lovely little iced cakes. The best thing about this hotel though is the location; right next to the flower market and no more than five minutes from Rembrandt square, it's completely central and within walking distance of most of the major attractions. Obviously we visited out of season so it was bound to be quieter and cheaper but regardless of the time of year, the location is pretty much unbeatable.

Reviews.Title: “Great Centralized Hotel in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: cammelview
Reviews.Content: The NH Carlton was absolutely great! It was very clean and comfortable! The staff was knowledgeable and friendly. From the hotel you can walk anywhere, 10 mins. to Heineken Brewery, 15 mins to Van Gogh Museum 2 mins to Rembrantplein ( a great place for nightlife & food!) and 5 mins to Dam Square. Its located right next to the floating flower market. Though you can walk pretty much anywhere, a tram stop is right outside the hotel! Around the hotel there are many restaurants and fast food to choose from. The main shopping area is located a block away. I would stay here again and recommend it to anyone who wants to stay in the middle of Amsterdam in a clean and comfy room. The rates are also very reasonable, June 2009 I paid 90 euros a night.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel, in the heart of Amsterdam.”
Reviews.Author: Snowman8931
Reviews.Content: Again, a great hotel. A great team gives you personal and top services. And..... compliments for lovely breakfast. I enjoyed my stay enormous. Kind regards, Sieno van der Wal

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value & location”
Reviews.Author: FooFoodoodoo
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel, very clean and the staff were very friendly. Although on our 1st night our sleep was disturbed on and off due to some idiots randomly beeping their car horns in the streets below. The following 2 nights however, were not as noisy and we didn't notice the same amount of noise. We didn't expect to have much sleep in Amsterdam but the sleep we did get was very comfortable. We managed to get a deal with breakfast included and are glad because the food was lovely, with a selection of english and continental breakfasts. Location wise, it was spot on, round the corner from the tram stop and close enough to walk to many of the attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Not a 4* experience and would not pay full price but great location and overall good stay!”
Reviews.Author: MillyMiss
Reviews.Content: After reading many of the reviews for this hotel i was slightly unsure about booking this hotel, however after finding it for the bargain price of Â£67 a night for a double room i thought i would give it a go. We booked for 3 nights... Many people had commented on the staff. When checking in we were given the option of a double bed in a non smoking room or 2 twins pushed together (fairly common im told) in a smoking room. We went for the proper double and were pleased to find out our room was ready despite arriving early. Unfortunately when we got to our room, we found that we had actually been allocated the twin bed option with 2 single duvets. Our second encounter with the same lady occured when trying to book a canal cruise for the evening. We had booked another excursion with a gentleman the day before, however, when trying to book a cruise for our last evening the receptionist told us it would be easier to book ourselves. After telling her we were heading in the opposite direction for the day, she told us we would be able to book one if we just headed to central station that evening... needless to say we were told that we should have booked and never got to do a canal trip. Having said that, the other staff were brilliant... friendly and one gentleman on reception went out of his way to find a local fondu restaurant after the one we had planned on visiting had shut down. The room room was small, basic and a little tired, but clean and perfectly adequate for the time we spent there. We had no real view as our room faced the back of the hotel but we spent very little time there so it wasnt a problem. The bathroom was again small but everthing we needed (basic toiletries were also supplied, but nothing fancy). I found a hair in the bath on the first day, but apart from that it seemed to be fairly clean. Breakfast was included, and each morning there was a good selection of breads, pastries, cereal, fruits and a small cooked breakfast selection. Although we ate breakfast there every morning, there is a huge selection of cafes serving breakfast, brunch and snacks just a short distance from the hotel. The location is fantastic! I didnt realise quite how small Amsterdam was, but everything is within 15- 20 minutes walking distance from the hotel. Central Station, Anne Franks House, the Van Gough Museum and the Heineken experience are all close by... and although we never needed to use them, the trams are frequent and apparently pass all the major attractions. All in all i wouldnt say this hotel is up to 4*standard. After being an air hostess and being lucky enough to have stayed in 4* hotels all over the word , i say it was more a 3*... however, if you can grab a bargain with this hotel and your not planning on spending much time there, then its a great place to base yourself while you explore Amsterdam!

Reviews.Title: “WORST FRONT DESK STAFF EVER!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: J8J812
Reviews.Content: I have never seen such unfriendly, clueless, rude, and unpleasant reception staff in a hotel like at the NH Carlton. They answered every question with a sense of arrogance and a feeling of just wanting to get rid of you. They did not give us a single correct answer as far as location of attractions and transportation. It seemed like these people were tourists just like us. They're front desk staff is responsible for answering the house phone and dealing with reception guests. The phone is their #1 priority because each time it rang we would need to wait for them to finish. Listening to the answers they gave the guests on the phone was simply shocking. Raising their voice and acting completely rude to one person left us standing their thinking if we made a mistake choosing this hotel. our check-in process took 25 minutes since the phone rang about 6 times. Overall these people are completely clueless as far as customer service and hospitality are concerned.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Great Location.”
Reviews.Author: mad4shoes
Reviews.Content: This was our third stay in Amsterdam so we know our way around and this is as good a location as you could wish for. although centrally positioned we were pleased by how quiet our room was. OK the view was to the rear of the hotel overlooking an office complex courtyard but it meant that it was away from the busy thoroughfare to the front of the building and the consequent noise of such a vibrant little city. We cannot comment on many of the facilities as we only used it as a place to crash; late nights and early breakfasts are not for us. We took only a standard room, not intending to spend much time there, but it was clean and tidy. The bathroom only had a shower but it worked perfectly, good pressure and temperature. If you wish to smoke there is a floor of such rooms available. The staff were all very courteous and despite us arriving early allowed us to store our luggage until our room was available, on departure they again looked after our cases until we were ready to leave on our evening flight home.

Reviews.Title: “Gross”
Reviews.Author: babezilla
Reviews.Content: Gross. This place looks and smells like a US airport Sheridan built in the 1970s. We booked this hotel on Orbitz. When we first checked in the front desk the woman kept asking for a voucher. All we had was our print out from Orbitz. The exchange were she kept asking for the voucher was an unplesant experience. Then we go up to our room... There are holes in the walls in the hallways, torn wallpaper, and a horrible smell. We got in the room and sat on the bed and the nice white bedcover was punctuated with pubic hair. The room was tiny. We asked to look at a deluxe room and it was not much better. Same torn wallpaper, bad smell, but larger room and bathroom. We left immediately for another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Gd location and clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: pazaboy
Reviews.Content: Gd hotel close to all attractions and nightlife, all within walking distance. Rooms were clean and spacious. All modern with TV, tea and coffee facilities. Would defo stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, rooms are excellent,the perfect place to explore amsterdam.”
Reviews.Author: bazanlin
Reviews.Content: Arrived on the Friday night,20th November, easy to get to hotel either by train/tram or by taxi. Where upgraded to superior rooms on arrival(didn't have to ask) and they were very modern,clean and spacious.Bar and restaurant in hotel is very good, choice of food is varied and the same price as most places in the city.Can't ask for a better hotel for location for ease of walking to most of the good bars,restaurants and museums,canals etc.Shower pressure in bathroom is not great, but is no big deal.When you arrive hotel will swipe your credit/debit card for security or any add ons you incur,and this does debit 100 euros from your available balance, but is back on your balance within a couple of working days.We went B&B, but there are plenty of good little cafes around the viscinity of the hotel for breakfast.Go on a canal cruise if you can, they are really good especially the ones with drink served onboard, good laugh.

Reviews.Title: “It's not a 4 star hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Welikegoodhotels
Reviews.Content: We had such a trouble looking for a hotel in Amsterdam, after reading all the reviews on this site as well as the comments from our friends.But we were lucky that we had extra miles to spend so we decided we would at least take a Superior room at this hotel. One thing we would mention is that the shower was terrible. There's scarcely a power coming from the shower, so we were still freezing cold after the shower. We even had whirlpool function in the bathtub, but the tap was broken, so we tried filling the tub with the scarce water that was coming from the shower. And why would there only be just a single bath towel? We were there for only a weekend and were outside the whole day so we lived with that, but we'll take something else the next time we're there.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: NH1970
Reviews.Content: This hotel is next to the Flower Market, in a great location for exploring the city. The room was clean and comfortable. Service was efficient. No complaints, it is in Amsterdam after all!

Reviews.Title: “Solid hotel in a great location at a bargain price...”
Reviews.Author: FollowYourDreamSF
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel via priceline at a great price of $63/night. It is in a very central location, so I could walk to many sights, shopping or restaurants in central Amsterdam. The rooms were in line with the photos, small (=average for European cities), clean and everything was in working order, but disappointing compared to other NH hotels. This property was acquired (previously Jolly Hotel) and doesn't have the hip designs of other NH hotels. The service was friendly and helpful, but slow during busy periods in the morning/afternoon. I didn't try their restaurant, because there are many choices within a short walk. Booking it through priceline made it a great value. At the standard internet rates, I would probably consider other hotels.

Reviews.Title: “great deal, even better location”
Reviews.Author: brand-eye
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a great location, right in the center of town. We booked it through priceline and got a good deal. We stayed here at the beginning and end of a trip to Prague and the first room we had was great. It had two balconies and incredible views over the city. We requested the same room for our second stay, and sadly didn't get it. We did however get a room with a balcony (our friends did also) and the balcony was discustingly dirty. The balcony had a great view and could have been an asset to the room, but instead it was too dirty to enjoy. Lots of cigarette butts and must have not been cleaned with soap and water in a decade, at least. Inside the room was clean.

Reviews.Title: “Quality, nice spacious comfortable room in great location near flower markets”
Reviews.Author: marnie_g2001
Reviews.Content: Check in and out - very easy - Nice helpful interested duty manager who allowed us into out rooms early in the morning. Quality bedding and facilities, nice shower, view over side streets. Location next to flower markets and easy access to all sites and city centre. Trendy bars and restaurants are closeby. Email the hotel and check the cost of taxi to the hotel - we were charged double the recommended rate. The hotel made sure they organised the return taxi at the right cost for us. Complimentary 15 minutes free internet. Nice little hotel bar for drinks. I recommend Anne Frank Museum, Reijkesmussen Museum and do the New Europe Free Amsterdam historical tours which leave from the centre of town/ or pickup in front of Tourist Bureau in fron tof main station - bright lively tours by young people who love to entertain - give them a good tip! Check out the interesting red light district and LA PLACE - incredible inexpensive fresh food paradise for breakfast lunch or dinner or coffee and cake!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, lovely staff”
Reviews.Author: mrsmcdonald2b
Reviews.Content: Hotel was in fantastic location, right next to the flower market and Rembrandt Square which meant there were food outlets nearby so we weren't forced to eat in the expensive hotel restaurant. It was only a 15 minute walk to the heart of Amsterdam and found it to be the perfect location as it was far enough away from the hustle and bustle to be quiet but close enough that we could walk to the centre without problem. The staff were extremely friendly and helpful and did everything they could to make our stay flow easily. The decor of the rooms wasn't great as it was just a bit outdated but we didn't really take any notice as it was just a base to sleep!

Reviews.Title: “Location, room & staff good but had phone bill issues”
Reviews.Author: ashenc
Reviews.Content: I just got back from a week in Amsterdam at this hotel. The reception went well and they had the room ready for me when I arrived at 10:30am. I've been to Europe many times and this is always welcome after a long red eye flight. I asked for a room with a view and they gave me a "quiet view" facing Reguliersdwarsstraat (street on the back side of the hotel). When we got up to the room, we found it small but sufficient. Two twin beds pushed together, a decent sized bathroom, mini bar fridge, coffee making facilities, nice black-out drapes and one extra pillow....I've stayed in worse. There was, unfortunately, no safe in the room. If you need a safe, you have to get one down in the lobby (it's free) and an attendant has to let you in the safe vault room, so plan ahead if you need to use the safe. The room window opens, which is nice since the room can get stuffy, especially after showering. The window is also fairly soundproof but since Reguliersdwarsstraat has a few clubs that go until the wee hours of the morning, expect to occasionally hear noise. One downside, I always buy a phone card to make calls back to the States while away. I was told by reception that using a phone card with the hotel phone is free. However, when I checked out, reception told me that I had to pay 1.50 euros everytime I got an outside line from my room. I made quite a few calls which resulted in a shocking bill. A couple checking out before me was also surprised when they had to pay a phone bill as well. Be warned! I have no other problem with the Nh Carlton other than the phone issue. In fact, I would rate this hotel a little higher if this didn't happen. They should tell everyone upfront, especially when asked about the phone like I had done! Other than this, the staff was friendly, the housekeeping service was very good and the location of the hotel is great. Here's a few tips: The Thai restaurant on Reguliersdwarsstraat, Phuket, is very good and reasonably priced. Also, if you walk down Reguliersdwarsstraat, on the back side of the hotel, you will reach Koningsplein where you'll find an Albert Heijn supermarket. Among most things that you would want, it sells pretty cheap sandwiches and beer. Also, if you go to Amsterdam in the summer, try Zandfoort beach, west of Haarlem. It's a really impressive beach resort about 30 minutes from the Central Station and 9.10 euros roundtrip by train.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly average hotel in the center of Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: SomervilleReisender
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for two nights through Priceline with a bid of $60 per night. It proved to be perfectly adequate: room clean enough, fast though expensive Wifi, limited TV channels. I would stay here again for a bargain, but not at full price. Could walk to everything from here. Easily accessible by tram, too. Right near the floating flower market. Excellent vegetarian falafel just diagonally across the street was the best part of the stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location & good for the price, but needs some updating!”
Reviews.Author: TorontoMac
Reviews.Content: Easy access from the central train station (3rd stop on the trams). Great central location right next to the flower market. City is totally walkable from this location. Room was tired (stained carpet, bathroom marble discolored, etc.) but still comfortable. Breakfast buffet very expensive unless you like to bulk up to start the day! Could hear the elevator motors whining at night due to the room's proximity to them, but otherwise quiet. Pros outweigh the cons.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: RichRamblesOn
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a long weekend in Amsterdam. We didn't get off to a great start as when we arrived we were given a room which was a twin with the beds pushed together instead of a double (a common thing in europe but still not ideal). The room decor was also a bit dated and there was a faint smell of smoke when we asked for non-smoking. When we aked to be moved all the rooms were full with it being a busy saturday night. However they moved us straight away the next day to a much nicer room with a queen size bed for the remaining 2 nights. The reception staff were really helpful over this so we couldn't really complain. We had breakfast included which was everthing we needed - cereal/sausage/bacon/continental/fruit/cakes! Location was great - right next to the flower market, only 10/15min walk from the main shopping streets, dam square, red light etc. Overall really happy and had a great weekend

Reviews.Title: “Always ask for a smoking room”
Reviews.Author: suguisugui
Reviews.Content: We got to Amsterdam very late and they weren't able to give us a smoking room inmediately, so the plan was to spend the first night in a non smoking room and then change the following day. What happen? The room they gave us was so big and nice, we just decide to stay in the suite-like-room they assigned to us the first night. The staff was very friendly and helpful and is located just beside the flower market. Excellent choice!

Reviews.Title: “U2 in Amsterdam--even the hotel was amazing”
Reviews.Author: mattydevans
Reviews.Content: I arrived for a 4 day trip from America to see friends and to see U2 at the Amsterdam Arena. I tried to check in my room at 8am but was told it was not available. They have signs that you can upgrade for $25/night and I asked if I could upgrade for this night so I could shower and go to bed. He said he had nothing available so I checked my bag and went to Barney's for a great breakfast and morning smoke. I came back at 11am and they gave me a room on the top floor with a large balcony. Everything was positive about the experience except for having to pay for Internet serv ice but my company will reimburse me so all in all, I highly recommend this hotel. Room was clean and comfortable and bathroom was great if you do not require a tub. Service was very understated and excellent. I will stay here again if the prices are competitive.

Reviews.Title: “I enjoyed it.....”
Reviews.Author: yorom
Reviews.Content: Good hotel next to the flower market... about a 15 minute walk to Central train station but the Muntplein tram station is a 2 minute walk to hotel. My room was very comfortable and quiet with a nice enough balcony. I got a very good rate for this room. The published rate for my dates was â‚¬184 and I would NEVER have paid that much even if Amsterdam is one of the most expensive city in Europe in my opinion.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location but some refurbishment's needed”
Reviews.Author: athenor84
Reviews.Content: Stayed here at the NH Carlton in late October 2008 for a leisure trip with a friend. I booked this hotel with a "roulette formula" on lastminute.com (you book at a very discounted price without knowing the name of the hotel, just price, location, category and features). Location is excellent, you are next to the shopping street of Kalverstraat, in a few minutes walking you can get to Rembrant, Spui and Leidse Square and in 15 minutes you get to Dam Square and the touristy red-light-district (tip: try to avoid it and don't miss the fancy neighbourhood ot Joordan). Staff is very friendly, mostly Italians at the desk (when I've been there the hotel had just been bought by NH from the Italian chain Jolly), check-in was very easy and fast, we bought an upgrade to a superior room for few Euros more per night and got an average-sized room on the last floor with a glorious view of the lovely Muntplein (windows can be opened). Rooms are very comfortable even if the business-style-forniture is definitely old-styled, no flat screens here and decent minibar; my true only complain was about the bathroom: very small (refrain: not cozy, small), dark (only two built in lamps), closet behind the door (hope no one will open the door while you're in or you'll get hurt) and shower with an old fashioned curtain (sorry I hate them). I'd suggest this property only if you are looking for an excellent location and friendly staff, (they often offer good bargain rates) otherwise you can get better value for money elsewhere in town (until they'll refurbish the rooms and the building).

Reviews.Title: “will definitely stay here again”
Reviews.Author: michaelf100
Reviews.Content: I have a client in Amsterdam and travel there on a weekly basis. I normally stay in NH Caransa but it was full at the time of the booking . This is the fifth NH hotel in Amsterdam/Schiphol airport area I have stayed at and probably one of my favorites. My accommodation is booked using our company travel agent. Unfortunately their system and that of NH Hotels isnâ€™t quite compatible. As a consequence my reservation doesnâ€™t always end up in the NH system *sigh*. This was also the case on this trip, but the young lady at the reception was kind enough to organize a room for me. The room (725)was on the 7th floor facing the intersection and canals. The view from the 1st balcony , yes there are two, are great. The second balcony is located of the bathroom and will give you a view of the city while in the shower. The room itself is quite large for Amsterdam standards with a separate walk in closet located in the back of the room. The bathroom again was quite spacious and fitted with a bidet and jet bubble bath, which I have yet to find at the other NH hotels in the city. Another feature not found in the NH Doelen, NH Caransa or NH Schiller is the movie on demand options on the TV. Ok most travelers will probably be out on the town rather than in their room watching TV, but thought it was worth a mention for the business travelers and families with kids. Something I found convenient was a separate room located near the elevator/lift for ironing clothing. It saved me having to call for an ironing board and iron to be brought up to my room. As mentioned in other reviews the breakfast is not the cheapest around at â‚¬20. The selection in the buffet is satisfactory but nothing special. I didnâ€™t use the restaurant for any other meals during my stay so I canâ€™t comment on the service or food. There are variety of places to eat in close vicinity of the hotel to cater to everyoneâ€™s taste ranging from Argentinean steakhouses to Sushi bars. The staff were courteous and helpful throughout my stay. All in all I enjoyed my stay and will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “amazing”
Reviews.Author: docgr
Reviews.Content: very good hotel, staff are fantastic, very clean. We were given a free upgrade on our arrival without us asking. Room was amazing with a beautiful view. location is good too, just a few minutes on the tram to the main city centre. it was a lovely and relaxing holiday. Staff were very helpful with guidance and advice.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in excellent location!”
Reviews.Author: aknaz
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the NH Carlton over the May long weekend. Staff were terrific and always willing to help where possible. Our room was very nice and very comfortable. The room had been recently renovated. We looked over the canal and flower market. It could be a little noisy at times with stag parties cruising the canals on boats and the chiming of tower bells directly across from the hotel, but there is double glazed glass and I didn't have a problem sleeping at all. The hotel itself is in an excellent location, right by the flower markets. It placed us well to get around to the western part of Amsterdam (where Anne Frank's house is), as well as the southern parts of the city (Vondel Park and Van Gogh Museum). The central train station is about a 15 minute walk from the hotel, but you don't want to stay around the main train station as there isn't much there and it isn't the nicest part of Amsterdam. The trams are also really easy to use and there are stops about 200m from the hotel. A great hotel and would definitely recommend people stay there!

Reviews.Title: “Have stayed at this hotel on two separate occasions and would return again.”
Reviews.Author: donBarrie_Ontario
Reviews.Content: I travel around the world, far too frequently for even veteran road warriors. I prefer hotels with atmosphere and character as opposed to chains that are the "same room" "different city", and to have me as a repeat visitor is a pretty good endorsement. On this occasion I was actually booked by an agency (which I rarely do) in conjunction with a trade show. Much to my surprise and that of the hotel, the agency had me booked in for only three nights instead of five. The hotel was most courteous and accomodating in extending my stay without any hassle. I was surprised to read of another review that was so critical of their cooperation or lack thereof. Location wise this hotel is perfect, shopping, sight seeeing, fine dining are all within walking minutes. If attending a convention at RAI, the number 4 tram is a block away and puts you at the venue in 15 minutes. The restaurant is very acceptable.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for budget conscious travelers!”
Reviews.Author: Ami_and_Jeff
Reviews.Content: This hotel was recommended to us by two different friends. The hotel met our expectations. The room was clean and tasteful with a great view of the Amsterdam skyline. We got a room with a balcony. The balcony was small but worth it for our purposes. The only downside was that the staff steered us toward tour companies were not asking about. Instead of directing us toward Mike's Bike Tours when we asked, they tried to push us toward another company.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT BOOK THIS HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: LuluRLondon
Reviews.Content: We didn't get the opportunity to stay at the NH Carlton, despite booking and paying for it 6 weeks in advance. When we arrived at the NH Carlton we were told there were no rooms left and "the whole of Amsterdam is full". We actually thought the desk clerk was joking. It turns out, no they weren't. NH Carlton policy is to overbook rooms and 5 or 6 weekends a year this means people miss out on their room. NH Carlton sent us all the way back to the NH Airport hotel. Fortunately the NH airport hotel staff are wonderful and stood up for us and argued that we needed to have a hotel in the centre of town. After one night at the airport we managed to get back into the city (but not to the NH Carlton). Several times NH Carlton lied to our faces about all the NH hotels being fully booked. When we arrived at the airport hotel, they said NH Carlton hadn't actually booked us in there, but into a hotel even further out from town. We were so luck the airport staff took pity on us and let us stay. Do NOT book the Jolly Carlton if you want to actually stay there - chances are they will send you somewhere else and will treat you terribly in the process. NH as a chain was good, and both the two other NH hotels gave us the impression that they deal with the Carlton's stuff ups, and greediness, all the time.

Reviews.Title: “superb location and very comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Ruby2000
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as part of a special 69 euro deal where we booked not knowing which NH hotel we would be put in. We were really happy with the location and the hotel, though I wouldn't pay the full price! Location is very good, comfy beds, a kettle which is unusual in holland, nice bathroom, big room. Had we stayed for breakfast this was nearly as expensive as the room! Staff were very helpful and gave me free internet access to check in for my flight.

Reviews.Title: “Location & Price are RIGHT!”
Reviews.Author: JRalli
Reviews.Content: As everyone seems to echo...the location was outstanding. Really can't beat it nor for that price (if you really look you'll find some great deals for it). The rooms were super. Kettle to make tea, opening windows (BIG bonus!). There had once upon a time been smokers in the room, but no biggie to me, not bad at all. The shampoos and soaps are all really nice -- they smell like candy and they're nice bright colours. Great bathroom with an outlet that works for North American AND European plugs. Another major bonus. Would definitely stay here again. Also closer than close to Rembrandt Square which is a whole bunch of pubs and terraces. It became a headquarter for us!

Reviews.Title: “Very good location and service, but ask for a room not on the street”
Reviews.Author: valbert01
Reviews.Content: Our 3 night stay was very nice, except for the noise. Indeed our room was on the street side of the building, so you have to ask for a room on the other side of the building. . . Except for that, hotel is very nice, location is perfect between the museums,and the city center. The service is really nice also.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: lovetravelkaren
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Jolly Carlton at the last night when we were at Amsterdam. The room is clean, it has nice and elegant office desk, a big walk in closet and quite big bath room... The window is not facing the main street, so it is very quiet. The front desk gentlemen are very friendly and helpful. This four star hotel is much much better than the five star hotel Nh Grand Hotel Krasnapolsky. I would recommend this hotel to my friends for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: TravellingAussie79
Reviews.Content: We booked the NH Jolly Carlton in Amsterdam as one of the secret hotels on Lastminute. We paid Â£200 for 3 nights which wasn't bad. The hotel is in a good location. Only 3 tram stops away from the Central station, and right next to the flowers markets. It's easy to get around the city. The hotel itself was ok but nothing special. The room had a funny smell, the air-conditioning was really loud, the beds were hard, the mini-bar fridge was filthy and there were minimal toiletries left. The decor was ok though and have to say I liked the pillows (even the extra one we requested that was delivered with no pillowcase!). After all of those complaints I would have to say I was still satisfied that we got what we paid for! The staff were friendly although not that helpful when it came to recommending good places to go. Stay here if you can get a good deal, if not go elsewhere!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great staff”
Reviews.Author: shoeshopgirl
Reviews.Content: We stayed here recently. We found the hotel on the Aer Lingus website as one of the 'top secret hotels' so we got it for a really good rate. We didn't opt for b&b so I don't know what the hotel food is like. The hotel is right beside the flower market on a busy road. Our room was at the back of the hotel. The service was excellent from the second we arrived. The reception staff could not have been nicer. The hotel is really nice (the lobby etc) but our room was a bit of a let down. The decor was a bit dated and the bathroom was really small, but it was clean and comfortable. We had a double room (really it was two single beds pushed together and covered with one sheet). If travelling form the airport to the hotel, take a train into the central station (will cost aprox â‚¬4.50 each for a one way ticket). We took a taxi from central station to the hotel even though we knew it wasnt that far but we had bags and were really tired from the early start that morning. The taxi driver quoted us â‚¬15 but the fare only came to â‚¬12.50. Just check the fare with the driver before you get into the taxi. The hotel is really central (about 10min walk from Dam Square). There was a lot of noise from the street outside our room (and we were on the 3rd floor) at night (people spilling out from bars etc.) It sounded like our room windows were wide open even though they were shut. Rooms servcied daily ( bed made / towels changed etc). Tip: If you walk out the main entrance and turn right and then take the next right turn, there are a lot of nice restaurants on that street.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location, nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: braneout
Reviews.Content: Great location for walking and catching the trams. Bed was good, furniture in decent shape, plenty of hot water and a full bathtub (!). Food: Italian restaurant in hotel is good if a bit pricey; there's a great Asian takeout across the street and the V&D store 1/2 block away has huge lunch operation. Staff pleasant and multi-lingual. Only drawbacks: the windows let the unseasonable cold right through (the heater could knock down most of that), and the high-speed internet requires purchasing a separate code from the desk and is not fast. Would definitely stay again, as the price was good for Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent break”
Reviews.Author: GlasgowScotsman
Reviews.Content: Booked hotel via Lastminute.com. Was a bit worried after seeing some of the reviews but shouldn't have. Had an amazing time despite the freezing weather and the hotel and staff added to this. All staff from front of house to cleaning staff were extremely pleasant and couldn't do enough for us!! Even though we were not guaranteed a specific room, we sent an email two days before arrival and got exactly what we requested- without having to pay any extra. I would have no hesitation returning to the Jolly Carlton and hope to do so in the near future. A wonderful hotel in an excellent location, with superb staff - what more could you ask for.

Reviews.Title: “Disapointed”
Reviews.Author: Elizza
Reviews.Content: I was extremly disapointed with the standard of our rooms, upon entering the gorgeous lobby we had high expectations of what our rooms would look like. Apart from the bathroom it was more like a cheap b+b room than a suposedly 4 star experiance. Not only were the rooms unpleasing to the eye but there was a horrible lingering smell of stale smoke. If you go 4star you expect it to be of good quality and quite a high standard. If I was going back to Amsterdam I would choose a different hotel. On the plus side it is in a good location and the staff were helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “A good time was had by all...”
Reviews.Author: Ninja23
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Jolly Carlton christmas/new years 2007 and thought it was great. Everyone was very helpful and polite, the room was a little small, but served the purpose. I had a beautiful view of the street and nicolas church, and eventhough the hotel is right in the party/clubbing district i had no problems with noise or disturbance. great location within easy walking distance of the flower market, shopping area, restaurants, rembrandtsplein and much more. the breakfast is a bit expensive (costing 20 Euro) but a great big delicious buffet with everything imaginable. I am going back there this year for my christmas holiday and I am really looking forward to it.

Reviews.Title: “MASSIVE reconstructive surgery needed. Neither cheap nor cheerfull.”
Reviews.Author: 7DegreesOfWonderment
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on the nights of November 9th and 10th 2008. We were VERY sad to have left the excellent 5 star we had just stayed in (reveiew here) yet as this hotel had been pre-payed we were obliged. We upgraded to a very large delux room out of necessity as soon as we saw how tired, small and pokey the standard room was. Time travel in the worst sence not only in decor but in that it reminded me of ropey hotels i had stayed in when travelling as a student. Nostalgia of the unwelcome kind. This former Jolly hotel (an italian chain) was purchaced by the spanish group NH two years ago but it seems that not a euro has been speant to give it a very needed facelift - this place is way past botox helping. It is classed as a fourstar but in this day and age it is rather a poor big akward 3 star. Class it as a budget travelling experience that is neither cheap nor cheerfull. One member of the mainly Italian staff was very helpful and friendly whilst the others were much less charming or efficient than they could have been. Desipte our informing them of our arrival at 15hrs on the sunday afternoon the day before our room was not ready before 17h30 !! A complimentary drink to apologise went someway to reducing our dissappointment. The corridors are dusty, old and depressing as was our room despite its spaciousness. The bathroom was small by modern standards and the shower curtain too short which soaked the floor after two showers. We were informed that housekeeping was off duty after 17hrs so the floor would remain like that till the next morning. Fresh towels were provided however. The complimentary toileteries, though seeming modern with their vivid colours, stank. The bed was uncomfortable which rendered the modern 'lifestyle' approach of a pillow menu totally futile and incongruous. The room was realy cold at night. There is no roomservice after 22h. Beware, incidentals were really expensive, Internet accces was 22 euros aday. Parking 80 Euros for two days and the minibar, badly appointed and a rip off. Over all this hotel needs to decide whether it become a cheaper budget hotel or a more luxurious destination .. in either case it needs a LOT OF MONEY SPENT TO MAKE IT A PLEASANT PLACE TO STAY. The location is good however and we had a good view over the bustling flower market. Ill be giving the NH Carlton a miss .... until at least i have heard of its having undergone massive reconstructive surgery.

Reviews.Title: “Good Choice”
Reviews.Author: Stacielea
Reviews.Content: We were very happy with this hotel. I was perfect location, short walk to a lot of the popular areas. The hotel staff were very friendly and helpful. We stayed in one of the Standard rooms and it was a good size and very comfortable. The only problem we had was the first night our room was very very hot (turns out the hotel had the central heating on). We tried to open the window but it was only the 2nd floor and right on the street so we couldnt sleep. When we told the front desk the next morning they were very apologetic and offered to swap rooms for us. The new one was much better, on the 6th floor and a lot cooler. I would definetly stay here again and recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Safe choice, good location”
Reviews.Author: tuomok
Reviews.Content: Spent few nights there in September 2008 together with my wife. Nothing spectacular; basic hotel, clean but not very spacious standard rooms, standard amenities: minibar, nice bed (with a neat bonus: they had few pillow types to choose from with tiny samples in the room). Breakfast was pricey (20e) but comprehensive and it was set in a nice restaurant hall, with natural morning sunlight flooding in. Location of the hotel is great: Rembrantplein just 150metres away and 10 minutes walk to the Dam, 20 to central station. Trams and taxies were quick to catch directly in front of the hotel. Basicly hassle free, safe choice. There are a lot more dodgier hotels in Amsterdam...

Reviews.Title: “finally, a good hotel in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: NevadaSteven
Reviews.Content: We go to Amsterdam every year, and it's been difficult to find a good hotel at a reasonable price. Even so-called luxury hotels don't measure up to first class hotels in other cities. The Jolly Carlton was a very pleasant surprise. Check in and overall service was great. We were even offered a free room upgrade. The room was spacious, and the bathroom was clean and modern with nice amenities.. The hotel is steps from the Rembrandtplein, around the corner from the flower market and a short walk to the Leisdeplein. Considering the location, it was fairly quiet as well..We'd definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Good Quality Hotel”
Reviews.Author: garymich
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights at the end of May and couln't fault hotel. 25th wedding anniversaryso booked a deluxe room which had fantastic view over Muntplein. Did not eat at the hotel but there are plenty of cafes within 5 minutes walk for breakfast etc. Previous reviewers have mentioned the noise but despite overnight work on the road outside were not kept awake and indeed if you closed the windows you could not hear a sound. Short walk from the hotel to everything Amsterdam has to offer. Ate out most nights on Utrechsestraat which has bars and restaurants frequented by local amsterdammers unlike the tourist traps nearer the centre.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: WLDGlasgow
Reviews.Content: I stayed here at the beginning of May with 9 friends. I thought the location of this hotel was excellent - close to all the main attractions and easy to walk everywhere from. It is situated right next to the flower market. My room was average sized, clean and did the job well, it had a small balcony with a nice view. I found the staff friendly and helpful and all in all had no complaints. Was quite good value for the money. My friends and I had a fabulous weekend in Amsterdam and the Jolly Carlton served us well.

Reviews.Title: “horrible<horrible hotel”
Reviews.Author: TravelingMan415
Reviews.Content: How exciting, a couple of days to check out Amsterdam and figure out what to do next time you are in town with more time. If you need a hotel, I STRONGLY urge you to look elsewhere. I am sitting here writing this at 8AM after my 3rd sleepless night. When I say, sleepless, I mean sleepless. Seems the neighborhood is the center of a major partying district and they are at it until the sun comes up. I mean till 6AM, there is screaming, yelling, honking horns, police sirens and partiers in the hall way. If this is your idea of fun, have at it. The property is dated and funky, rugs in hallways are torn and unrepaired. Rooms are small and bathrooms are moldy and with hardware falling off the wall. This place needs to add double windows for noise, get security guards to calm down the party in the streets and hallways and NEVER put someone near the street side on a Thurs, Fri, or Sat night. Other nights it only goes until about 3AM. Front desk doesn't do anything and for your $300/night you are on your own and without sleep. Definetally DO NOT recommend this hotel until they fix their problems which is not likely.

Reviews.Title: “Awful!”
Reviews.Author: worldtravellers91
Reviews.Content: Terrible stay at this hotel. We were put in a converted meeting / conference room. Not a very good conversion either. We were sleeping on a camper bed which was practically on the floor. It wasn't made for the room as there were no bedside tables either. Really uncomfortable and hard to get on and off the floor, as it was so close to the ground. When we asked if it could be made higher, the answer was if you can't do it yourself, neither can we.... There was even the little kitchenette off the room, as it was a meeting room. But not useful for us, as completely empty, not for the guests to use. Check in and out experience was just as bad. Rude front office staff. Will not stay here again. Were still charged full room rates.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Camden
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Jolly April 9th to April 17th,2008. We had a non-smoking room on the 5th floor. The room looked like it had been recently renovated. The staff were very helpful. Mario, who handled our luggage was terrific. The location can't be beat. We were able to walk and take trams everywhere. The flower market is right out the door and we spent time looking at the flowers every day. We didn't eat breakfast in the hotel, but ate at some of the restaurants opposite the flower market. We will stay at the Jolly the next time we go to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Great location/rooms too hot”
Reviews.Author: JerseyBaanThai
Reviews.Content: I was late booking this hotel - needing to attend a conference at the Amsterdam Rai. Hotel is part of an Italian chain - Jolly, which is now part of a bigger Spanish chain -NH Hotels. Jolly Carlton is very centrally located for all sites, cafes and bars etc, but ask for room at the back of hotel - much quieter. I had a room on 7th (top) floor - good views and bonus of a balcony to sit on - room faced west so beautiful afternoon sun. Rooms are small but well equipped. Internet is based on a 24hr charge - so you pay during the night when asleep. I found the rooms very warm - no air con as advertised - this is purely a heating system - I slept with windows wide open - hence need for rear room. Bed firm but pillows lumpy - no pillow menu as is the case now in many quality chain hotels. I used the room service for 2 meals - excellent value and excellent quality of food and service. All staff top notch. Hotel clean and tidy. I would use again for location, price was reasonable, but I would want same room again for extra space outside to watch Amsterdam at night. Recommended. Steve

Reviews.Title: “Not so Jolly”
Reviews.Author: Ronilev
Reviews.Content: Hotel was very centrally located in a nice area. Lobby and public areas were very attractive. Breakfasts were excellent. Staff helpful. Sadly our room was small, dark and smelt of cigarette smoke, there was dust under the furniture. The bathroom, however was very good. The room overlooked a back street with a local disco which was very noisy at night, with passers by at all hours. I think we were unlucky as we apparently got one of the last rooms unbooked, so this was not a good room, although not cheap. I would advise checking the size and location of the rooms before booking and if there are any non-smoking. The hotel was acceptable, but next time I'll find somewhere else!

Reviews.Title: “A very average hotel to be avoided if looking for a good nights sleep”
Reviews.Author: Sidkrist
Reviews.Content: It's 6:30 am and I'm writing this review to vent a bit of my fustration of having been woken up now 5 times. I've called reception already 3 times and they are quick on getting the other guest to quiet down but there are really just too many party goers in this hotel. If you are coming to Amsterdam for a quiet relaxing weekend this is not the hotel for you.

Reviews.Title: “well positioned in relation to attractions”
Reviews.Author: DublinBernie
Reviews.Content: Stayed for four days in this hotel. Its well positioned in relation to attractions etc. However it is so overpriced. â‚¬7.50 for a small vodka from th mini bar, the hoel bar was only a euro less ans charged â‚¬7.00 for a beer. the hotel bar is soulless as is the rest of the hotel. It lacks all atmosphere and while staff are polite, friendly is not a description I would use. When we arrived we were shown to room 536. It was a nightmare even for a "standard" room. It was tiny and the view was a blank wall. We had to ask for upgrade asap couldnt spend the night in it. â‚¬25 per night to up to a superior room (533) three doors down but it was worth it. It was in no way luxurious, the carpet was even faded and patched. But at least we could walk about and had a view.Breakfast not great either you could have your eggs boiled or scrambled! So so! Poor choices. And another thing for a 4star hotel what are they doing using such cheap toilet tissue! It was dreadfull had to go and buy some! Have stayed in cheaper hotels in amsterdam and have received far better service.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in Central Location”
Reviews.Author: GEORGE&BELLA
Reviews.Content: If you want an upper mid-range Hotel in Amsterdam, look no further. Excellent location within easy walking distance of city sights. Red Light district after dark is something that has to be experienced. Huge number of great places to eat at reasonable prices and why does Heineken taste so much better in Amsterdam? Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “good location, within walking distance to everything”
Reviews.Author: tampatwo07
Reviews.Content: This hotel is within walking distance to everything. The price was fair compared to other hotels in the area. Some people might find the rooms a little small, but this is normal for the area. When entering our room there was a little bit of a smell, but overall the room was pretty clean. The hotel staff was polite and helpful and also spoke english. We would probably stay at this hotel again if we every return to Amsterdam, since it was close to the train station, and its a clean hotel for travelers on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and great service”
Reviews.Author: CherryGrower
Reviews.Content: The location cannot be beat. Its just across the canal and up the street from the Grand Amsterdam but a fraction of the price. Right next to the flower market and a few minutes walk from almost everywhere. The front desk staff were great and we really enjoyed our stay. Second time staying with the Jolly chain and were very pleased with both this hotel and their property in London. thanks Jolly!!!

Reviews.Title: “Jolly Good”
Reviews.Author: mikeyontour
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Jolly Carlton late November 07. Loved the location, being central to all major attractions. The flower market is right beside the hotel with the main museums, Ann Frank house etc all within easy walking distance. Great resteraunts and nite life exist right beside the hotel. Our favourite was the Argentinian Steak house around the corner in Reguliersdwarstratt. The steak was top notch. Service so friendly. The size of the standard rooms in the Hotel were a little small considering the price we paid, - â‚¬450 for 3 nights. They were clean and well kept and so this was a small gripe as the location and the friendliness of the staff were the main reason we liked this hotel. The only issue I have with this hotel is that they promote the Airport Shuttle bus as advertised on reception. We thought this would be a convenient and cost effective way to get us to the airport for our return home. Boy was I wrong, we arranged at reception to be picked up at 11am, but by 11.45am there was still no sign of the bus. The porters on duty were extremely apologetic and were concerned for us. They did admit that we were not the first people to be let down by this service. We were panicing at this stage, fearful that we would miss our flight. One of the porters hailed us a taxi on the street and we made a mad dash to the airport and made it on time. So moral of the story is, if you want a hassle free return journey home, avoid at all costs the airport shuttle bus that is advertised at this hotel and I imagine at other hotels in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Jolly Carlton Right Choice for Us”
Reviews.Author: DameKane
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel based on its location, which was the right decision for our 5-day visit. The view from our 6th floor room with a balcony and large French doors was nothing short of wonderful. We looked directly at the Munt Plein, and when it was lighted at night and the bells were chiming, the effect was exactly what we were looking for on this visit. When the doors were closed, and room-darkening draperies drawn, this deluxe room was quiet. The room was clean and the bathroom was updated and also very clean. The staff at the front desk (as well as the doormen) was helpful and courteous to us during our entire five days. We asked a lot of questions, and also needed their help making dinner reservations for us. All this was done immediately, and in a most pleasant manner. I found NO FAULT with the staff. This is an Italian hotel chain, and love being with Italians. I would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a full-service hotel in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Old facilities and Staff Not helpful”
Reviews.Author: Tonyloves
Reviews.Content: Although the hotel has no bad conditions, it is not worthwile the price. The problem is that in Amsterdam hotels are too expensive and it is difficult to find a better deal. Anyway, my experience is that: *Staff is not helpfull: -I asked twice to know about check-in of some friends and they didnot tell me. -I had to ask twice for another boiler because mine does not work. -I asked twice for extra-hagers (we was 3 people) and I couldn't get it them four days. -Bath ammenities were for two people and ours was a triple. *Old facilities: -dirty carpet -broken sheets. -Out of fashion facilities. -Don't disturb sign was electronic but doesn't work. *Others: -Not safebox in the room. -Expensive wireless not included -They charged our credit card for the whole stay the first day. -Luggage deposit not careful. They leaved a door to street open for a while! On the other hand, it has an excellent location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Deluxe View Rooms!”
Reviews.Author: AdventuresInEurope
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 3 nights in a Deluxe Room. We had a corner view that was really nice. The room was very spacious with a panaramic view of the Muntplein. We couldn't have asked for a better view. The room we stayed in was #331. The bathroom was spacious with 2 sinks and a good size tub with jets. The shower was very small. Every once in a while the water would get really hot. This was quite unpleasant and actually made me fear a hot shower, so I took a nice bath. Room service from the Carusso restaurant was really good. The Tortelloni with stuffed spinach and cheese was great at 14 euros. There is an 8 euro room service charge. Overall I like the location of the hotel very much. It's really hard to beat. And with the views from the Deluxe rooms, it would be hard to not stay here everytime. I paid 189 euros a night. Also there is a sign at check in that will let anyone upgrade their room to a superior or deluxe for 25 and 50 Euros.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: harts0n
Reviews.Content: Just came home from Amsterdam. Spend four nights at the Jolly Carlton. This was the first trip to Amsterdam for both me and my girlfriend. The hotel got a great location, from the central station it`s approximately 7 euro with taxi. It takes about 15-20 minutes to walk to the Anne Frank house, 10 minutes walk to the red light district, and a 10 minutesâ€™ walk to the canal cruise. The hotel: As I said, this was my first trip to Holland. So I didnâ€™t know what to expect regarding hotel standard. The lobby was quite nice, and the woman we spoke to on arrival made an ok first impression. As all Dutch people they hotel staff spoke English very well. We got a room at the fifth floor. The street outside the hotel lobby is quite busy, so I was happy to see we got a room with a view the other direction. But, the street outside our window was quite noisy during the night. Not much traffic at all, but there were people going to nightclubs (and home again) all night long. If you close the window, it`s not a big problem, but then again it`s much too warm. My body temperature is quite different from my girlfriend, I thought the hotel room was a sauna, but my girlfriend found the temperature with the windows closed brilliant :) The room was quite nice, but not â€œstate of the artâ€�. The room was maybe a bit smaller then an ordinary room in Norway, but the size was no problem. The room was always very clean. I would recommend the Jolly Carlton hotel if you get a good deal.
