I donâ€™t know if it`s a four star hotel, because it`s hard to compare, because I have no other experience from hotels in Holland. Check out our pictures.

Reviews.Title: “great central location”
Reviews.Author: Reifl
Reviews.Content: stayed at the jolly carlton for 2 nights at the end of October 2007. Great central location near the floating flower markets. Easy access to shops , restaurants, trams etc. The hotel has an impressive lobby and helpful staff . We booked a standard double room as we were only there for 2 nights and didn't see the point of paying the extra 50 euro per night for a luxury room. The rooms were small but big enough for our short stay as we were only in the room a couple of hours as there is so much to do and see in Amsterdam. The only below average thing that I saw whilst staying at the jolly carlton were the "grotty" looking stairwell that didin't seem to belong to the rest of the hotel at all (as I have a fear of elevators I used the stairs daily, and I'm sure that I was the only guest at the hotel that used them). We opted out of paying for the breakfast as we felt it was very expensive for 20 euro each per day (lovely little cafe around the corner that does a full english for 8 euros each) Amsterdam itself is a lovely city with loads to see and do during the day and night. We pre booked an excursion for the Windmills and Edam tour which was a half day (4 hour) excursion It was a pleasant enough trip but we felt that we were being rushed from one place to the other and not having enough time to browse for souveniers in the the shops. Having arrived in Edam (beware shops are closed on Mondays) we only had 45 mins to have lunch and have a look around. We will definately be visiting Amsterdam again and will again stay at the Jolly Carlton because of the great central location.

Reviews.Title: “Had A Great Time”
Reviews.Author: TWNTI1
Reviews.Content: just come back from amsterdam been staying at the jolly carlton with friends for 3 nights, i was very impressed with the hotel and would recommend it to anyone, the hotel room was nice and clean and light, and the location was great, would recommend and will be going there to stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Great central hotel”
Reviews.Author: charlie1234
Reviews.Content: This hotel was really great, the rooms were clean, the reception was helpful and the location was excellant. Just round the corner from the floating flower market. We didn't eat in the hotel as there were plenty of restaurants nearby that appealed to us. Getting to and from the airport is easy you can either get on the hotel shuttle bus which was about 12 euros each which drops you off outside your hotel or you get the train from the airport then hop on a tram or get a taxi to the hotel. We would stay in this hotel again and would recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Be careful wit front rooms”
Reviews.Author: Ewsp
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Jolly Carlton for two nights. In some respects the hotel contradicts typical American hotels: The rooms are nicer than the lobby. The room was 4-star, although smaller than ordinary rooms on European 4-star hotels. The bathroom was 3-star. We had a room facing Vijzelstraat, which is very busy. Luckily the room was on the 6th floor. The hotel activates air conditioning according to the calendar, not according to outdoor temperature. If you are unlucky enough to have a room on one of the lover floors facing Vijzelstraat, and it is beautiful October weather, you are in trouble. The sun heats the room and the only way of cooling it down is by opening the windowâ€”where the traffic is. HINT: The hotel charges 20 Euros for breakfast. Go instead around the corner to one of the cafÃ©s facing the Flower Market and have an English breakfast for half the price.

Reviews.Title: “Never ever again!”
Reviews.Author: wendy007
Reviews.Content: Booked on internet and stayed here for one night. I chose this hotel because the pickings were slim due to a last minute travel decision, and I seem to recall I had stayed here a few years ago and found it nice. However, I was THOROUGHLY disappointed!! The hotel looks nice, but was really dated inside. Staff was rude - I asked for change to park my car, and they were really reluctant and then finally gave me a bunch of small coins although they had plenty of others. I mean, the least they could do for their guests was to welcome us upon our arrival!! The heat wasn't working properly and I was freezing all night. I asked for a non-smoking room but got a room that smelled like an old bar PLUS it smelled heavily of insecticide. Never again!

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad, Good Value, Dated but Clean”
Reviews.Author: mrjak1979
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 4 night stay at the Jolly Carlton. The Hotel itself isnt bad, I give it 3 stars out of 5 . The room we got was 2 beds, the beds are not that comfortable, definetly dated. The carpet, room furniture and TV are very dated. But most importantly everything was clean, sheets and bathroom included. The bathroom is actually very nice. We stayed in room 316 , which seemed very lucky since the view was excellent, opening up to a nice little street , and it had a terrace. Internet is expensive in the hotel at .35 Euro per minute. There were about 4 English networks on the TV. Location of the Hotel was superb. Bars,Coffee shops, flower market, shopping , and nice resturants very close. Almost everything is in walking distance - Including Red Light , museums , Brewery and Central Station. The Zoo was a bit of a walk but only because I think we got lost. I would reccomend this hotel for a short, budgeted stay. But if you could afford more and need to be pampered look elsewhere. I would equate it to a Holiday Inn or Best Western in the USA. There is room service from the Italian restaurant beneath the hotel, the restaurant has excellent Brick Oven pizza, there;s also a great Chinese resturant on the corner. There's a Dutch Supermarket called Albert Heijn that is a 2 minute walk and is a great place to pick up snacks for the room. All in all the hotel was satisfactory, the sanitized bathroom is the biggest selling point.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT hotel, great location, highly recommended!!!”
Reviews.Author: xichic
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel last minute, and I got SUCH a deal. I visit Amsterdam about 3 times a year, and this has been the best deal i have found so far -- the location and room at the price i paid ($120 a night) was an incredible value for Amsterdam. I was alone on this trip, so as a woman, i found the location to be central to all the shopping, the sights, restaurants, AND still felt safe walking around by myself, especially in the evening. The room was a king bed, comfortable, very clean room -- clean bathrooms, nice lobby, great staff. There is an internet room in the lobby (though pricey to use the computers, but at least it is available) overall experience was excellent due to location, service, and room quality

Reviews.Title: “Very central”
Reviews.Author: AndrewandJenny
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel with friends from 27 September - 1October. Overall it was a good experience. The room was comfortable - albeit a bit small - but we had the option of upgrading to a superior room for 25 euros. The staff were very friendly, particularly the bar staff, including a lovely Irish lady. The tea and coffee making facilities were a bonus for a European hotel, although the cups and spoons were a bit flimsy. Nice tea though. The location was excellent - just next to the floating flower market and close to Dam Square. We would stay there again, but might consider upgrading to a superior room next time if we could afford it.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean room”
Reviews.Author: joyh46
Reviews.Content: Staff friendly and helpful. Communal areas and bedroom clean. Reasonable size room (think it was a superior room). Furnishings very drab which made the room seem very dark. Good choice of english speaking channels on TV. Tea making facilities in room but plastic cups and powdered milk. Very good location - easy walking distance from most of the attractions. Overall a good experience, but would have expected a bit more for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean with helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Sandiuk
Reviews.Content: We booked for 4 nights in mid-September as we had previously stayed here 3 years ago. Since then the hotel has been given a face-lift. The rates were higher than normal (we booked through a NL hotel booking site online) due to a big conference taking place during the week but even though they were all busy, the staff were helpful and friendly. For an extra 25 euros a night you can upgrade on arrival to a superior room (50 euros for a deluxe) which is well worth doing if you can! We asked for a room at the front and found it was well sound proofed even though you had the trams and nightlife til late!

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: Melisa9
Reviews.Content: Excellent location! Right on the flower market canal. Rooms were clean and reasonably modern. The staff were helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Not a 4 star”
Reviews.Author: Renee B
Reviews.Content: Not a 4 star more like a 3. Our smoking room was basic with peeling and cracked wall paper/plaster. Ask for a room away from the main road otherwise you can hear the trams and cars ect until the early morning. Good location being next to the floating flower market and about 20 minutes walk to Dam Square. Literally round the corner from gay friendly bars and restaurants and coffee shops ect. Not very good choice in TV channels unless you want to spend 13 euros on watching a movie. No price list for the mini bar - a small toblerone was 4 euros i found out on check out. Make sure you have enough coffee and tea ect before housekeeping leave for the evening as although the staff are friendly didnt always have supplies Would stay there again because of the location but not because of the rooms - would first check the price of the Banks Mansion hotel first though.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Irishken
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately when I arrived the twin deluxe room I booked was unavailable. The hotel allocated me a standard twin room facing the rear of the property with a view of some offices and a brick wall at the back of the hotel, when I complained about the room I was informed that no deluxe rooms would become available during my stay. I was not offered any compensation for the lower standard of room but as I got a bargain (free upgrade to deluxe room and 20% discount) when booking the hotel, I was less inclined to let this spoil my trip. I feel the hotel gave me the room I paid for, a standard room with no view. The room was very clean and while not tiny it is small. The bathroom was a good size and the shower was hot and powerful. The location of this hotel was ideal within reasonable walking distance of most of Amsterdamâ€™s attractions. Rembrandtsplein is a 5 min walk and Dam Square is 15 min walk. The hotel is beside the Flower Market and is serviced by the No. 4 9 16 24 25 26 trams at Muntplein. The hotel is very clean and the staff very helpful not withstanding the error in room allocation. I would stay here again as the location is excellent for visiting Amsterdam, but I would have lower expectations on room size and quality.

Reviews.Title: “What a place!”
Reviews.Author: katyd22
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 3 night stay at the Jolly Carlton in Amsterdam and I can honestly say it was one of the best hotels I have ever stayed in. On arrival we were upgraded to a double deluxe room free of charge and received a good friendly reception. The room was spacious and ultra clean with nice touches that confirmed its 4 star rating. The location was brilliant as the hotel lies between dam square and leidesplein with rembrandtsplein on your doorstep. I booked the hotel through [--] and found a great deal at 317 euros for three nights. Had I not got this deal the rooms would have perhaps been a little pricey. Overall great service and location - would definitely recommend!

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: TopTrump
Reviews.Content: great hotel in a great district of amsterdam yet still close enough to all the main attractions to not be out if it. near to the rembrandt square area which is full of bars, coffee shops and restaurants, all of which are really nice, not seedy in anyway and are tourist friendly. Hotel is very clean and spacious, with courteous staff. Didn't have breakfast there as prefer to venture out to tast local treats, and i think i chose wisely. Big local presence which makes you feel like you are on holiday and not trapped in a tourist loop. best place i've stayed in amsterdam

Reviews.Title: “great location, average room”
Reviews.Author: worldwidevan
Reviews.Content: It was a bit confusing when I booked the room on the hotel website as later on I found that the hotel has 2 separate websites. I have not been given a reservation number in the replying email. So I have to make international phone call to make sure the booking is confirmed. (**Use the website which has more details when you make the booking**) We safely arrived and the room (standard) is average. The room is facing the main street with tramlines but with windows closed it is perfectly quiet. The room is a bit small but the beds are very comfortable. Apart from the size there is nothing much to complain. The location is brilliant as it is at the centre of the attractions. It is just next to the tramlines so you can go to anywhere very easily.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: little-del
Reviews.Content: Our stay here was great, the location is ideal for enjoying the city. As for the rooms we only had a standard room, it was small but perfectly clean and comfortable. We did not eat in the hotel as breakfast can be found cheaper elsewhere. The small restaurant is reasonable priced but the main restaurant is much more expensive. You have to pay a deposit on arrival if you dont have a credit card. Then the city tax is paid on check out. Overall the room was expensive for what you get but most hotels in amsterdam as priced high.

Reviews.Title: “not what we expected”
Reviews.Author: phingask
Reviews.Content: This was our 2nd visit to Amsterdam, the 1st was a wonderful experience so the standard set was high. Although the hotel itself was clean and the room spacious we found the staff uninterested and unfriendly. Not a lot of smiling faces here, and when we went up to our room after breakfast on the 3rd day we found our key card didn't work. At reception we were told we were down for checking out - we had another 4 days left! - but even so 10am was not the check out time. Staff seemed to tolerate us but not welcome us, so we will not be recommending this hotel or staying with this group again. Last year we were at the Crown Plaza - go there!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and cool hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Chef_Scott
Reviews.Content: I was a little concerned after booking this hotel and reading some of the reviews....but my concerns fell away once I got there. Contrary to what one reviewer said, this hotel IS in a GREAT LOCATION for sightseeing around Amsterdam. You're right next to Munt Tower, the medieval gate to the old city, and also right next to the floating flower market, and within walking distance of Vondelpark, the Van Gogh museum, Anne Frank house, red light district, etc etc. The only time we took a taxi was when it was raining incredibly hard and we had to get to the supper club cruise at the docks (behind Central Station) in a short period of time. As for the amenities: the room wasn't large by US standards, but it was comfortable, had a high tech clean bathroom, had a large bay window that opened entirely so you could people watch on the streets below or have a good North Sea breeze coming in (we slept with it open). It had a cool large triangular mirror in the room. The only problem we had at all was that the plug in the bathroom (the only one we could use with our converter) didn't work, so I couldn't recharge my video and digital cameras--luckily with efficient use I stretched their capacity through the entire vacation. Every day we had really tasty italian candies placed in our room after it was cleaned. The staff were mostly italian but we didn't have any language difficulties with them at all, as they spoke english fairly well. Don't expect to have ice machines in Europe btw--but you can get ice at the bar in this hotel--the bartender will give you a bag with some. All in all we really liked this hotel and we'd definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place To Stay”
Reviews.Author: wildeman
Reviews.Content: The hotel was so nice and clean. It was one of the bigger hotels I stayed at while in Europe. It is located in a great spot with very short walking distances to all of the city's attractions. Don't believe any negative responses about this place. It is a chep price for a great hotel room. Huge bathroom and very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Comfy Hotel”
Reviews.Author: alli-scotland
Reviews.Content: I have never had a bummy hotel, they have all been great. I have stayed in 'The Jolly Carlton' 'The Luxor' 'GT hotel Inntel' 'the Lacanna'. The Jolly Carlton is very comfy and quite plush. I loved all the little extras like dressing gowns and slippers. Breakfast was great. One tip though, its a lot cheaper to book hotel at last minute, as opposed to the airlines being the opposite- they are cheaper to book in advance. One thing that spoiled this hotel. I asked for a nice view and I got a view of a deserted alleyway. It was not good.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: KimberlyAZ
Reviews.Content: The staff and hotel desk were wonderful, we had a great room, which was large, clean and comfortable. Staff were great, location was perfect. Would recommend and will definitely stay there again. Would definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: ellesmac
Reviews.Content: paid 129.00 euro per standard room per night thro the hotel website. After reading the reviews I was abit apprehensive about this hotel however I cannot fault the location. Get the conexion shuttle bus from airport to hotel- will cost you 19 euros return but handy if you dont want the hassle of hauling luggage around and trying to find your own way or want to save time or both! Check in was ok...reception guy refused to acknowlege that I sent him an email requesting a nice room with a nice view if possible but was not gonna let it ruin my midweek break- we got a standard room with no view on 6th floor, bit stuffy, could have done with better air conditioning as it was hot, the room was small but clean. Cannot fault the location as per previous reviews right beside the flower market and within walking distance to everywhere of interest. Hot Tip: come out of hotel turn right to the corner of that road and you will find a great chinese restaurant called P King-good food good value and interesting people watching!Great place just to chill! Even cheaper, wok to work, wok to go etc: great little takeaway noodle bars if your watching your pennies! Amsterdam is not that big and there are loads of budget hotels near the train station in the centre just watch out for pick pockets! Canal cruising is the way to see amsterdam-try the hop on hop off boat however start out early as they finish around 6pm cost:17 euro

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: cookie34
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 2 night stay at the Jolly Carlton, I can honestly say we had no complaints at all. The room was on the 7th floor with a balcony, it was clean, we got checked in no problem and the staff in the hotel were friendly and helpfull. Its in a great location, 5-10 min walk from Dam square, and right next to the flower market. We didnt eat in the hotel but there are plenty cafes and places to eat nearby. My only complaint was that the bathroom was a little small, but it was very clean which is the most important thing. I would have no problem staying here again or recommending this hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “I almost cried....”
Reviews.Author: Stanno36
Reviews.Content: I am writing this via the expensive, though reliable and fast wireless internet connection. I arrived this morning, full of excitement at being back in Amsterdam for the first time in 22 years. Arriving outside the hotel, I was shocked. It looks terrible, dingy and unkempt. Reception was harried, arguing with some fellow guests over problems with their room. Not a good sign. I then made my way up to my room... to find a shoe box. It was so small that the chairs at the desk do not fit, the door to the bathroom needs to be closed so you can find the toilet, and the decor is very very tired. The corridors are tiny and cramped, and the hotel generally smells stale. The view at the back of the hotel is depressing. I was genuinely shocked at the standard of this hotel. I've just opened the minibar, but not had anything, so will have to see if that pops up on the bill at check out. Positives - the location is simply superb. I walked off my post arrival funk with a good long walk and window shop, and am looking forward to exploring the surrounds tonight with business colleagues. The shower worked well - maybe I was lucky? I have no basis of comparison with other hotels in the area, but I suspect to get the best out of this place, you need to beg, borrow or steal for an upgraded room... which my business booking did not allow. Would I bring my wife and children back? Not to this room.... all the best!

Reviews.Title: “Great Surprise”
Reviews.Author: Yulichka
Reviews.Content: i booked this hotel through Booking.com. I was so pleasantly surprised when I got to the hotel. The hotel is part of the Italian chain. It has all the little luxuries of the Courtyard Marriot. The hotel had a nice big bed (had a double), not 3 twins pushed together, great bathrooms and showers. The location was even better. It was walking distance from everything. I will stay there again when I go to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, clean, spacious rooms. Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: vestagon
Reviews.Content: Most decent hotels in Amsterdam are expensive. Jolly Carlton has a great location. Upon arrival the Service Staff parked our car and assisted with luggage. Very friendly and professional. The room was surprisingly spacious, very clean and quiet, despite facing the busy street and tram line. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Experience”
Reviews.Author: GiordanOpp
Reviews.Content: Amazing location, great room, pleasurable experience all around.

Reviews.Title: “enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: ramraid
Reviews.Content: spent 2 nights at the carlton over queensday 2007and found a good standard room which was spotlessly clean and bigger than i thought it would be the bathroom was especially nice which is always a good guide to a clean hotel the location was great and pretty central for most attractions and nightlife etc without being too noisey reception was quick and easy checking in and out we didnt bother paying for breakfast as booking.com didnt include it in the price and at 15 euro per person found it cheaper to eat out overall if your looking for a clean central 3/4 star hotel this should tick your boxes

Reviews.Title: “great for everyone!”
Reviews.Author: kirsty_m
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel through hotelconnect.co.uk which had the best price at the time and included breakfast - a lot of the deals from other sites didn't include breakfast. The hotel is fantastic!! In a great location, right at the flower market which is great for gifts and there are shops there that you can get a strippenkaart (for the trams - the little tobacconist is great because they'll show you how to use it). Also, just along from the hotel is the Rembrantplein which is a great area for pubs and restaurants if you're wanting to avoid busy crowds but still enjoy yourself. The hotel itself was such a surprise to me. The room we were in was really big and the bathroom was lovely. The lift always works! which is great because my mum is disabled and we really needed that. The staff are probably the worst point, very snooty. The porters only help you on arrival if you look like you're a tipper, the reception staff are ok but could be a little more helpful. They can be rather frosty.

Reviews.Title: “Ok, if you like things Small and Basic”
Reviews.Author: jofayerty
Reviews.Content: We have travelled to Amsterdam alot, having stayed at either Banks' Mansion or NH Barbizon. This time (and probably the last time) we thought we'd try something cheaper, as we are never in our room anyway, and how much difference would it make? Quite alot as it turned out. The hotel staff were not very pleasant, the room was tiny, you had to close the door in the bathroom to get to the toilet, the beds were awful and the TV worked when it felt like it - It made alot of difference to our weekend break as we dreaded going back to the hotel. When you're used to 5 star hotels, this place REALLY lets you down. My advise is this - DONT STAY HERE UNLESS YOU ARE USED TO HOSTELS.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location, good hotel”
Reviews.Author: 37Male
Reviews.Content: This was our 20th trip to Amsterdam and because we used this website we thought it our obligation to write a review.We have been to a lot of varying star hotels and have never returned to a single hotel twice, however we would definately return to this one......location is perfect, in the middle of everything.When we arrived we were upgraded to a deluxe room and found it to be large and comfortable.Cleaned everyday and quiet at night (we had a room at the back) Lots of bars and restaurants nearby (Remplandt Plein and Leidesplein) one of the main shopping streets just around the corner and ten minutes away from Dam square.

Reviews.Title: “Could have been Better”
Reviews.Author: SanjayLondon
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for only 1 night but had not a very good experience. We had booked via some website which confirmed a double bed for us but when we got into our room it was a Twin bed. On contacting the reception they were not really very courteous and advised the hotel was fully booked. I think the location and the spacious room of the hotel is definitely a plus point. On the negatives, it was just the price - i think at 245 euros it was very expensive and not really worth the location or spacious rooms. Would definitely avoid this one in future. I am sure a little more courteous staff who could have arranged us a double bed room would made it a bit better.

Reviews.Title: “a warm welcome from all at the Jolly Carlton”
Reviews.Author: jules000016
Reviews.Content: My son and I spent 2 nights at the Jolly Carlton and had a great time. The staff were warm, very friendly and attentive and the location was superb. We arrived early in the morning and although our room wasn't ready for us we were able to leave our case and go off on our travels. The receptionist pointed us in the right direction and advised us to go to the tourist information to buy tickets for the attractions - this way we didn't have to queue (we could walk straight in) and also we were given small discounts - a double bonus. Overall, thanks to the staff at the Jolly Carlton, we had a very enjoyable break - we will definately return and recommend it to all of our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Customer service was so bad that I would not recommend to anyone”
Reviews.Author: hayai
Reviews.Content: We booked online using the hotel's own website and paid the more expensive rate for breakfast at Caruso restaurant (rather than the cafe). However, in the morning, when we arrived in Caruso restaurant, an unfriendly woman asked for our room number. She then said that we had only paid for the cheap breakfast and must go downstairs to the cafe. I told her that was not correct, that I had paid for the more expensive breakfast at Caruso restaurant. She then phoned Reception, who told her that we had paid for the cheap breakfast and must go downstairs to the cafe. I was livid, because I knew that I had paid the more expensive option. So, I took my family and went to our hotel room, to get the print-out of my booking confirmation (showing my Caruso breakfast option prepaid) and marched downstairs to Reception. Reception then agreed, and I went back to Caruso restaurant, for breakfast. Although, I had eventually got into the restaurant, the whole family was extremely angry at the dismal way we had been treated. It was a terrible start to the day and really ruined the hotel stay. I then found out that the breakfast I had to fight to get was complete rubbish - cheap, long-life orange juice, and a rather sparse, unappetising buffet. Then, I wondered what the cheap breakfast at the cafe must be like, and felt glad that I had paid more, because anything worse than that would be inedible. Later that first morning, a lady arrived at our room to check the minibar. She opened the minibar door and then walked out of our room, leaving both minibar fridge and hotel room doors wide open. After she left the room, I called out to ask her if she was coming back or if she was going to leave the fridge door open like that. She said that she was going to get a beer can and return. When she returned and put a beer can into the minibar, I told her that we had not taken anything from the minibar, but she said "I only check and replace missing items". She then walked out of the room again, this time she left the outer door to the minibar wide open. She expects guests to close minibar doors after her! Then, to avoid a false charge at chekout, I went to Reception and told them that I had not taken anything from the minibar, and to make sure that I was not charged at checkout. They said they would deal with it. At checkout, guess what? Yes, on the bill was the minibar item. So, my discussion the previous day with Reception had been a complete waste of my time. Luckily, at checkout, the minibar charge was removed, but I didn't want to leave the problem until then, because then there would be greater suspicion that I was not telling the truth. The hotel and corridors are dark, ugly and dated, but inside our room was surprisingly better. To conclude, our stay was marred by the completely dreadful customer service. Staff appear not to have received any training in customer service. There appears to be no understanding by staff as to what makes a stay enjoyable and what makes it annoying. We found that being turned away from the breakfast room and having to produce our proof of eligibility is unforgivable. As a result, I would not recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “If You Like Smoking Go Here”
Reviews.Author: MrEZE
Reviews.Content: On arrival one is greeted by a burly doorman who is clearly too busy chatting with a local trader to offer assistance with luggage. We had reserved two rooms non smoking (thatâ€™s another issue I will come to) The reception personnel advised that although we had requested adjoining or at least next door rooms and our children would be in there and as we always do when travelling like to have them in the next room just in case etc. With 30 minutes of discussion and my patience being pushed to the limit, we were offered rooms opposite each other as these where the only suitable NON SMOKING (remember we reserved non smoking rooms) available. The fifth floor, the non-smoking floor had the strongest tobacco aroma imaginable, we might as well have been beagles in a laboratory! The room, although clean and well maintained, was very warm, on enquiry we discovered that the hotel air conditioning is not turned on for some weeks yet, so you either have stuffy, over heated room with tobacco smells or you open the window to the noise of generators and air duct systems of the adjacent office building. The restaurants, in the hotel, which prides itself on being four stars could only be described as cancer chambers, one could not even begin to think of ordering food.

Reviews.Title: “Jolly Carlton - What a nice surprise !”
Reviews.Author: Cecik
Reviews.Content: I was very surprised with what I encountered when I walked into my room at the Jolly Hotel Carlton. I don't know why it's rated so low int this website. This other hotel, that I stayed in the beginning of my trip, rates much higher, and didn't even come close to the Jolly Hotel. I booked a double deluxe room. It was only 20 to 40 euros more than the regular room. I know that 20 to 40 euros a night can add up, but you will be still probably paying less than some of the other hotels in Amsterdam. The other hotel I stayed was more expensive and as I said didn't offer half of what Jolly did. We got a very spacious room with a very spacious bathroom (two sinks and all) facing the back ot the hotel (so it was very quiet). We had robes and slippers in the room for us to use and even chocolate/candy on our pillows every night. The only thing that wasn't included was breakfast, but I think it's pretty much like that all over Amsterdam. The hotel is very well located, between Rembrandt-Plein and Leidseplein. There are excellent restaurants all over the area and great shopping too. The perfect area to stay.

Reviews.Title: “tulips from amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: tulip77
Reviews.Content: myself and my 3 sisters booked a weekend here-i'd heard accomodation in amsterdam wasent great-but i couldent fault this hotel-great value-spotless clean-great location-i'd definitly return here and recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location, Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: ScottGlasgow
Reviews.Content: This was our third trip to Amsterdam and we normally stay in a 5 star hotel up at Central Station, for this trip we were with friends so decided to change hotel. The hotel was extremely easy to find and looked pleasant enough from the outside. The foyer and check in area were very nice and check in was extremely quick and all questions were answered. The rooms were a little small however we were given a 7th floor room with a large balcony area which provided excellent views over Amsterdam. The rooms were immaculately clean and were maintained to this standard every day. The onyl downside to the room was a lack of a personal safe, however we did not have a single problem with security and when i returned to the room one day to collect something the cleaner asked to check my key card before allowing me entry which certianly laid my mind to rest. The staff in the hotel were also excellent and were happy to supply maps, travel information etc... and always did so with a smile. The guys in the foyer were great for organising taxis and luggage as well. Without a doubt this is the best location we have stayed in Amsterdam, everything is within walking distance due to its central location. The setting in the flower market and close to Spui and Rembrandtsplein make for a very nice area to stay in and quiet at night. We didnt eat or have breakfast in the hotel due to the abundance of cafes and restaurants to eat in in the flower market and within walking distance. I would/will go back to the Jolly Hotel no problem at all.

Reviews.Title: “Location is tops! A very nice hotel for Amsterdam!”
Reviews.Author: sxm123
Reviews.Content: First of all, I will provide directions to the hotel from the airport. DO NOT take a taxi from the airport unless you don't mind paying through the nose. Taxi fare from the airport is 40 EUROS. Avoid taxis at all costs in Amsterdam.. The metres run like a cheetah!! Initial fare is 5 euros and it just skyrockets from there in the blink of an eye! I couldn't believe it. Become familiar with the streetcar system in the city.. it is very easy to follow and wonderfully convenient. The streetcar is your friend!! Instead of taking taxi from airport, I recommend the following to reach the Jolly Carlton Hotel: 1. Take train from the airport to "CENTRAL STATION" 2. Buy a "StripKaart" (I think that's what it's called) or pay cash fare of about 1.60 Euros and take the Tram # 4 or #9. 3. Ask to be dropped off near the FLOWER MARKET. Hotel is about a 2 minute walk from here. Anyway, on to the hotel ... Location is amazing. You can walk to virtually every major tourist spot within 10-15 mins. Staff is friendly and the hotel is clean and well decorated. There is a nice bar on the ground floor which overlooks the street - very nice place to relax and have a beer while people watching. The bartenders and staff at the bar were very friendly. although i did not eat there, the food that neigboring tables were being served looked quite delicious. Noise from the street is tolerable. We were on the 3rd floor on weekend nights and, with the windows shut we really had no trouble sleeping. Breakfast at the hotel was unreasonably expensive at 15 Euros. All I had was cereal and some juice. Perhaps I should have eaten more if I had known I was going to be charged that amount! Even still, 15 euros is excessive for breakfast, even by London England standards. A great place to eat is just on the way to Rembrandt square called Wok to Walk. very nice, cheap, and quick food if youre on the run and don;t want to spend too much money. Very nice smokeshop that was featured in the movie OCean's 11 is locted within a 5 minute walk: DAMPKRING. You can sit at the same table that Brad Pitt and Matt Damon sat on during filming! I don't smoke, but this place came very highly recommended (no pun intended) by a local friend of mine. Apparently the quality of product, atmosphere, and crowd are the best in the city. I thought I would share this pearl of wisdom with you in case you like to indulge.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: gemmauk
Reviews.Content: We went to this hotel in November 2005, and had a fabulous time!! Got a very reasonable rate on lastminute.com - about Â£400 for two people, 3 nights and 2 flights. Room was great - very clean, bright and airy. Staff were very pleasant, and the location was excellent - very close to both Dam/Rembrantplein squares, and floating flower market etc. All the staff were very friendly and helpful. Didnt eat in the hotel - looked a bit overpriced and there are so many nice places to eat in Amsterdam that you dont need to eat at the hotel. Overall a really nice stay in the hotel - would definately visit again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Except for the Guy at the Front Desk”
Reviews.Author: Koekai
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. Modern, clean amenities. Excellent location. The hotel is quite booked Friday nights and check out time is not until Saturday noon. Rooms don't get cleaned and become available not until around 1PM or 2PM. So, if you're arriving Saturday morning from an overseas flight with a bad jet lag, you just can't hang around the hotel lobby - worse if you happen to fall asleep on the coach, at which point, the guy at the front desk will rudely wake you up to say "no sleeping allowed". The same guy wouldn't even take the effort to tell you when your room becomes available. Other than that, great hotel, excellent value.

Reviews.Title: “best location in dam”
Reviews.Author: pablo.d77
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Jolly for 3 nights found the staff were really friendly and helpful. apart from the mini bar attendant stole a bottle of wine and it got put on our bill. [--] but when I phoned they took it off straight away. the best part about this hotel is its situated right in the centre of Amsterdam in the best place possible. Its next to rambrant plein which is a massive square with escape which is a 2000 capacity club, also many ather clubs and bars. You can walk from the hotel to most museums and sights on foot and its only ten minutes walk to the red light district just ask at the hotel for a map. We never ate in the hotel as being Amsterdam we were always out but there are loads of restaurants around. We went to a thai cafe called Butterfly thai cafe on Oudezezuds Achterburgwal street. Same street as the hash museum just after the red light distrcit. It was better than a lot of the resaurants in thailand, try the Tom Yum soup and the fish was bom. The room we stayed in was quite small and we never had a view but we never asked. the room, lifts and whole hotel was very clean and the lobby looked good. I will be goinig again next year without my girlfriend so I can go mad..

Reviews.Title: “good hotel good location”
Reviews.Author: n1952
Reviews.Content: Having read some of the most recent reviews I was a bit apprehensive about what I might find on arrival.I have to say, however , staying in this hotel was a very pleasant experience.The receptionists I dealt with were efficient and helpful. The non smoking room on floor 1 was bright and airy and spotlessly clean.I got a very good rate through alpharooms which included breakfast. There was quite a substantial hot and cold buffet on offer. Location was excellent - easy to walk to anne frank house,museums, etc + a lot of reasonably priced restaurants in vicinity.Only negative was the taxi driver at central station who tried (unsucessfully) to rip me off by asking 15 euro to the hotel. In conclusion a good 4* hotel which was certainly value for money

Reviews.Title: “Maybe you were staying in a parallel universe...”
Reviews.Author: rubyglittershoes
Reviews.Content: .. because we thought it was wonderful! We stayed for 5 nights and paid Â£600 for a Deluxe Superior room. This had an ensuite marble bathroom with dual sinks, a large bedroom with separate living area, two TVs including 1 plasma LCD and although the 2 beds were pushed together (seems to be the norm) they were comfortable and large. The room's best asset was the view which looked over the flower market and canals on one side and Muntplein on the other, we could watch the world go by! The location was also good, not as noisy as Dam/Rembrantplein but location's irrelevant really given the amazing Dutch transport systems. I've seen a few comments about the unfriendly staff, we found all of the staff very welcoming and chatty and the man on the reception at 4.30am was more than happy to order us a pizza which the delivery firm dropped off 30 mins later! I would happily recommend this hotel and although I do like to try different places out, I'd be worried about other establishments not matching up.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Tiny Room Bad, Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: jennilou
Reviews.Content: Brilliantly located hotel close to everything good for somewhere to sleep. Stayed 3 nights over new year period. Got breakfast to the room and cost 50euros and it was, well lets just say not pleasant and not what i had ordered. From the outside the hotel looks massive and very worth the money. The lobby area just adds to your expectations as is very luxurious and welcoming. Howver cant say the same for the rooms appearance was quite dingy - although a smoking room not very luxurious hideous pictures on the wall and absolutley tiny booked a Double room and was given 2 beds joined together. Hotel staff very friendly although some housekeepers seemed a little grumpy. Was not in the hotel much They do have a restaurant but cant comment on that as never went due to the 50 euros i paid for breakfast. There is a cafe situated in the lobby which serves a nice coffee though. The goos thing is this hotels location right nxt to the flower market and shoping centre. Dam square, Red Light etc all within about 10mins walking distance. Great hotel for location but rooms and room service not up to much.

Reviews.Title: “brillient location”
Reviews.Author: roughley
Reviews.Content: i read some shocking reviews about this hotel and went there anyway. i like to make my own mind up. i travelled to amsterdam with my 5 year old daughter. we had a fantastic time. amsterdam is not for adults only. so the jolly hotel, what can i say. the location was brillient. our double room was clean and comfortable with an en suite. i had trouble with the shower but phoned reception and they sorted it immediately. a bonus for us was the tv which received bbc 1 and 2. this just kept my daughter entertained whilst we spent brief periods in the hotel. we basically slept there. i'm sure you could get cheaper elsewhere, but travelling alone with a 5 year old i wanted to know we were going back somewhere comfortable. to sum up - clean, comfortable, all staff very friendly, location fantastic for me and my daughter,could be a little cheaper but we knew the deal!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: RooiKop
Reviews.Content: Me, my husband and a friend have just come back from a quick weekend break in Amsterdam. The hotel was enough - the staff were very friendly. The rooms could definately do with un upgrade. We had a room with a balcony with a lovely view over the city. We didn't eat in the restaurant but chose the Italian across the road which was lovely - the food was really tasty. Breakfast at the hotel was very basic - probably a better idea to go out for breakfast. I would recommend this hotel, it has a great location and wonderful staff. The rooms are very comfortable with everything you need.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Jolly Not too clean”
Reviews.Author: Rexel
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 3 nights at this hotel in September. The location was good and we found we could easily walk to all the tourist attractions in Amsterdam - another plus was the tram line just outside the hotel door. All this was good - but probably not too hard to find in Amsterdam as it is fairly easy to negotiate. The staff were friendly and tried to help with directions and complaints. We got the feeling that they were frustrated by a couple of our complaints as it seemed they had heard them before and they have not been dealt with by management. The literature in our room had the wrong time displayed for breakfast times. We arrived and they were packing up - when we pointed this out to the manager she begged us to talk to hotel management because she had had many complaints and nothing had been done about it. The hotel foyer has obviously been updated - but not the rooms. The rooms and hallways are tired and in fact, a little dirty. Our bedspread was grubby and the bathroom was tired as well. It was not the worst hotel I have stayed in but I wouldn't recommend it. Not such a Jolly stay.

Reviews.Title: “good rooms, great location”
Reviews.Author: Babayaro
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the jolly last year, we travelled with another couple so I booked 2 rooms on the internet. I took advice from another reviewer, on tripadvisor, and emailed the Jolly hotel chain with a request for a room with nice views etc, I got an email back to say that my request had been noted, I took this as a no, but on arrival both our rooms had been upgraded at no extra cost. Just as well, because we sneaked a look at the standard rooms when the cleaners were in and I must say they looked rather on the small side. The room we had was spacious with large bathroom, the downside was that it had dark decor, but to be honest we hardly spent anytime in the room, I wonder why I bother paying extra for nice hotels. There are loads of pubs and restaurants nearby, and you are right next to rembrantplein square. There is an italian across the road which is very popular and quite expensive, it has a good atmosphere but I was quite disapointed with the meal, the indian next door to it was good though, although I was drunk at the time! We never ate at the hotel, too much choice on the doorstep. Overall a good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: davidrobert2
Reviews.Content: Nice room, great bathroom with oversized tub, towel warming rack and speakers connected to the television. comfortable and friendly and close to everything.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: DebDeSilva
Reviews.Content: This is a quiet hotel in a very central location. Our room was good size and had an updated bathroom. The staff members speak English and seemed nice. The mini bar does charge you when you open it (we just had them take the charges off the bill - no problem). We used the fridge for our own food. Don't eat at the first-floor restaurant. Not good and overpriced. The Caruso Restaurant is great. I wouldn't rate this as a 4-star hotel; more of a 3.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: yschoy
Reviews.Content: After booking the trip and hotel and reading the reviews on the site, I was expecting the worse and when I got there, I found it to be a really pleasant experience. The room we had was really spacious and the bathroom was large enough for 2 people (with two sink basins) and the bed could've accommodated 4 people! I found it a bit noisy at night around 4am when drunken people were shouting in the street but overall, found the hotel to be excellent. I got a good price for the trip and the hotel seemed to be a bargain. It is in a fantastic location and we walked everywhere for 3 days and I highly recommend the Indonesian restaurant around the corner next to the Flower Market. Would definitely recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Dingy - rude, aggressive receptionists”
Reviews.Author: CDY1
Reviews.Content: The hotel has OK common areas however the rooms are dingy, old and smell of damp. Do not be misled by the 4 star. Expect a down-at-heel 3 star and you wont be disappointed. However the real low point is the italian workers in reception who are the most outrageously rude and unhelpful I have have experienced in Europe. They are pointlessly aggressive and argumentative. Avoid - if there are other options available.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - only minor problems”
Reviews.Author: Ulster_Tripper
Reviews.Content: The Jolly Carlton is a very well situated hotel as nearly everyone has mentioned. Sitting right beside the flower market its less than 10 minutes walk from both Dam Square and Leidseplein. It really couldnt be much better located and unless you're planning to spend all your time laying in the hotel then that really is the main thing. The reception staff are helpful and the lobby of the hotel is very welcoming. The room we had was clean and whilst not huge it wasnt cramped either. As with other people, the double we had ordered turned out to be two single beds with seperate sheets etc. After trying this on the first night and drifting far apart we requested a change to a double bed. Whilst not being able to accomodate us for the second night they moved us after that for the rest of the stay. Whilst the 'double' again was 2 singles at least they had joined the beds with a single sheet etc and the drifting apart was cured. The reception staff through all of this were very accomodating and moved luggage etc between rooms. I only experienced one slight problem with the water temperature when it seemed to jump up for a moment, but in 4 days of 2 people showering twice a day that was the only occasion . If you do need to take a tram then there is a stop about 50m from the front door of the hotel which is very handy for taking a tram up to Centraal Station or down to the museums area. Overall the hotel is clean, very well located and a great base for exploring Amsterdam. It really only misses out on 5 stars very narrowly and I would happily recommend it to anyone going given the very reasonable price we got (4 nights for price of 3) through lastminute[--].

Reviews.Title: “good location, shame about the decor”
Reviews.Author: Maybeitsbecause
Reviews.Content: would agree with all the other comments posted below - the Jolly is certainly in an excellent location, right by the flower market. The room was quite large and air-conditioned and despite overlooking the main road was very quiet, which ensured a good nights sleep. However the decor is terrribly dated and needs up-grading from the eighties style. Bathrom looked a little bit grubby and I also noted that having made my bed the housekeeping had just flung my pyjamas onto a side table which seemed a little slapdash. Reception seemed friendly although we did not have to bother them much, they were efficient in organising a shuttle bus to the airport for us whiich arrived promptly and was much better value at 12 euros each than the rip-off taxi we had taken earlier on. Our hotel offer did not include breakfast which seemd a little steep for 12 euros - lots of much better cafes around. Lastly, there was a very strange arrangement with the minibar which was locked. If you opened it you were charged - even if you did not drink anything. If you wanted to cool any of your own drinks, they charged 15 euros to empty the minibar, which I thought was a bit strange! Overall a satisfactory hotel but I probably wouldn't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Jolly in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Condo1000
Reviews.Content: You cannot beat the location here for this hotel in Amsterdam. It was also very quiet at night despite being on a tram line and with the flower market etc. Breakfast is mega-expensive, go for the cafe's down in the road in Rembrandtsplein instead. Staff are extremely helpful and polite and you can get a bus to Schipol from the hotel door if you like (Connexxion bus). Rooms were small but were clean. Rather expensive for the room but all hotels in Amsterdam seem to be around the same, even for worse locations.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable”
Reviews.Author: threetenors
Reviews.Content: Found the rooms quite basic but comfortable. The Restaurant was not as good as I had expected it to be. Overall, though the hotel is good value for money. Use the tram to get to Centraal statation as it is quite a hike.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Good location”
Reviews.Author: bongoblog
Reviews.Content: I booked here at short notice through a website for 109 euro which is good for Amsterdam at the moment. I had a room with a view over the flower market and Muntplein. Reception staff were freidly and efficient. The room was smallish butcontained everything needed inc. tea/coffee and safe. Both room and bathroom were clean and well maintained. The bad points were the queen bed was 2 singles which drew apart during the night(very romantic!) and the shower going from perfect to scalding to freezing, that they really should fix. If not for this i would give 4*

Reviews.Title: “Good location, and some rooms are a (nice) surprise”
Reviews.Author: nicolasj
Reviews.Content: The rates for this hotel can vary a lot. I got a room for 109 â‚¬ which was very low, so even if below I give some remarks, the value for money was excellent. LOCATION The hotel is on a busy street, and even the small road under the hotel lead to a busy area (small restaurants, ...). The flower market, tramline, shopping streets, canals, are all very close and easy to find. This is not a 'calm location' so be ready for some noise. RECEPTION My check inn was fast and efficient. The lifts come quite fast. ROOM The corridors feel a bit a like a 3 star hotel from the seventies, but they are clean. My room turned out to be a big suite with 2 single beds, a huge writing desk, a seperate luggage room with a safe, a nice bathroom, and all of this with a business atmosphere. Everything as clean, modern and in working order. I don't think all rooms are like this, but at least 507 is. Be aware : the remarks other users of this side made about fluctuating water temperatures are correct. Better take a bath, not a shower. FACILITIES and RESTAURANT My stay was too short to test some of the other facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Ronan2006
Reviews.Content: Great 4 days in Amsterdam. This is a hotel that is in the middle of everything. All the city attractions are within easy reach of this hotel. You could walk, tram or bike anywhere. The rooms are small but adequate. Read the review about the water and they are true, be very careful. Staff a friendly and helpful. Only problem was we got a smoking room our first night when we asked for non smoking. Was put in a deluxe room which was great except for the stale odour. We moved the next night to a box room on top floor. The room was fine and clean. It is a 3* hotel and nothing more. We got a really good deal to stay here but I don't think it is worth the price they normally charge. If you can get a good deal at this hotel, I would recomment staying here as it is a great base to explore Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Great location,average room”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed 3 nights. Great location near the tram lines and central Amsterdam. Room was small (its Europe), barely big enough for the bed, which was comfortable. Breakfast was overpriced. Plenty of dining options all around hotel. Staff extremely pleasant and helpful. The shower has a sign about the hot water...it can get scalding with no warning, they mean it! Be nimble. I thought it was a little too expensive for the room (180 euro) but I waited too late for reservations.

Reviews.Title: “good location”
Reviews.Author: davlin1126
Reviews.Content: we have just returned from a 5 day stay at the jolly carlton,the location is great,the hot water supply is very tempremental and on occasions can get VERY hot,our room was not cleaned until on average 3.30pm daily although the maid usually woke us up at about 8.15 am humming and singing as she went up and down the corridor,at night it could be noisy from the street below ,on the first night we could"nt open the mini-bar and on reporting this we were told that the bars in the town were open until 5.00am ,not the answer we wanted really,we had breakfast once in our room for which the service charge is 8 euros, we found that there were better and cheaper options in the many eating places nearby. ,how-ever it was not all negative and we did enjoy our stay ,the reception staff were help-full and the rest of the staff very pleasant,the hotel is within easy walking distance of dam square,central station,and right next door to the floating flower market.

Reviews.Title: “A decent 4-star hotel”
Reviews.Author: eaglehaslanded
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Jolly Hotel Carlton from February 19th to 22nd, 2006. I requested and received a nonsmoking room which was really nonsmoking--never quite guaranteed when you are in Europe. I should add that I only paid about $110 a night via hotels which was quite a bargain. The service was formal but adequate. Knowing Italian is a plus here because half the staff is from Italy, particularly those who work at the restaurant. That said, the reception desk people speak perfect English, and so does the hotel operator. Breakfast costs something like 12 Euros extra, but because I already knew this from the website, I never tried it. There are some wonderful pastry and coffee shops just down the street, like Kweekboom on Reguliersbreestraat, so you really have no reason to pay big bucks for a hotel breakfast unless you really wish to. There are two restaurants and a "grand cafe" on the premises. I tried the cheaper restaurant (not Caruso) and was decidedly underwhelmed by the service and the food. Between that and the fat surcharge you would have to pay for room service here (8 Euros above the price of the meal--which works out to $25 for pizza from room service), you're best off eating at any of the nice restaurants within a few steps. The location is pretty good, just steps from the 4 and 9 tram Muntplein stop, which is very useful. You do _not_ need to take a cab to get here until after 12:30 am when the trams stop. And even then, because the hotel is only two blocks from Dam Square, you probably won't be too far to begin with in this compact city. Everyone's reviews already forewarned me about the weirdness of the hot water service in the bath. Jolly even puts stickers in the shower to let people know that on occasion the water can get scalding hot. It happened to me once during a shower. Basically, be prepared to step away from the water and turn the temperature down when necessary. That said, the bathroom was clean and the water really was hot. And the towels were fresh and plentiful. And again, you're never guaranteed any of those things in Europe, even at some places that call themselves four star. Basically, this was a good, solid four star hotel. I would consider returning, but given the choice, I think I would try out Dikker & Thijs Fenice because it's cheaper, includes breakfast, and is right next to the 1/2/5 tram line stop, which gets you to more places you might be interested in. However, Amsterdam is so compact, you can basically stay almost anywhere in the city center and get wherever you want to go. You just might have to walk an extra two blocks to get the tram you want.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My Partner and I stayed at the Jolly Hotel Amsterdam for during the weekend 11-13 Feb 2006. Hotel was Average. Not sure if its really a 4* more of a 3*+. The staff were OK but to be honest we did not trouble them much. The room was Double. Not the biggest I have stayed in but it did the job. I was given a twin at first but had to request a change for a double, this took around 20 mins to arrange. Check in was 2pm, we got there a bit early but still had to wait for the rooms to be prepared... Not nice if you have just come in from a long flight etc... Be very careful of the showers, other reports of Hot and Cold temp are very true. Nearly burt myself as the shower temp went from nice and warm to boling hot !! .. (there are warning stickers) The hotel was clean. Room keeping did a good job. There was soom minor maintainance going on the 6th Floor ( some sort of re-wiring but not noisy at all). Did not eat or drink in the hotel. There are more then enough places to eat and drink within easy walking distance. (Studio2 opp the Flower Market do a nice Full English at half the hotel rate) and there is a McDonalds across the road for late night munchies ! The MiniBAR came with enough warnings and locks to be honest it put me right off even trying to see what was in there! The only thing that is worth writing about is the location. It very centrally located for walking. We covered most areas on foot and never felt we walked too much. We walked to Central Station too, its about 10 mins walk. Used web hotel booking service to get a discounted rate..Would stay again, if the price was better... mainly because of location. Stayed in the Marriot before which weighed slighty higher ( because of views over Leidseplien).

Reviews.Title: “Jolly Carlton Review”
Reviews.Author: tagz718
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is in a great location easy walking distance to all areas of attractions and interests. The Hotel Lobby is beautiful and looks ritzy. My room that my husband and I stayed in was small, very small. Housekeeping was GREAT, they cleaned the room everyday gave fresh towels, made the beds and filled up the coffee, it was awesome. The Doormen were great and always were very polite and made us feel at home. I wasn't very happy with the front desk staff they were sort of short with you if you had any questions to ask them. Overall we enjoyed our stay at The Jolly Carlton HOtel and probably would go back but upgrade our room to a bigger room if there is one and ask for a better view ours was of a roof overlooking some buildings.

Reviews.Title: “4 star disguised as a 2 star”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was an over-priced hotel. The service was terrible, cold-fish who made you feel guilty for asking a question. They charged horendous fees for everything.... if they are a luxury hotel should wireless internet not be standard? Or how about local calls? The fact the flimsy curtains wouldnt close, or the fact the shower would go from SCALDING hot to frigid.... and when we called they said that "all the showers do that".... but without turning the dial? I was 5mos pregnant and the shower just about launched me to the floor because it got so scalding half way through my shower. The staff didn't care. The breakfast was WAY over priced (I suggest going for a 2min walk across the street, there is a greatlittle cafe). Other then the location, this was a 2 star, advertising and priced to try and pretend to be a 4 star.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place, Met all of my needs....”
Reviews.Author: pothead702
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a 5 night stay in Amsterdam at the Jolly Carlton Hotel. I really enjoyed my stay there. This was my 3rd trip to AMS and the most enjoyed. The location of the hotel is perfect. It is in the center of it all, everything the dam has to offer is within a mile or so radius. The room was decent sized, 2 twin beds pushed together, full bath with a tub large enough to hold me a 6'2" man, minibar, and my room even had a little balcony where you could go out and have a smoke. Decent restaraunts in area, I recomend the Indoesian & Chinese places on the corner, as well as the breakfast at the hotel, nice spread for 12 euro. I would stay here again and would recomend this place. 2 thumbs up!

Reviews.Title: “Crap service”
Reviews.Author: ForeverBlue40
Reviews.Content: My partner & I stayed at the Jolly Carlton January 2006. Great room, loved the location (right by the Bloemenmarket) but the service was appalling. On one day our room was not cleaned until we complained about it about on our return at 4.30; my partner was scalded by a surge of boiling water whilst in the shower which was only suppressed by a continued application of cold sponges.When we complained about it, they stuck a notice in the shower area warning of the hot water! And then to cap it all, on our final day, with a check out time of noon, we packed most things away and went out leaving a few items that we needed, out. In marked contrast to previous days, our room was cleaned on time and the items that had been left out thrown out. It was only thanks to reception and housekeeping that most of the items were recovered from the garbage. 4 star? NOT!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: mel-n-e
Reviews.Content: Clean, Central Location, friendly staff, had a great view of the city from the top floor.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutly loved the Hotel Jolly”
Reviews.Author: jessycat
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the jolly from 26th dec to 30th dec. We were a bit apprehensive as we had read a few negative reviews,we needn't have worried, as soon as we entered the hotel we new this was going to be an enjoyable stay. The hotel is fabulous, absolutely spotless and the most efficient we have ever stayed in When we booked in we were upgraded free of charge )and without asking ) to a superior room, a porter took our bags and escorted us to our room which was huge and gorgeous, We had 2 4ft beds side by side, there was a bath robe and slippers for the lady. Plenty of tea and coffee, and a sweet with a message by our beds. The bathroom was lovely really big with 2 was basins, shower and a bath. Ther was a hairdryer, but this was in the bathroom so you had to stand I think they could put a stool in there, as usual with foreign hotels there was no plug by a mirror in the lounge so couldnt use own hairdryer, I gave up and stood. After we unpacked we went down stairs and the manager asked us if we liked our room, we thought this was a real personel touch . All the staff were really friendly as were all the dutch. It was freezing cold in Amsterdam so the warm hotel was very welcoming, heating is on in the rooms 24hrs, you can turn it to whatever temperature you want. When we booked out we left our luggage in the hotel, I have never seen this done so proffesionaly your bags were tagged and we were given a duplicate.Anything really valuable was put behind the desk and locked up. We would not stay in a different hotel if we go back to amsterdam.We took the schipol shuttle from the airport they are every half hour from the airport, we had a return cost 35 euros (Â£24total) for 2 of us right to the jolly. The hotel cost us Â£284 total for the room ,that Â£35 each per nt, booked with cheeptravel or cheephotels on net (spelt as seen) Fab Stay

Reviews.Title: “A hotel where "EFFICIENCY" is the keyword”
Reviews.Author: henri1710
Reviews.Content: While on a stopover in Amsterdam this time I booked the Jolly hotel Carlton for a cheaper rate than the Grand Krasnapolsky hotel and the Victoria which in the past was a dissapoitement in terms of services and price, so I took a crack at the Jolly hotel Carlton this time and believe me, it was diferrence. Upon arrival, I was greeted professionaly by a seasoned receptionist who would normally attribute the lousiest room since the booking was done through an internet base hotel reservation which could obtain rates not even proposed by a travel agent, and my rate was very low (which is logical to me). They notice that I was walking with a crutch, they immediately upgrade my room to a supperior one which is located on the first floor. In front of the room, things started badly as the magnetic key didn't syncronise with the room lock, so it was back to the reception and a change of key card, this time accompanied by the porter, I was finnaly in the room. I was surprised. First becauce through getting cheap rate with a rack rate going over 300 and they really gave me a superior room which I went over carefully, from the bathrooms (a large one , the minibar , the coffee making facilities to the options for internet connection and found nothing wrong with the except maybe the soundproof windows which was difficult to shut, but well nevermind, I got a decent room for once and will certainly not complained about it. The bathrooms was even equiped with a shower stall with a seat for people who are not that strong with there legs. After a shower and a very comfortable sleep, it was panic in the morning as I forgot to bring my shaving kit, I call housekeeping who replied she will see what she could do and less that 5 minutes later, the doorbell rang and it was room service with box containing a shaving kit. Upon arriving at the reception for the checkout, the staff was polite and total checkout time including the fact that I booked throught the internet, but want to pay for the rooms upon checkout took less than 5 minutes while the staff asked if my stay at there hotel was alright and when i told them I would prefer to stay here than the Grand Krasnapolsky, it was all a proud smile. All in all this was the best hotel for me in Amsterdam in comparing with other top name hotels. On the positive side, the staff is very efficient and the rooms well equiped and well maintained except for the magnetic key lock and the soundproof window which didn't shut very well, I would personnaly stay here again for these reasons: I got a very good room for the price I paid, a friendly and efficient staff and situated 3 tramways stop or by walking the main shopping street Kalverstratt, the hotel is located at the end of this street. Location, prices (if available), fully equipped rooms and of course the excellent staff, I rate it the best.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous central location”
Reviews.Author: brongraham
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a long weekend, and had a great time. The rooms were plenty big enough, and had great freebies (always a plus!!). The staff on front desk were polite & efficient. We were taken a little by surprise by the hotel tax charge on leaving, which was in addition to the hotel room charge that we'd paid up front - lucky we hadn't spent everything! We didn't eat in the restaurant at all - bit pricey, and there was plenty of other places to go that were extremely close. Likewise, it wasn't a problem being room only, because there were plenty of places to go for breakfast. All in all we had a great time in the Jolly hotel, and we'd definitely go again.

Reviews.Title: “Incompetent and not very helpful”
Reviews.Author: Hardrada1
Reviews.Content: Interesting to read other reviews where this hotel has messed up their bookings. I recently booked a weekend at the Jolly Carlton, got email confirmation of the booking and travelled there on a Friday night only to be told that there was a problem with my booking and the hotel was full. They claimed they'd tried to call me, though I'd received no phone calls or voicemails, it then transpired that they'd done it an hour beforehand (i.e. while I was on the plane). The guy behind the desk didn't really want to know, his line was that they'd failed to authorise my credit card and so cancelled the booking. I don't believe this for one moment (my credit card provider usually notifies me about anything like this), especially as there were two couples at reception when I arrived who seemed to be having a similar problem, it seems more likely they'd overbooked and just bumped a few guests randomly. The guy reluctantly found me another hotel which was miles from the centre and wasn't happy when I refused it. I can't comment on the hotel itself, all I saw was the reception but I can confidently say they're inefficent, uninterested and not very helpful. I will not be booking this one ever again.

Reviews.Title: “great location, great rooms”
Reviews.Author: wallifoot
Reviews.Content: I was very pleased with our stay at the Jolly given the mixed reviews on this site. We stayed at the hotel for 4 nights at the end of October 2005 and could not fault the service or the room. The location is fantastic to be able to walk around the city in any direction. Takes 5 mins to walk to Dam square. We were on the 6th floor at the back and had no problems with noise. The only thing that I could say to improve on was the hairdryer. If your the kind of person that relies on one in the morning then I would suggest you take your own. Great service and I would stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: From the moment we entered the hotel our every need was catered for. The staff were friendly & efficient and bent over backwards to help us. A high class 4* hotel. The hotel is clean and in a good state of repair and our rooms were wonderful!!! clean, well sized etc and we were allocated a free upgrade. Breakfast was excellent and the service could not be faulted. We have stayed in Amsterdam on a number of occasions and this hotel was the best by miles.

Reviews.Title: “Location,location....”
Reviews.Author: trotterleg
Reviews.Content: With so many choices I decided after my Milano Jolly Hotel experience to do it again, but in the Dam. My first Deluxe room was small and overlooked the street. Spent 2 nights in this room and then upgraded to a quiet, larger Superior room. What a difference 50 Euros made. Ate breakfast in their Italian style restaurant- great Italian waiters- a little bit of real Italy in Amsterdam. Beyond easy to navigate around the city from this hotel. The flower market was a great way to ask for directions back to the hotel. The weather was warm for October , and the A/C had been previously shut off and heat was available. Didnt use it but it was a little warm in the room. Not the fault of the hotel. I doubt Ill be returning to Amsterdam but if I do I'll surely add the Jolly Carlton to my itinerary.

Reviews.Title: “WIFI people MUST read this”
Reviews.Author: mitchmurr
Reviews.Content: Am currently in the midst of a thirty day stay here, about ten days in, and I am very happy with the hotel. I travel to many places and have had bad places before but this is fine, depending on what you "need" in a hotel. Being it's Amsterdam, I personally do not need a hotel with a good restaurant. Step outside the door and there's so much to choose from. Breakfast is so-so but, again, step outside for a wonderful cafe. Location is great...much around to do. Street noise can be loud at times but it is a main street. I was upgraded to a Deluxe, which is one up from a normal room, and it's very comfy, nice bathroom. Though they have those showers with no curtains, only a two foot partition so your floor will get flooded (what's with these Europeans and this set up!!) ALSO...PLEASE NOTE.....they charge 22 Euro a day for high speed internet service (yikes!!) BUT if you have in computer WIFI, you can find a free service called HOTSPOT AMSTERDAM if you look in the area of computer that shows that stuff. Whew!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Just a normal person giving a review”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: me and my girlfriend are just back from Amsterdam and we stayed at the jolly carlton hotel for 4 nights in a standard double room. we booked with Hotels and paid around 600gbp 4nts upon arriving at reception of the hotel it looked quite nice with a large seating areas which were clean. we went the desk, gave our names and the staff were pleasant and helpful, then a person came up to us with a trolley and took our luggage and took us to our room but.. **I think this service is reflected in the hotel price/star rating which you pay more for & isnt really something personally id rather not have paid for in the overall price** We arrived in a room on the 4th floor which to be honest was quite plain and bland, the room itself was described online as double or 2 single beds dont let the pics online fool you folks its doesnt look quite like the same, we got 2 single beds the room size, of the bedroom was just abit small **wasnt really really tiny but it was small and not comfortable for the price we paid, you should be able to get bigger rooms in amsterdam for the money you pay for this hotel, this is my 4th time to amsterdam and have always stayed in the rembrandt area, **for example: we stayed in a hotel 20metres across the road from this hotel last year called 'albus grand hotel', it was 3 star and the only differences i can see is that the main repception of the jolly hotel is bigger, someone carrys your luggage, there is 2 more lifts and a resturant you get a full size bath but the 3star across the road their rooms where alot nicer and less expensive and about the same size, the bathroon was small no doubt about it, if you can imagine or look at some pics, if you where standing at the bathroom door looking into the bathroom you would see the full size bath against the wall opposite the door, between the door this bath wall is about 3meters max, its about 3x3meters the bathroom is. the view was looking into offices about 15metres from our windows and unfortunley there were a few large fans on the roof, initally i thought the noise was general street noise but these where industrial fans so this again it was quite an expensive hotel room to have to listen to very loud fans at the best of times when the windows open. there is a mini bar in the hotel room and when i got there i checked it out, there was a small tin of orange juice which i drank, tin of coke, & a packet or caramelised nuts, it came to 17euro, which when which i looked at the price list all the soft drinks where 5euro no less, so the mini bar is way to expensive and they have no vending machines for drinks or food to force you to use it, i would aviod using this at all costs. overall this hotel is definitley not a 4 star hotel that is worth 600gbp for 4nights, there are nicer 3 star hotels we have stayed in the area, you are paying alot of money for a standard double room, which is just small size, small bathroom and possible or more than likley not really an enjoyable room for 4nts, very plain not even comtempoary so it wasnt really worth the money we could of saved on other hotels

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just come back from staying at 'The Jolly Carlton' Hotel, Amsterdam.
