This hotel is very central, within walking distance of Dam Square, The Palace and about 15-20 mins walk from Centraal Station. The breakfast in the hotel is fair but not worth the 19 euro per person. We had a Deluxe room which was large, good view over canal and over the flower market this was on the fifth floor and was very nice. Ann Franks House was very much worth a visit. If you get chance to go to Voldendam and Marken on an excursion then go, this was a good trip. People seem very friendly although beware if you are looking lost someone may wish to help you which is good, but for a fee!

Reviews.Title: “Dutch Disaster”
Reviews.Author: itsdifferent
Reviews.Content: I cannot think of any good things about my recent experience at the Jolly Hotel Carlton in Amsterdam. Ok, maybe one thing â€“ itâ€™s in a good location, but thatâ€™s it. In addition to the well worn 80â€™s dÃ©cor and dimly lit hallways, they stuffed up our room booking which meant we had to move. The breakfast we ordered was not only late but it was cold and without tea or coffee which took them 2 further trips to rectify which they then had the cheek to charge us â‚¬32 for (The cafÃ©s along the flower market a nicer and offer better value!). The bathrooms were not adequately clean and ours had the aroma of a menâ€™s urinal. There was an orange fluorescent street light outside our window which we could not block out because the curtains were mere window dressing and could not be drawn which, added to the fact that there is a club behind the hotel, meant the street noise was horrendous. We even endured a 4am game of street football bouncing off the building 5 storeys below. Finally to add insult to injury, the total cost. Itâ€™s not often that I leave a hotel feeling ripped off but I did here. I know itâ€™s not easy finding the balance between value for money and a decent hotel in Amsterdam and if, like us, thatâ€™s what youâ€™re looking for â€“ keep looking.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay!”
Reviews.Author: SafeTravelsGirl
Reviews.Content: My husband and I really like the Jolly Carlton in Amsterdam. We had a large bathroom, comfy bed, and fantastic view. We could sit in our window and look out over the town. Location was excellent, too. We walked everywhere, and breakfast at the hotel was always really good. I normally do not like chain hotels, but this one is the exception - I totally recommend it for everyone!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff were helpful, location excellent, rooms clean and our stay was great. We would recommend this hotel to those who want to see all of Amsterdam but still sleep comfortably at night. From the airport just hop on the train to central station (3.40 euro) then take tram 14 or 16 (1.60euro) to the tower. Right past the tower is this great hotel. Would definetly recommend getting a canal bus pass for the day (16.00euro). They're good until noon the following day and make stops close to all the major museums and historical sites (Van gogh museum, Anne Frank House,etc). What a delightful city!

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel, above average prices!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 3 day break in Amsterdam which we thoroughly enjoyed. It's a great city with loads to see and do. I would definitely recommend it. However, we did find the hotel very expensive. We got upgraded to a superior room on arrival (for free) but if this was superior I dread to think what the standard room was like. It was a good size with a view of the canal and pretty clean, which is the main thing, but the price was way too high for this room. If you can find a really cheap rate then fine, but if not, look for another hotel. We paid 280 euro for 2 nights. The hotel was recommended by a friend and for this price I expected it to be of a good standard, but I wished we had shopped around more.

Reviews.Title: “Just what we wanted”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I booked this Hotel after looking at so many reviews on tripadviser - which I must say were really helpful. Got a good deal by booking late and upon arrival were offered an upgrade to a superior room - 433. This was larger than some of the rooms and was directly facing the flowermarket and Muntplein so we always had the time handy! The room was very pleasant and comfortable with a safe, minibar etc - only minor fault really was the double bed was 2 singles. The Hotel was clean, comfortable and the staff helpful. The location of the hotel - (one of the reasons I chose it) was fantastic - close to everything. We had a short break but everything was so easy to get to that we were able to fit in everything we wanted to do. Few things to do on your trip - Anne Frank House well worth a visit, go up the tower of the Westkerk to get a fabulous view of Amsterdam, of course a canal cruise, don't miss the Begijnhof a secret village in the middle of town hidden off the Spui. The Leidsplein area is a great way to spend the evening with so many choices of what and where to eat or to just watch the world go by or the street artists perform. Our few days were packed with great sights, wonderful food (try the Indonesian experience of rijsttafel a selection of dishes with rice) at the Kantijil & de Tijger on Spuistraat, pancakes at Pancake Corner and tea on the top floor of Metz & Co down the road from the Jolly where you can see the whole of the city. I could go on as there were so many good things to see and do. Book the Jolly and you won't be disappointed - but try and get a good deal. One thing to watch for - we booked the Airport Connexion bus to take us back to the airport for 11 euros each however it didn't turn up (booked for 1.45pm), we had to get a taxi at the last minute and pay taxi fare the one thing we tried to avoid. I felt the Hotel could have done something to address this as they knew we were waiting. We were lucky a taxi was pulled up outside so we jumped in. To avoid this book a bus earlier than you need just in case or go by train as we did on the way in.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: lowrider_62
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Jolly Hotel Carlton from August 4 to August 9 2005. The hotel staff was very friendly and would do anything to please its guests. The rooms were very clean and housekeeping was around 9am every morning. My room was equipped with two twin beds, air conditioning, mini bar, safe and a bidet, although I requested a double bed. My negative experience with this hotel was that the telephone calls were very expensive. Also, upon checking out, I looked at my invoice only to find out that they charged me from using the minibar in which I never used! Next time you check out, I strongly advise you to review your invoice before paying. I told the receptionist about it and he voided the charges with no hassle. Also, my rates were very expensive. Each night averaged $175.70 Canadian Dollars. But apart from that, I had an excellent experience with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A good hotel, but not exceptional”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The reviews for this hotel seem to be a bit mixed, but after spending two nights there recently, I thought it was a generally good hotel. Although the room I had was rather small, it was clean and comfortable. The airconditioning in the room was great too, especially because Amsterdam seems to get very humid during summer. However, I did find the hotel somewhat on the expensive side. The breakfast seemed over-priced and phone calls were especially expensive. One other drawback was that the cleaners started cleaning rooms quite early in the morning. I was woken up each morning at around 8.00 or 8.30 by the sounds of vacuum cleaners, trolleys, and voices outside my door. This probably wouldn't bother those who like to get up early and head out to explore the city, but if you've had a late night and want to catch up on sleep, then you might want to keep this in mind. Overall though, a good hotel and a good location.

Reviews.Title: “Solid choice if a tad expensive”
Reviews.Author: nash0819
Reviews.Content: A work colleague and I were attending a conference at the RAI Centre on the outskirts of Amsterdam. We would have preferred a hotel near the RAI but all of these were booked up, too expensive or had bad reviews on this site. Therefore we settled on the Jolly Carlton as it was just off Rembrantdplein and on the route of the number 4 tram, which goes directly to the RAI. The hotel is a few tram stops down from Central Station with the RAI Centre about 20 minutes further down the line. I booked one standard double room each for myself and my colleague on Expedia. I arrived on a Sunday and did not get an upgrade to a superior room whereas my colleague arrived on a Tuesday and, without prompting, did get an upgrade. We both checked out on Friday morning so perhaps his shorter stay meant he was more likely to get the lucky break. I cannot speak for my colleague's room but my standard double room (215) was suitable for its purposes. The size of the room was adequate for one person but it may feel a bit cramped for two. There was plenty of cupboard and hanging space, the desk was a good size and the separate table and chairs were most useful. The desk was too close to the bed for comfort and there was a general lack of power points but I got by by shuffling recharging devices. Free coffee/tea making facilities were included. The bed was very comfortable for a hotel bed and it had decent pillows. The window arrangement was slightly odd, semi-circular in shape with an assortment of drapes to pull across and no view to speak of. However there was no significant light spill or noise creep from the fairly busy main road outside and this was a big plus for me. In fact, I didn't realise I had the AC turned on for the first two days, which was helping to mask the outside noise. The bathroom was very clean and well stocked, with an excellent lighted shaving mirror. The shower, over a medium size bath, was very cramped; anyone over 6 foot would have to stand sideways to avoid bumping their shoulder into a protruding wooden cover along the length of the cieling above the bath, which was hiding a large pipe I presumed. The shower itself was slightly tricky to get the temperature right - and keep it there - but I've had much worse and the pressure was good. The mini-bar was reasonably stocked, with a small can of Heineken costing 5 euros. I used the laundry service at 10 euros for a pair of jeans and these were competently cleaned. The wireless internet did not work very well, maybe because the antenna on my room's device was broken. The 100Mb LAN connection from the same device did work well, even if it was more than 20 euros for one day's access (max 24 hours, to 14:00). The television worked properly with BBC World, Sky News and CNN for the English speaker and a better choice of German, Dutch, French and Italian channels for others. The description of the hotel on Expedia claimed that all rooms have a mini-safe. This is not the case! Also, there was nothing even vaguely suitable that I could find to securely attach a kensington lock to. Even though the staff at reception were more than happy to put my laptop in the back room when I wanted to leave it at the hotel, I would have preferred to secure it in my room. The hotel recpetion staff and porters were all very friendly and spoke excellent English (and Italian I think). I chose not to eat at the hotel since I did not have time for a full breakfast and most other meals were provided at the conference. The menu looked expensive but of a high standard. Overall, I would say this is a good three star hotel but not a four star hotel. If you are going as a couple, or are over 6 feet tall, I would strongly recommend getting one of the Superior rooms but for a single person or a small couple, the standard rooms are sufficient. I will give it 4/5 however if I had had to pay for the room myself, I would have given 3/5.

Reviews.Title: “great experience”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: lots of bad reviews on the web, however we had a great time. rooms were fine and we stayed economy! not the best view but a good view with an interesting view of the city (by the way if you are in Amsterdam and you spend more than 8 hours in the hotel you should go home!). Very clean, professional and generally (owing to the time of travel) not too expensive. Amsterdam is likely the best people watching city, with the Dutch some of the nicest and most friendly people we have met. I would go back in a heart beat. the tour books correctly state that while Amsterdam is a small city it is very compact and full of attractions. the Tulip market is at the door of the Jolly and is wonderful and not to be missed. When I arrived (about 5 hours after my wife) she had adorned the room with two dozen white roses and 100 red tulips!!! And all for about 20 euros. After long meetings it was the most welcome site I have seen. The beer is cold, the staff professional, and the Italian resturant (in the hotel) has some of the best service and food we have experienced (and owing to the calibre affordable). Kids listen to me with the cost of direct flights (inexpensvie) and the efficiency of the airport (the best I have seen and I have been in many), the Dutch hospitality (very friendly to Canadians) and very efficient transportation, go to Amsterdam and forget LA, Vancouver or Toronto! Just for a simple example I spent $47 CAD to go to the airport (from Mississauga) and spend 3.70 EUR from Central Station (Amsterdam) to the airport. Great city, good hotel and if you want to do it economy it can be really affordable. go and do it soon.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel and city”
Reviews.Author: jodean1979
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Jolly Carlton Hotel which was just near the floating flower market. The hotel was 4* but would probably rate it 3* in England but clean, comfortable and tidy with friendly staff. The city is very clean and pleasant to walk around. The transport system is the best trams, bikes and canal buses being very popular to travel on. We walked most places though but did by a canal bus ticket which was fairly expensive but worth it as we spent nearly a full day just going up and down the different canals as they offer a different perspective on the city and you can take it on at your own pace rather than getting caught up in the pace of other tourists. The city has become extremely commercialised. The squares are much like Spain, in respect of the bars, like Irish bars etc. Not at all like Paris where they have not embraced the tourist but expected the tourist to embrace their city, which I personally preferred. The Red Light District is not at all what you would expect. Unless you go down the smaller side streets then perhaps this is where it all happens but as I was with my partner we did not do this we just stuck to the main streets where tourists were walking even with younger children in some groups so that shows how tame it actually is for some. There is a lot of pick pocketing signs so be careful with your money. Even though we were not a victim of this crime I can imagine it is quite common as at the busy markets there are a lot of people just pushing past you. Money - The exchange rate is ok for the UK and exchanging your Â£ to Euros in the UK is great too and free, but in Amsterdam the commission was around 8% which is 1% too much for me so we just drew money from the cash points I would suggest you do the same if your bank offers you this service for free like ours as it is rare for shops, bars etc to credit cards be it Visa or MasterCard etc, they like their cash only system it would seem. Also beware of early flights as check in times for hotels are 2pm like most but flights to Amsterdam tend to be early morning arrivals for connections. I would definitely recommend you visit Amsterdam as it is a nice place.

Reviews.Title: “safe bet”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Finding a hotel for a group of six friends was a bit stresslful as none of us had been to Amsterdam before. Jolly Hotel Carlton was a very centrally located. Right near the flower market we were able to walk to the Leidslpien, Dam Square, Red Light District and any other sights we vistited. Trams are right out in front of the hotel but our group of New Yorkers are used to walking and had no problems getting where we needed to go by foot. The hotel was pricey at $190 a night for a double room but recommended if this price fits your budget- the rooms were nice, bathrooms were a bit small but fine and the concierge was helpful with all of our questions. It wasn't the most luxiurious hotel in Amsterdam but for the price I felt it was worth it. We only opted to pay for the 12 Euro breakfast on our last day - you can get a better meal at any cafe around with a better atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Location!”
Reviews.Author: Rubik000
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed three nights in this hotel in March. We were very satisfied: - Great Location: just next to the flower market, 5 minute walk to Dam Square. A tram station is about a block away. - Great room: good size and decoration. - Service: Very friendly staff. - Good value: We payed close to 100 Euro and we feel it was worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Very Jolly indeed”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Scored a last minute deal on this hotel - 80 euro for a regular room. Requested upgrade on arrival and although initial quote was 50 euro, the clerk then advised that it would be only 25 euro. Was given a large room on the top floor of the hotel. Very large balcony with lovely view of local area. Great location - in walking distance to just about everything and tram outside the door. Great facilities - large bathroom, comfortable bed, cable and good size room. Breakfast was only 12 euro for all-you-can-eat (hot food included). Staff were friendly and helpful at all times. Excellent value for the price and was very happy with the hotel. Would recommend upgrade, though. Regardless, would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Upgrade to Suite”
Reviews.Author: Memphisman
Reviews.Content: The ordinary rooms are small by American standards but OK for a night or two. My wife and I spent an extra 50 Euros per day for an upgrade to a very large suite with a fantastic view because we were there for six nights in March, 2005. Our bumpout windows on the 5th floor overlooked the Flower Market and Canal, the 400-year-old Mint Tower and a Piccadilly Circus-like convergence of several busy streets and tram lines. Buffet breakfast was very good and staff helpful. Within 100 yards of McDonald's, many eat-in/takeout food places and wide range of shops. Less than a mile to nearly all major museums and other attractions. But beware the sauce-free, tasteless, Italian pizzas.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location, staff really kind and helpful and for a mere 50euro per night we were upgraded to beautiful deluxe room with breathtaking view from the balcony(see photo enclosed), huge marble bathroom with bathrobes the complete works!!!! A memorable weekend due to hotel, will definately come back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: danmar169
Reviews.Content: The very best thing about the Jolly Carlton is the location - it is central to pretty much everything with excellent restaraunts (we'd recommend the Tujuh Market for lovely Indonesian food and d'Vijff Vlieghen for an atmospheric location with exceptional cooking) very close by and all the major sights an easy walk away. The hotel is clean, staff friendly (we had no problems to raise and found the staff - particualrly the two doormen- very polite and helpful), and the breakfast buffet was good though the the cafe bar is expensive and there are much nicer bars and cafes within five minutes walk. The room decor is a bit dated but was in good repair and the room was spacious. Ask for a room higher up and on the canal side for lovely views...

Reviews.Title: “Great Location But Ask for a Superior Room”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Got to the Jolly Hotel late Thursday night and was very disappointed with the Standard Double Room we were given, which was on the small side and the bed was not a full-sized double. However, we decided to pay to upgrade to a superior room at an extra cost of 25 Euros per night, which was well worth it. The room was large and the width of the bathroom probably the same size as the original standard room we had been given!! The location of the hotel is fantastic - you can walk to most places which is great. Would definitely stay there again, but would ensure that we booked a superior room to start with!!

Reviews.Title: “Satisfied with the Jolly experience!”
Reviews.Author: Grch
Reviews.Content: Just like some previous reviewers who have read prior negative reviews, I thought briefly about cancelling our reservations- but it was too late and cancelling would have been costly so I decided to make a go of it. If anyone else who is reading this is in the same position- I can assure you, no worries, the experience was just fine. I did email ahead of time after reading the reviews to confirm a nonsmoking room preferably on the top floor with a balcony and view. I received an email msg within the next 12 hrs stating that they had put my request through but could not guarantee anything. Upon arrival at 2pm, our room was ready, and sure enough, they had given us a wonderful room on the 6th floor with a breathtaking view of the clock tower and the rest of Amsterdam below. Granted, we had asked for a queen bed and we got 2 twin beds, but fortunately we are not overweight so it was not a huge deal. The room was of avg size, the bathroom was avg- a towel warmer in place but not working. The service was very courteous and helpful- not at all rude as reported in prior reviews. The doormen showed us personally where to park the car and helped us store our luggage after we checked out to pick up later in the day. Parking is in a very secure garage (in fact, we were not given keys to it- only the doorman could let us in) and is 35 Euros a day. The location is Jolly's biggest asset- on the same street as the "floating" flower market- so very convenient to everything- we walked everywhere with ease.... you can't beat this hotel when it comes to it's location and reasonable price. I agree to some extent with prior reviews, the Jolly is not a 4 star hotel by American standards (more like a 3 star), but probably by Amsterdam standards it is a 4 star, and certainly was a pleasurable experience. It's hard for me to quote a reasonable price- we paid 149 Euros/nt for our room... I probably would recommend not paying much more than that. Overall, a very satisfying experience!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel, clean and well maintained, helpful and cheery staff, great location. Highly recomended.

Reviews.Title: “top class”
Reviews.Author: Rachaelbgreen
Reviews.Content: reading reviews of jolly carlton and i can't believe it is the same hotel we stayed in a few months ago. room was exceptional with separate kitchen area and beautiful bathroom and even dressing room. we found service exceptional and are in the process of booking our next visit to jolly carlton! can't wait to visit again, definately recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I would 100% recommend this hotel. Great location, clean, safe, affordable!

Reviews.Title: “Jolly much better than Victoria”
Reviews.Author: spanner42
Reviews.Content: Booked this Hotel through Expedia, then read these reviews and panicked slightly. Stayed at the Victoria in July, and this was way better. We arrived too early to check in to our room, but the receptionist was friendly, gave us a map of Amsterdam, and a guide booklet, and the concierge kept our bags for us. When we returned a few hours later, the same receptionist remembered us. The room wasn't brilliant, but we loved it. It was exceptionally clean, nicely decorated and although not huge, there was plenty of room, and storage.We had no room safe, not the adverstised slippers, but there was an abundance of towels, shampoos etc. Also, there were tea/ coffee making facilities at no extra charge. Queries that we raised were dealt with promptly and with a nice attitude, and breakfast was good. The mini bar prices were not excessive. The room was not soundproofed to the traffic, but this was not noisy enough to be a problem. As a frequent visitor to Amsterdam, this would be on my list for hotels to visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, excellent hospitality!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Jolly for the weekend, so glad we picked this hotel. Location was fantastic beside the floating Flower Market. Taking the tram was easy, only about 5 mins to Central Station and to Leiseplain. Walking to the Old Side and Chinatown was a pleasant 15 minutes through the main shopping street in the City. Good choice of fast food and decent restaurants in the area. We arrived early but were allowed to check in the room. The hotel upgraded us, at no extra charge, to a lovely superior room on the top floor with a balcony and a nice view of the city. Not spacious but the room was clean, modern and I believe recently renovated in 2003. We would definitely stay again on our next trip.

Reviews.Title: “My view..”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Ive been on Holidays many times, and i always try to read some sort of review beforehand to hopefully clear up any worries. I personally believe that alot of the complaining has been, and i dont mean to cause any offence. from Americans. (this goes for nearly every hotel resort ive been to). what people complain about is so petty and meaningless. "oh the decor wasnt to my taste" etc.. or a paid 60Euros a night for a meal i didnt like..well go out to a resturant theres plenty of them in amsterdam! theres a Mcdonalds across the street. what made me more worried about my holiday was this complaining, i was so excited then listening to all these negative comments really dragged me down, i'd just spent Â£600 on this holiday as a suprise for my man, and had a made the biggest mistake?! sheer panic struck, but as soon as we arrived the panic melted away, if your expecting a big cheesy american grin and the "have a nice day!" go to america, this is europe. the girls on the front desk work hard, and probably into the early hours of the morning. basically what im trying to say is if your expecting the ritz go to the ritz. if your expecting a nice safe hotel room in a beautiful area go to the jolly.

Reviews.Title: “Not user-friendly”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just responding to a rave review - I found the staff to be pretentious and cold. Generally disinterested. The cafe personnel were even worse. The bellman was also incompetent. The rooms are adequate, except the single I was in (non-opening windows and local Thai cuisine...). The location is great (at the floating bulb vendors, near major art, and the Red Light District), and the prices are reasonable. I won't be back.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel at a great location”
Reviews.Author: bowmore
Reviews.Content: Stayed several times at this hotel. Here my pros & cons: + great location + rooms on the top floor (some of them have a balcony with a nice view, they also seem larger than others) + nice buffet breakfast - staff is not very friendly - some rooms are very small & smelly Overall not the greatest hotel, but thanks to its location still a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Jolly Hotel - avoid this place!!!”
Reviews.Author: Wayfarer64
Reviews.Content: I recently had the misfortune of staying at this hotel. At 4-star prices, I received 1-star service from a management staff I can only describe as cold, rude and uncarring of client requests/concerns. A miscommunication over the hotel's online booking system left me with a much larger bill than expected and when I made repeated requests (via e-mail after leaving Holland)for clarification, all of my requests went unanswered. Moreover, I paid for expensive breakfasts I didn't eat and wasn't aware I was being charged for (If you do stay here be very vigilant about your billing!!). When I inquired about getting a rebate for meals that I didn't eat, my inquiry went unanswered. Any other 4-star hotel I've stayed at would have at very least offered responses to my concerns. Even a simple "sorry, sir, there's little we can do..." would have sufficed. Amsterdam has numerous 3/4-star hotel choices that far surpass the Jolly in price and service, so I highly urge readers of this to look elsewhere for a room. And a suggestion to the hotel management: you and your staff are in dire need of public relations skills training. You have much to learn about the hotel business. I hope your head office is reading this.

Reviews.Title: “We have been treated better in a 2 star hotel.”
Reviews.Author: PigsEar1
Reviews.Content: Four of us were in Amsterdam for a weekend break. We were supposed to arrive on the Fri night, but due to Air Traffic probs, we were 3 hours late, arriving at the hotel at 12.30am. We had pre-booked 3 months ago and paid in full for 2 rooms, only to be told on our arrival that the rooms had been given to someone else.We were told this was tough luck & at no time was an apology given.We were put in a taxi to another hotel at the other end of town, which the taxi driver could not find (you would think the Jolly would have given him directions) & finally got to our rooms at 3.00am.The next day, we commenced our siteseeing feeling extremely tired. Upon our return to the alternative hotel for lunch, we were locked out of our rooms and told this was because the Jolly hotel had only paid for one night & had just called to ask that we be sent back to the Jolly Hotel. We then had to pack again, and suffer another taxi ride across Amsterdam, effectively losing most of the afternoon. On arrival at the Jolly, we were given a room upgrade, which was fine, but did not make up for the fact we had lost at least half a day of a one and a half day trip (result of not getting up early because of late check-in & being sent back to Jolly). The excuse used by the hotel was they had problems with their system. This is hard to believe as surely a hotel should only accept payment/ money for the number of rooms in their hotel and no more? We were travelling with my mum & her sister, who were both on their first trip abroad at the age of 70 - I fear that as a result of the problems, this will have been their first and last trip. Added to the above probs, the bar staff were rude and arrogant and the service poor. I put our drinks on the room tab and when I had to sign for it, I could not understand what to write and where as it was all in Dutch. The bar man proceeded to ridicule me in front of other customers. He could obviously speak good English, so all he need to say was 'please print you name here'. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone and have had better holidays staying in Youth Hostels.

Reviews.Title: “Jolly Jolly Joy Joy...”
Reviews.Author: manlaw
Reviews.Content: Just came back from a 5 night stay at the Jolly Carlon Hotel. Excellent hotel in a great location. Room was perfect, nicely decorated, very comfy bed and huge bathtub - especially nice after spending the day walking all over town. Location is excellent, literally 10 minutes to everything. Trams stop right around the corner from the hotel and run everywhere. I only took the tram once but that's because I enjoy walking. The stroll up the main shopping street around the corner from the hotel to Dam square is so intoxicating, full of life and culture. After reading some other reviews I was somewhat skeptical, but ended up being pleasantly surprised with everything! I stayed at the Victoria last time I vistited which does not even come close in comparison to the Jolly. I would definitely stay here again and reccommend it highly.

Reviews.Title: “overpriced, average but not outstanding for what was expected”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: after reading the reviews in tour books I expected more from this 4 star hotel. It was average in size. the staff were average in their ability to help. the location was average. for the same price the Krasnopolsky was a better location. the breakfast was excellent and the restaurant staff were great. the room was clean but there was cheap construction of wood that was like a guitar for the nyophitos only. in conclusion it was your big ,generic , average hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A 2-Star Motel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel has the most obnoxious and un-professional manager that I have ever seen. Arrived early but rooms were not ready till noon. Every other sentence from the manager was "If you don't like it, you can go to another hotel" Last time I heard this kind of thing was when I was back packing in Europe staying at youth hostels. Got stuck in a broken elevator for 20+ minutes. Manager's response: "you were in the wrong elevator" Later he said "this kind of things happens ...it is not our fault.." Rooms were small and the interiors not well maintained. We paid through Priceline. Might be worth it if you can pay $50. The rest of the staff was generally good and sympathetic, though.

Reviews.Title: “A hotel to return to.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Jolly Hotel from 3rd April until 8th April 2004. The staff and the hotel were excellent nothing was to much trouble. We were given a room upgrade on arrival at no extra cost. The restaurant Caruso is superb and the staff first class and the food out of this world for taste and selection,well worth a number of visits to try the different meals on offer. My wife and I will return again later in 2004. This was our first visit to Amsterdam a combination of staying at the Jolly hotel and a beautiful city and friendly people will ensure that we return in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “Not that Jolly...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We booked 3 nights in a deluxe room with breakfast for ?95 per night...the room itself was lovely, fab bathroom but if, like me, you are booking this hotel for the whirlpool bath, you'll be disappointed! The baths have not worked for the past 3 yrs although some websites still state that they are in every room. Also the staff were pretty rude to us, we asked for room service at 10.30pm on a sunday night and were laughed at. Not really a 4* I'd say, but you can't beat the location.

HotelInfo.Name: NH Carlton Amsterdam
HotelInfo.Address: Vijzelstraat 4, Amsterdam 1017 HK, The Netherlands
